name: Sunny Artist Loft In Historic Brownstone
summary: Sunny artist loft in our Victorian brownstone, located 3 miles from downtown Boston, in Roxbury. The apartment is located on our third floor (walk up) and features an open, airy floor plan with exposed brick (600 sq ft). Perfect for a relaxing Boston getaway and easy access to most attractions.
space: Beautiful, open, sunny loft - 3 miles south of downtown. Easy access to public transportation, major highways, airport, hospitals, convention center, museums, colleges and universities... The apartment is very well appointed, - it features a large spa bathroom with soaking tub and rain shower. We offer a fully stocked kitchen with gas range, farm sink, coffee maker, blender... Have any questions? Ask us! Special requests? Let us know!
description: Sunny artist loft in our Victorian brownstone, located 3 miles from downtown Boston, in Roxbury. The apartment is located on our third floor (walk up) and features an open, airy floor plan with exposed brick (600 sq ft). Perfect for a relaxing Boston getaway and easy access to most attractions. Beautiful, open, sunny loft - 3 miles south of downtown. Easy access to public transportation, major highways, airport, hospitals, convention center, museums, colleges and universities... The apartment is very well appointed, - it features a large spa bathroom with soaking tub and rain shower. We offer a fully stocked kitchen with gas range, farm sink, coffee maker, blender... Have any questions? Ask us! Special requests? Let us know! Key-pad entry at front door entrance - third floor, walk up apartment. On street parking (always available). Cable TV, wifi, Netflix, Bluetooth speaker system, VHS and wacky video library! We prefer to greet guests upon arrival (we live in the apartment below). We'
neighborhood_overview: Roxbury is one of the oldest areas of Boston with some of the most gorgeous examples of Victorian architecture. It is an urban, multicultural and economically diverse community. There are lots of little parks in the neighborhood - a surprising amount of green space for an urban setting. Located one street parallel to Blue Hill Ave (a main thoroughfare), you will find bodegas, locally owned restaurants, and most conveniences. Slushies on the corner! Delicious Dominican fare down the street! African cuisine one block over! We've lived in this neighborhood for over a decade - supporting our community and local businesses is very important to us - Roxbury is a gem of the city.
notes: We are both working artists and makers. We especially enjoy hosting other artists, makers, movers and shakers. We enjoy the local music scene, art galleries and institutions, and the LGBTQ scenes and events in the city. We are local and organic food enthusiasts - there is a farmers market that sets up on the corner every Thursday, from May to November. All produce is grown in the community and proceeds go back to the community.
transit: Dudley station is .7 miles from the house. From there, you can get to just about anywhere in 30-45 mins by bus or Silver Line. We provide schedules and maps and can always advise on best routes. Boston is a small walkable city for the adventurous - there are also conveniently placed Hubway bike rental stations very near the house.
access: Key-pad entry at front door entrance - third floor, walk up apartment. On street parking (always available). Cable TV, wifi, Netflix, Bluetooth speaker system, VHS and wacky video library!
interaction: We prefer to greet guests upon arrival (we live in the apartment below). We'll check in as much or as little as you like. We're available at all times for questions or concerns.
house_rules: We ask that guests leave the apartment in the condition that they found it. (No need to make the bed, but please do your own dishes and put things away. This helps us keep costs down so we don't need to charge an additional cleaning fee).  We request that any additional visitors, (friends coming into the unit who were not part of the initial booking) be kept to a minimum and cleared with us first.
host_about: Artist, woodworker, fabricator of stuff!

Furnished with 3-4 real beds plus a convertible . It can sleep 3 with private room, or 8 with double occupancy per bed, including two on the sofa bed( except #2 T-2). This is a 4 story building with three identical units on the 2nd (T-2) , 3rd (T-3) and 4th (T-4)floor. T-3 and T-4 each has 2 king sized beds , a full sized bed and sofa bed. (T-4) has a twin bed under the Full bed ( called Trundle) Super convenient location near two subway stations and  many universities , Longwood Medical , Copley square and Fenway park. Restaurants , shops are all within walking distance. This historical building does not have elevator.

neighborhood_overview: One of the trendiest neighborhoods in Boston, the lower South End is a vibrant, exciting place for city travelers, families, or anyone looking for a good time in Boston.  Located next to Northeastern University we have had the pleasure of many families and parents stay with us to be near their relatives going to school in NEU.  We are literally steps away from Ruggles subway and bus terminal and also just a few minutes walk from Northeastern Green E Line station making cars completely unnecessary.  You can get anywhere by public transportation here. Walking distance to many such as Symphony Hall, Newbury St, Copley Sq, historic South End and many fancy sit down Restaurants. First floor Chinese food and immediate area Subway, Thai food and pizza
notes: Universities and convention center and hospital stays and Red Sox games are the most popular highlights.
transit: Only about 5 minutes walk to the Ruggles station and 10 minutes walk to E line at Northeastern Univ Station. Ruggles station 1 St floor is also a major bus terminal Go to Down town, Grove Hall, Harvard Square , MIT BU  South Bay Shopping Center, Franklin Park Zoo and Golf, Copley to name a few.
access: We have all password entrance , you can enter your self at any time after check in time. No key to pick up. Be sure text me the day before your check in date to get your pass code
interaction: As often as you need before or after you check in. I am available anytime, feel free to call during day or text at night.   Please always text with (T-2, T-3 or T4) unit no and check in date for quicker response.
house_rules: - No late night party, no loud music,  no smoking inside the unit.  Please clean your cigarette butts and do not litter on the sidewalk. - No overnight guests allowed without permission - No candles, firecrackers or any flammable or hazardous material allowed at any time in or outside the property. - Guests must always clean the dryer filter after each use.  - No overnight guests allowed without permission  -Put regular trash in BLACK bins only. Do not put in BLUE bins!  -BLUE bins can take glass or metal only. Nothing else. -Do not put food or anything else down the sink garbage disposal or drains.  Dispose of all leftover food in the trash containers and bag it and throw it into the outside trash cans please.  The garbage disposal is not a trash disposal and will be jammed. -Do not put anything down the toilets except for small quantities of toilet paper.  Do not put dental floss, tampons, sanitary pads, or anything else down the toilet, it will be jammed if you do.

name: BEAUTIFUL BOSTON BROWNSTONE
summary: This beautifully renovated condo is quintessential Boston in a fabulous location with wide open floor plan, high ceilings, gorgeous moldings, white quartz kitchen, top of the line stainless appliances, marble bath and high end electronics in each room including a 60" high def TV - Welcome Home!
space: We just completed a stunning top to bottom renovation of this beautiful brownstone last year located in the heart of Boston on the Back Bay/South end line.  Wide open living, dining and kitchen with gorgeous refinished original wide pine floors, dramatic 11 foot ceilings with refinished original moldings, exposed brick throughout, brand new top of the line stainless refrigerator, 5 burner gas stove, built in microwave drawer and white custom kitchen cabinets with white quartz countertop and backsplash. Kitchen is fully stocked with everything needed and a gorgeous marble bathroom stocked with hotel quality bath towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash and blow dryer. There are 2 bedrooms - one master with king size bed and one smaller bedroom with exposed brick and daybed that pulls out to a king. Both have gorgeous new bedding. We have installed high definition flat screens in each bedroom including a 60" flat screen Sony in the living area and each room has high efficiency remote cont
description: This beautifully renovated condo is quintessential Boston in a fabulous location with wide open floor plan, high ceilings, gorgeous moldings, white quartz kitchen, top of the line stainless appliances, marble bath and high end electronics in each room including a 60" high def TV - Welcome Home! We just completed a stunning top to bottom renovation of this beautiful brownstone last year located in the heart of Boston on the Back Bay/South end line.  Wide open living, dining and kitchen with gorgeous refinished original wide pine floors, dramatic 11 foot ceilings with refinished original moldings, exposed brick throughout, brand new top of the line stainless refrigerator, 5 burner gas stove, built in microwave drawer and white custom kitchen cabinets with white quartz countertop and backsplash. Kitchen is fully stocked with everything needed and a gorgeous marble bathroom stocked with hotel quality bath towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash and blow dryer. There are 2 bedrooms - one ma
neighborhood_overview: Our brownstone is on the South End Back Bay line with easy access to literally everything Boston has to offer. We are a 5 minute walk to Copley, Prudential, Symphony Hall, Newbury St and a 12 minute walk to Fenway Park. We have the train on our block and the bus line across the street. We are in the midst of amazing restaurants, shopping, museums, world class Universities and hospitals. This is the perfect city location!
notes: We chose to save and refinish the original wide pine floors - we would greatly appreciate if guests  would remove shoes that may damage the floors once entering the unit - especially high heels - pine is a naturally soft wood. Thank you!
transit: Train is on our block - bus line across the street - walking distance to most everything - can't get much easier than that!
access: There are 3 units in our brownstone - we live in the bottom triplex, this unit is above us and our other Airbnb property is above this unit - the penthouse. Guests have full access to their unit and both units share the entrance and foyer. We have a separate  entrance to our living space. We also rent both units together for parties up to 8 guests!
interaction: We own the building and also live in the bottom triplex. We are accessible as often or as little as guest require.
house_rules: No smoking or parties and be respectful of upstairs guests and neighbors. I do not allow more than 4 guests to stay overnight in this unit.
host_about:
Hello fellow AirBNB members! 

I started on Airbnb with "Gorgeous Cape Cod" property in May 2015, listed our renovated "Stunning South End Back Bay Penthouse" in August 2015, and listed our newly renovated "Beautiful Boston Brownstone" in August 2016. We also just launched both Boston units together for larger parties - "Luxury Brownstone Penthouse Duplex"! 

I have been successfully renting the Cape Cod home for over 15 years and was a landlord before we converted to condos here in Boston 10 years prior to that.

I promise you I am extremely accommodating to all of my guests. I make sure everything is perfect on arrival and I am accessible whenever needed. In fact, we received Superhost status every single quarter since we began (we have more than 150 5 star reviews)!

Aside from hosting, I am an advertising executive in Boston, I am married to David, my partner in life and all things real estate and mother to our wonderful daughter, Adria, who is a rising senior at Northwestern University in Chicago.

I am enjoying meeting new and interesting people from around the world through Airbnb and making sure I provide the highest quality experience possible for all of my guests.

Thank you for taking the time to view my listings and hope to hear from you!

Warmest regards

Sue

neighborhood_overview: Peaceful, quiet residential neighborhood with professionals and their families as your neighbors.   Only about 5 minutes walk to the local park, zoo and golf, the supermarket shopping mall is only 5 min walk away there is a Dunkin Donuts, CVS, library, postal service, and bank.  There is a nearby bus stop 4 min walk away that has 6 bus lines running, you can transfer to the Silver Line at Dudley station or the Orange Line at Ruggles or Red Line at Fields Corner.   There are plentiful local restaurants you can sample Boston cuisine at.
notes: There is a large sized backyard perfect for relaxation or barbecue with beautiful flowers and fruit (Please do not pick or cut the flowers. They are there for viewing only)  Each unit has its own private entrance and deck. Long term stay can be discussed upon request.  Rates subject to change without notice.
transit: Very convenient on public transportation. 8 bus lines and two train stations ( one mile to Red line at Fields Corner, half mile to Four Corner/Geneva commuter rail)
access: Shops, parks zoo and golf less than 10 minutes walk Beaches: 1.5 miles to 2 miles in South Boston  South Bay Shopping Center 1.5 miles Brigham Circle 2.5 miles South End 2 miles Copley Square 3.8 miles near by Universities: MIT, BU, Harvard Medical School. Northeastern Univ, Went worth Univ. Mass College of Arts, Mass College of Pharmacy, Simmon College, Emanuel College. Berkeley  Down town Boston 4 miles  Museum of Fine Arts and Fenway Park, 3 miles
interaction: I can be available to welcome you on the check in date and I will provide a phone number you can text or call me during daytime for any questions you may have.
house_rules: - Quiet Hours during night time, no disturbances, loud music, parties or anything that would disturb the peace.  This is a quiet family neighborhood. - No wild parties or gatherings allowed.  Only small, civilized gatherings allowed if owner grants permission only. - No late night party, no loud music, no smoking inside the unit. Please clean your cigarette butts and do not litter on the sidewalk.  - No candles, firecrackers or any flammable or hazardous material allowed at any time in or outside the property. - Guests must always clean the dryer filter after each use. - No overnight guests allowed without permission  -Put regular trash in BLACK bins only. Do not put in BLUE bins!  -BLUE bins can take glass or metal only. Nothing else. -Do not put food or anything else down the sink garbage disposal or drains.  Dispose of all leftover food in the trash containers and bag it and throw it into the outside trash cans please.  The garbage disposal is not a trash disposal and will be jammed

neighborhood_overview: Enjoy Boston from this centrally located spacious in the city's most historic neighborhood: The South End is truly a cosmopolitan neighborhood. It is just minutes away from Downtown and the Back Bay, and has recently become one of the City’s most popular neighborhoods. The area’s main streets are Tremont Street, Columbus Avenue, and Mass Avenue. Here you’ll find the area’s renowned Victorian brownstone buildings. There are nearly 30 parks in the area. It’s also home to a thriving arts community and some of the best restaurants in Boston. Boston's most vibrant community. This tree-lined neighborhood is known for its fine dining, art galleries, the open market, and smiling faces. The South End is worth taking the time to explore. One of Boston’s most beautiful neighborhoods, and one of its most culturally diverse. A little history: Developed in the mid-19th century to relieve overcrowding in downtown Boston and Beacon Hill, the neighborhood was originally a narrow strip of land, surround

name: Modern living in a conveniently located brownstone
summary: 750 sq ft of recently renovated contemporary living space. Our 1 bedroom, 1 bath brownstone is located on beautiful Fort Hill near John Eliot Square, convenient to Hospitals and Universities and a 5 minute walk to the Roxbury Crossing T stop. Bright, open, clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. Baseboard heat. New queen size Casper mattress. Perfect for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Kitchenette includes mini fridge, griddle, toaster oven, microwave, coffeemaker, etc.
space: This 1890 brick building has many period details inside and out. The unit available for rent is the basement apartment which was completely renovated in April, 2016. The stairs are narrow so use caution when descending with your baggage.
description: 750 sq ft of recently renovated contemporary living space. Our 1 bedroom, 1 bath brownstone is located on beautiful Fort Hill near John Eliot Square, convenient to Hospitals and Universities and a 5 minute walk to the Roxbury Crossing T stop. Bright, open, clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. Baseboard heat. New queen size Casper mattress. Perfect for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Kitchenette includes mini fridge, griddle, toaster oven, microwave, coffeemaker, etc. This 1890 brick building has many period details inside and out. The unit available for rent is the basement apartment which was completely renovated in April, 2016. The stairs are narrow so use caution when descending with your baggage. Guests will have access to the entire 750 sq ft apartment as well as an outdoor brick sitting area, approximately 125 sq ft Guests can easily reach us at any time via phone or text. Upon arrival, there is a secure lockbox with keys to access the space. There is a
neighborhood_overview: Historic Fort Hill is an established and quiet neighborhood. John Eliot Square, site of the oldest wooden church in Boston, is adjacent to our place. There is a convenience store across the street from the building. Dudley Square is a ten minute walk. Fort Hill is one of the oldest areas in Boston. The area is well lit and we've had no safety issues with our guests. Fort Hill has become quite gentrified with a mix of older, life long residents, medical professionals from nearby hospitals as well as students from bordering universities. There is usually on street parking in front of the building.
notes: We take pride in our property and neighborhood and expect our guests to treat our space as they would their own. A new queen size Casper mattress and box spring as well as new linens and comforter was set up on October 2017.
transit: The Roxbury Crossing T stop (Orange Line) is a 10 minute walk as is the Southwest Corridor (walk and bike trail) with access to Boston's Back Bay (25 minute walk to the Prudential Center) Boston is a very walkable city. You can walk to Northeastern University, Fenway Park, Symphony Hall, Children's Hospital, Dana Farber, the Museum of Fine Arts and the Isabella Stewart Gardiner Museum in about 20 minutes.
access: Guests will have access to the entire 750 sq ft apartment as well as an outdoor brick sitting area, approximately 125 sq ft
interaction: Guests can easily reach us at any time via phone or text. Upon arrival, there is a secure lockbox with keys to access the space. There is a 5 Highland "ambassador" (tenants on the second floor) that will be available to help with anything you may need or any questions. See instructions and pictures on entering the building and apartment.
house_rules: - Quiet building and neighborhood, no loud parties. - Please leave the space as you found it  - Absolutely no smoking indoors.  - Please leave the keys in the lockbox when you leave
host_about: We are a couple from North Andover MA that own two brownstones in Boston. We renovated space in one of the buildings to use as a "crash pad" when we go to the city and make it available for Airbnb guests when we are not using it. We are parents of three sons and have four grandchildren.

house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: 1 Bedroom Unit - South End / Fenway / Back Bay
summary: This charming one bedroom unit is located in the heart of Boston´s art and cultural district right at the border of Back Bay/South End/Fenway neighbohoods. You will be at walking distances from:  Fenway Park,  Symphony Hall, Northeast University, Christian Science Plaza, Museum of Fine Arts, Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, Kelleher Rose Garden, The Emerald Necklace Conservancy, Berklee College of Music, Theaters, New England Conservatory´s Jordan Hall, Boston Conservatory, and much more.
space: The 1 bedroom is on the lower level of the building with the option of two entrance into the building and access to the apartment: front of the building, right at Massachusetts avenue or back of the building with easy access to the parking space or the subway station or Mass Ave.  Parking in Boston is a challenge. The unit itself does not have a dedicated parking space, however, the space right in the back of the building can be rented using the app SpotHero (there is a website with the same name) after the name. You can check availability by searching on the app or the website for the address of the unit. The search will let you know if the space is available or not.  (ask us the address if you are interested). Even if the space is not available, the app will show other options close to the property and those parking prices are usually lower than any parking garage in the vicinity.   Please note, this charming unit is well decorated on the lower level with two windows on the living ro

neighborhood_overview: The unit is located in the heart of Boston´s art and cultural district right at the border of Back Bay/South End/Fenway neighbohoods.  You will be at walking distances from: Symphony Hall, Christian Science Plaza, Museum of Fine Arts, Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, Kelleher Rose Garden, The Emerald Necklace Conservancy, Berklee College of Music, Theaters, New England Conservatory´s Jordan Hall, Boston Conservatory, and, of course, the famous Fenway Park.  The Cultural District taps in to the creativity and high energy of a neighborhood that is home to universities, colleges, and some of Boston’s most exciting performing and visual arts institutions.
notes: The 1 bedroom unit is located on the lower part of the building. There is a flight of stairs down to the back of the building. Once you are there, you can use the back door of the building to get in/out with easy access to the subway station next door.
transit: Boston is America´s walking city. However, you will be located right by the Massachusetts Avenue subway/Metro stop on the Orange Line and 5 minutes walking to the Symphony stop on the Green Line. The number 1 bus stops right across from the unit and takes you directly to Harvard University or MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology) and hundreds of other attractions and points of interess.  You will not find an more convenient place to stay and get around Boston.
access: Please note: the washer and dryer are coin operated. Only quarters (0.25 cents coins) are accepted. The washer takes $1.50 and the dryer, 0.75 cents. These machines are located on the same level as the unit by the end of corridor.  We do not have these itens inside the apartment and other people in the building also use the machines.
interaction: Our team is available to help you anytime you need assistance with anything related with your stay. We have 3 phone numbers available to you in case of emergency in the building. We are available 24/7 to help and to answer your questions.  You will receive these numbers once you book a reservation. We speak English and Portuguese. We can also help with some Spanish.

name: 2BR Top Floor Apartment Near T, I-93, Airport
summary: **Please read the WHOLE listing before booking!** 2BR apartment near T, I-93, & airport; on-street parking. 1 BR with a full bed, 1BR with a twin bed, and a couch in the LR. Could sleep up to 4. Awesome café and a grocery store close by. Good for couples, friends, and parents with children. There is a cat on the premises. Please expand & read the detailed description section and house rules below BEFORE booking, to make sure my place is the right fit for you!
space: Great, open, spacious top floor apartment. Beautiful, refinished hardwood floors and new paint. Huge windows and full of sun. City views from the master bedroom window! Tons of public transportation near by, as well as free on-street parking. The common areas in my building, (hall/stairs,) as well as my windows, are older and could use updating, but my apartment is in excellent condition and is well decorated. Please note that my apartment is on the third floor, so you will have to walk up two sets of narrow stairs to get there. There is a window AC in the living room - there is no central AC.

neighborhood_overview: If you are not familiar with Roxbury, or living in a city, please be aware that Roxbury is what some would call a "grittier" neighborhood. It is an inner-urban lower income neighborhood. I've lived here for two years, and have never felt unsafe in my area, even at night. My neighbors are all great. I grew up in Southern California, and I have lived in diverse, multi-cultural areas most of my life. However, because it is a lower income neighborhood, you will see things such as: run down buildings, occasional graffiti, and homeless people panhandling down Melnea Cass Blvd in the warmer months, mostly towards Massachusetts Ave. The building was built in 1899, and the windows need updating, so you will most likely hear noises such as: sirens, (the hospital and police station are both within close proximity,) and music and horns from the cars stopped at the traffic light out front. Occasionally you might hear: music from the unit below, people occasionally yelling outside, the doors closing
notes: Please remember that this is home sharing! My house is clean - but lived in - it will not be like a hotel. There may be stacks of books, kids toys, and occasional other things you will see.  I can't relocate my stuff somewhere else, unfortunately, and sometimes putting something away means putting it neatly to the side. I have an indoor only cat in the house, so if you have allergies or dislike animals, this is probably not the place for you. Cats tend to shed quite a bit, so there will be cat hair, and he will probably want to be in the room with you. (Feel free to shut him out.) There is a litter box in a closet in the hall by the bathroom. If you are not a cat lover - or tolerant of animals - this is probably not the best place for you to stay. Occasionally cats can get sick or have accidents. I sweep constantly, but the cat hair never fully goes away. (Hardwood floors - it just floats around.) If my cat doesn't like how you treat him, or if you scare him, he may hiss or bat at you.
transit: My apartment is an ideal commuter location! The I-93 is right up the road. Silver Line T Stop Melnea Cass @ Washington is a block away, and goes into downtown in about 20-25 minutes, and to the airport in about 40 minutes. Orange line T Stop Ruggles is a 15 minute walk, and can connect you to all other subway lines. Multiple bus stops one block away, including the #1 bus which will take you into Cambridge. Free, on-street parking is usually available, though it may be a little harder during peak workday hours. Zipcar lot right next to Haley House Café. Easy Uber drive into downtown is usually $6-$8 when not surging.
access: Two small but cozy bedrooms. The first has a full sized bed, the second is a child's room and has a twin bed.  Couch in the living room can also be used for sleeping. Small bathroom with bath and shower. Small kitchen with fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. Please provide your own food - I will provide space in the fridge. There is no dishwasher, so please wash your own dishes. The hallway has three large bookshelves full of books - feel free to borrow as long as you return them in the same condition that you find them! Living room area is full of sun, and has a couch, two chairs, a flat screen TV, Amazon Prime and Netflix access and a Blu-ray player. I paint so there is a studio space with a desk in my living room. I respectfully ask that you keep away from the art/art supplies/paintings. Please note that there is no table and chairs for eating meals at.
interaction: I will leave the keys in a lockbox for you for check-in, and save the check-in instructions on Airbnb. I will email you the lockbox code and some information a day or two before you arrive. I am always available via Airbnb messaging for help, questions about the apartment, questions about getting around, as well as for any suggestions in the area. If for any reason I need to enter the apartment while you are there, I will let you know in advance, and check with you to make sure this is okay. If you are there longer than four days, someone will be by to check on and attend to the cats. You are not required to attend to the cats in any way.
house_rules: BY MAKING THIS RESERVATION YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THE FOLLOWING: 1) You will contact me with a check-in time before your arrival. The apartment will most likely not be ready before this time. Don't just show up earlier without contacting me and expect the apartment to be ready. 2) There are NO luggage holds before or after your reservation.  3) You've read the entire listing and are aware that:   - There is a large cat in the home, which means there will be cat hair, a litter box, occasional cat smells, etc.  - There WILL be noise - I live in a low income neighborhood called Roxbury in Boston - There is no closets to hang up clothes, and no drawers to put them in - I'm on the third floor and you must walk up stairs - This is no iron/ironing board/laundry - Check-in is 1pm or later, check-out is by 11am 4) You will respect my belongings and not play with them/go through drawers, or touch my knick knacks and art.  5) You must be self-sufficient enough to follow the check-in instructions, and fi
host_about: My name is Monica, and I absolutely love living in Boston! It is a great city with so much to do. I've lived on both coasts, growing up mostly in Southern California before settling in Boston again three years ago. I'm definitely a city girl at heart! I paint and draw and my walls are covered with art that I did myself, as well as an eclectic collection of other random things. I'm also an avid reader and have three giant bookshelves filled with books. I love museums, music, eating out, beer, and wine.

house_rules: Please do not make a request right away. But send me an email first. Unlike most other Airbnb listings, what we do here is long-term rentals by the year, or by the semester.  We try to keep the atmosphere conducive to studying and resting and a couple of house-rules are in place to this end.  1. Towels and linens (sheets, blankets, and pillows) are NOT provided. The bed is full size. 2. No smoking on the premises.  3. No loud music or TV etc.  4. Only for one person (no couples, no visitors). If you are expecting a guest, please stop here.  5. Check-in time has to be coordinated at least 48 hours ahead. On arrival, a short registration process with a picture ID is needed in exchange for keys and wifi access.  6. Inside the apartment, we take off our outside shoes. So if you bring your own flip-flops, slippers or some kind of indoor shoes, that will be useful. 7. No laundry facility in the house. We use a nearby laundromat.

host_about:
I'm a single father of two adult children, currently an empty nesters, therefore I'm opening my residence again, previously I had international students from Qatar, Syria, and Saudi Arabia that have lived with me and I'm looking forward to continuing the experience of having guest from different states, countries and continents. About me, I'm a American Sign Language interpreter working in the medical field but also who works as a freelance interpreter in other venues. In my free time I'm a traveler I've been to Europe, London, Wales, Scotland, Ireland, Spain, Netherlands, France, Italy, Germany, Austria, Greece, Syria, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Dubai to name just a few. I can't live without Friends, Chocolate, a good book, Traveling, and learning. The number one book of all time is the Bible, I also love mystery books and books about language. I love movies that have a message, of course I'm a super hero fan, comic love, history lover. I love HGTV, music of all genres, and definitely a FOODIE. I like movies, museums, karaoke (:, as well as other things. I'm a spiritual person with strong beliefs, yet I don't push my beliefs on others. I'm overall an easy going person. If you give respect you can expect the same. I'm opening my home to you, so please have and show respect and love, welcome to my home and welcome to Boston, Massachusetts. As a host I'll offer you my home and hope you make yourself at home, most times I'm away working, but you can text and if I'm not with a patient I'll respond. Being that I'm a man I realize that some females may not be comfortable, but in both rooms I've installed alarms on the doors that can be activated as a bell to let you know someone is coming in or as an alarm for security sake. I also remind all that I live in the city and when you're here remember that you are in a city, a city that has diverse people, people of color and various backgrounds. So please be mindful of this, and conduct yourself as such. My life motto: "Is do unto others as you want them to do unto you" it's that simple. Boston is a beautiful city, come play and enjoy. 

I do live on the property and typically am here when guest come.

summary: Living is comfortable in this penthouse apartment in Boston's Fort Hill neighborhood.  With skyline views, ample deck space and a cozy interior all surrounded by parks/green space, this modern brownstone is quiet, well situated and inviting.
space: The house is surrounded by parks and within walking distance or a quick transit ride to everything a visitor to Boston could desire! The space is a private room and comes with access to a shared bath, shared living room, shared kitchen and a private deck for relaxing in the urban oasis. The room contains a double bed, plenty of dresser and closet space, alarm clock with IPhone charger, bedside table, ironing board and luggage rack.
description: Living is comfortable in this penthouse apartment in Boston's Fort Hill neighborhood.  With skyline views, ample deck space and a cozy interior all surrounded by parks/green space, this modern brownstone is quiet, well situated and inviting. The house is surrounded by parks and within walking distance or a quick transit ride to everything a visitor to Boston could desire! The space is a private room and comes with access to a shared bath, shared living room, shared kitchen and a private deck for relaxing in the urban oasis. The room contains a double bed, plenty of dresser and closet space, alarm clock with IPhone charger, bedside table, ironing board and luggage rack. Guests are welcome to use the well equipped kitchen as well as the living room. Walkable to parks and transit, shops and restaur
neighborhood_overview: Walkable to parks and transit, shops and restaurants, this is one of Boston's hippest neighborhoods with every demographic represented.
notes: A kitten, Magnus, became a new member of our family in August 2018.  He resides in the house, though is not allowed in the guest room.
transit: The house is situated about 5 minutes walk from one of Boston's major transit lines (Orange Line).  Transportation access includes a south-west bike path, numerous bus lines as well as some on-street parking for those who have a private automobile.  There is also a bike sharing service available at the local transit station.
access: Guests are welcome to use the well equipped kitchen as well as the living room.
interaction: I'm happy to leave guests to themselves or provide them with extensive knowledge of the area from a historic or touristic perspective.  You may even find me providing a meal on occasion gratis.
house_rules: This is a private home not a hotel.  Guests are treated as members of the family and reciprocal respect and mindfulness are appreciated. Guests should be polite, courteous and respectful. Shoes are removed at the door, slippers will be provided.   This is an environmentally friendly home and guests should be conscious of the environment and conserve resources such as water and other utilities.  For example, twenty-minute long showers are discouraged. Guests seeking to book 5 days or more must have a completed profile, at least three verifications and at least two reviews and/or references.  Exceptions to this policy may be granted individually as warranted.  Please write to inquire. There is no smoking allowed on the property.
host_about:
I live in the city so that I might help preserve open spaces for myself and others to enjoy.  I'm very much a hyper locavore. Better than 95% of the trips I take, the businesses I patronize and the work I accomplish are within 5 miles of my house. This carefully crafted lifestyle allows me to integrate exercise into my daily routine by walking and biking and save huge amounts of time and carbon.  The values expressed though my lifestyle choices are important and made with mindfulness. 

For more detail about how we interact with guests, please read the many wonderful reviews we have received over the years.  We enjoy having the world show up at our door in the form of so many interesting people.

neighborhood_overview: The South End and Back Bay are the premier neighborhoods of Boston with historic Brownstones lining gorgeous streets with shops and restaurants everywhere. This is the ultimate location to experience the best Boston has to offer!
notes: We own and live in this brownstone building and are offering both of these newly renovated upper apartments to larger groups which allows 4 guests in each unit privacy and separate amenities but close proximity as the penthouse is directly above the unit below. We have been offering short term rentals in the penthouse for over a year and the unit below since last August. We have received more than 50  5 star reviews for these 2 units on airbnb and many more from other sources - please take a look and I look forward to hearing from you - Thank you!
transit: The orange line train is on our block as well as the bus line across the street and we are within walking distance to everything in Back Bay the South End and Fenway Park.
access: Guests have full access to the unit and the private roof deck and have a private entrance from the street.
interaction: We are always accessible to our guests and are usually on site to greet arrivals but we respect all of our guests privacy!
house_rules: Penthouse apartment is not suitable for toddlers - apartment below is separate and is suitable for toddlers. Children under 12 are not allowed on the roof deck (for obvious reasons). Smoking is allowed on the roof deck only.
host_about:
Hello fellow AirBNB members! 

I started on Airbnb with "Gorgeous Cape Cod" property in May 2015, listed our renovated "Stunning South End Back Bay Penthouse" in August 2015, and listed our newly renovated "Beautiful Boston Brownstone" in August 2016. We also just launched both Boston units together for larger parties - "Luxury Brownstone Penthouse Duplex"! 

I have been successfully renting the Cape Cod home for over 15 years and was a landlord before we converted to condos here in Boston 10 years prior to that.

I promise you I am extremely accommodating to all of my guests. I make sure everything is perfect on arrival and I am accessible whenever needed. In fact, we received Superhost status every single quarter since we began (we have more than 150 5 star reviews)!

Aside from hosting, I am an advertising executive in Boston, I am married to David, my partner in life and all things real estate and mother to our wonderful daughter, Adria, who is a rising senior at Northwestern University in Chicago.

I am enjoying meeting new and interesting people from around the world through Airbnb and making sure I provide the highest quality experience possible for all of my guests.

Thank you for taking the time to view my listings and hope to hear from you!

Warmest regards

Sue

name: A Victorian Secret AMAZING apt.  in Historic Home
summary: Your own apartment in an historic Victorian house built in the 1800's, while being 10 minutes away from the subway to downtown Boston.  Full of light, lovely views of the city from the many windows.  2 bedrooms, kitchen, living room, dining area, large and stunning bathroom.  Located at the height of the quiet neighborhood of Fort Hill, overlooking Revolutionary War park.  Memorable sunsets!  Free parking in private gated driveway.  Close to Downtown, the Hospitals and Medical Centers.
space: This beautiful apartment was just completely remodeled!  Each of the 2 bedrooms has a queen bed, built-in cabinets and drawers, large bay windows and skylight.  The living area is open style, with comfortable living room, kitchen, dining area, and desk/workspace.  Bathroom has glass-walled shower, full size bathtub, and washer/dryer for your use.   Kitchen includes full-size refrigerator, cooktop, dishwasher, microwave (no oven).  Cookware and utensils, blender, dishes and glasses, silverware all provided.  Cook and serve a beautiful meal!   Living Room includes 40" TV with cable service. The apartment is located on the 3rd floor of our beautiful Civil War era Victorian home.  The house sits on a small tree-lined street, adjacent to Highland Park - an historic hilltop park with an iconic tower commemorating the Revolutionary War fort that was located on the hill (hence, the name Fort Hill).   Guests will have private parking inside our gate.

space: My place is tucked in a little dead end street in Roxbury. It is about a 5m walk to Dudley bus terminal where you can catch a bus to any part of the city. name: Room for up to 4 in Updated 1 BR apt by T!
summary: Enjoy your time in Boston in a century-old brownstone building.  A freshly renovated second floor 1 BR apartment with everything you need to spend a weekend or weeks away from home.  Exceptional convenience to the T (our subway) gives you access to all that Boston and Cambridge have to offer.  Old world charm is the background for a clean space with a new bathroom and updated kitchen.  Room for 4 with a private queen bed and an Ikea couch that converts to a sleeper in the living room.
space: The entire apartment comes off of a fresh renovation.  The kitchen has a new tile floor and concrete counters, a gas range, and plenty of cabinet space.  Living room floor was just sanded and the couch converts to a sleeper for two.  Very large bedroom with a queen bed and spacious closet.

neighborhood_overview: The proximity and accessibility to just about everything in Boston and Cambridge.
notes: $20 per adult per night past two guests.  Kids under 12 incur no additional charge. Three night minimum starting mid-March (St Patrick’s day) and all weekends, though two night stays might be accommodated - feel free to inquire. If you need a Sox or Celtics hookup, the house has a season ticket holder.  Feel free to inquire.
transit: Our subway, affectionately referred to as the T, makes getting around Boston and Cambridge easy without battling for that rare parking space. The house is less than a 5 min walk from the nearest station. 3 stops get you to posh Back Bay, 6 to downtown.  One can walk to the Longwood Medical Area, Northeastern or MFA in 20 minutes or less. Fenway is about a half hour on foot depending on your pace or a very inexpensive uber ride.  For those traveling by car, you can park overnight or 2 hours during the day steps away from the house. Longer daytime parking is about 200 feet away.
access: Gas range Coffee maker Microwave Toaster Dishwasher Disposal Iron/board Wifi
interaction: I live on the street and am usually available in the morning and evening. Just let me know if you need me for anything.
house_rules: - Feel free to smoke in the garden outside the building, but dispose of butts properly to keep our neighbors happy. - Please be respectful of other building residents. - Kindly park your shoes just inside the apartment door during inclement weather. - If you use the kitchen, kindly restore all used items to their original state.  It's fine to leave the dishwasher running - we'll take care of the rest. - 3 night minimum on weekends and during busy season (past April 1).  Two night stays might be accommodated - feel free to inquire.
host_about: 25 year residents of Boston, MA.  We live in the same building as the airbnb space and are happy to share our knowledge of the area, especially the shortcuts for getting around.  We are fans of the Red Sox, Celtics, MFA, Museum of Science, and the exceptional scientific community in the Hub.

name: Stayloom’s Sleek, Stylish Place | near South End
summary: Stayloom is dedicated to giving you a luxurious and authentic travel experience. From the refurbished table to the local artwork, our homes are furnished so every detail has a genuine connection to the surrounding community. Spacious and suitable for groups of all sizes, each Stayloom home is crafted with the intention of bringing family and friends together. Stay in style. Stay for the stories. Stayloom.
space: Located just steps from the subway, this Stayloom condo is perfect for smaller groups looking for a getaway after exploring the city. Designed with the crisp chic and functional comfort of the mid-century modern aesthetic, our home provides a contemporary take on a the classic cool of retro. Our place is the ideal space for groups looking for a first class Boston experience. - Open-concept living and dining space - Comfortably accommodates up to 7 people   - Brand new kitchen equipped with stainless steel appliances, stone surfaces, and essential cookware - 55” inch flat screen SmartTV, central heat and air conditioning, high speed internet - On-street parking  - All beds feature Tempurpedic-quality mattresses and silky, high thread count linens. - All bathrooms are immaculate and include essential toiletries and stacks of plush cotton towels.

neighborhood_overview: While charmingly historic, the Fort Hill neighborhood is pulsing with modern energy. With the South End, Fenway, and Downtown all nearby, Boston’s culinary and cultural scenes are at your fingertips. A dynamic mix of local families, young professionals, and students, Fort Hill has a unique flavor all its own while remaining deeply connected to Boston’s rich history. All guests after booking will receive a personalized list of recommendations including locals favorite spots, restaurants, and activities. We will provide detailed information and guides on the surrounding area to enhance your overall experience.
notes: If you have questions you need answered before securing your booking, or you simply want to talk with us first, reach out to our Stayloom team with an inquiry before a reservation request. Please also note that one-night stays on the weekend or reservations that start or end on a Saturday may be subject to an additional fee. Want more options? Check out Stayloom’s other homes located in popular destinations across the nation such as Boston, Savannah, New Orleans, and more! At Stayloom, we make sure you find the perfect fit. Damage deposit: $250 (non-Airbnb reservations only)
transit: The closest subway stop is less than a ten minute walk away, making the whole city readily accessible within minutes.  The nearest Hubway bicycle rental location is a five minute walk away. There are also several private transportation options at your disposal (Uber, Zipcar). If you do plan on driving, please note that while we do not have off-street parking at our home, there is no shortage of safe, free on-street parking available.
access: The entire home is for your exclusive use.
interaction: You will have complete privacy here, however every question or concern you may have before or during your stay will be promptly addressed via messenger or phone. In the case of a maintenance emergency, our ground team is available to assist you. Entry is simple, there’s no need to coordinate key pick up.
house_rules: - Please respect Boston's noise ordinance. Quiet hours begin at 11:00pm, weekdays & weekends. - Any visit from the local police department will result in immediate eviction without refund.
host_about:
I am a proud member of the Stayloom network! My personal loves include perfecting my Boston clam chowder recipe, traveling as much as I can, and keeping up to date on current events. Part of the joy for me is in providing a platform to let you discover what I love about my two favorite cities. I hope I have the chance to show you Boston and New York's amazing energies and vibrant cultures.

Cheers,
Frank
Stay Heirloom

name: Sunny Spacious South End 2 Bedroom!
summary: Location, location, location!  South End Boston Location right near Northeastern University, Wentworth, Berklee College of Music, Boston Medical Center and more.  A bright spacious apartment with large windows, high ceilings and hardwood floors. Extra large eat in kitchen 2 comfortable bedrooms and a good sized living room make this the perfect space. Walk score: 96 Walkers paradise, no car required. Walk to everything! Transit score: 100 The Orange Line T-Station is half a block away.
space: When you walk into this apartment you are immediately aware of the amazing light coming in through the many windows.  this apartment has windows on 3 sides!  The layout is great with the bedrooms split, one in the front and one in the back of the apartment with the kitchen, bathroom and hallways in the middle. This makes for some nice privacy.  The furnishings are simple and clean, nothing fancy.  I did just put brand new appliances in the kitchen.  The bedrooms have new room darkening shades.   You will love this location because you can quickly walk to restaurants in the South End and the Back Bay.  The South End offers it's special neighborhood feel with brownstones, brick sidewalks, tree lined streets and some beautiful parks. Restaurants in the South End tend to be small cozy and unique with very varied cuisines.  You might want to make some reservations before you arrive.  Boylston and Newbury Street are both very walkable from the apartment.  There are several supermarkets nearb

neighborhood_overview: Just around the corner you will find Wally's, the oldest Jazz club in Boston.  It's small but awesome.  You can walk in, grab a drink at the bar and listen to some amazing Jazz.  Wally's supports Berklee College of music students who play there on a regular basis.  Darryl's is another great venue for Jazz is less than one block down on Columbus.  Darryl's has a very coolbar and some pretty awesome southern style food.  Northeastern University is just down the street and Boston Medical center about 1/4 mile down Mass Ave.
notes: This apartment is on the third floor of an older building.  There is not an elevator so you must be able to climb the stairs! I am very interested in people who would like to stay long term.  Are you looking for a place for 6 or 8 weeks or more during the summer?
transit: This neighborhood rates a 100 score for travel.  The Orange line is just few minute walk away and from the Train you can get anywhere you want to go. The Ruggles T stations is also just down the street. The walkability score is 96!  You really can walk anywhere from here, and there are literally 4 restaurants within a block away.  I'd like to note that you can walk to the Boston Marathon finish line and all of the pre marathon activities in about 15 minutes. Driving access is also great if you happen to be driving into the city.  Both the Massachusetts Turnpike and route 93 are just a few minutes drive away.  You won't have to deal with battling traffic to get across the city.  There are a couple of garages not far away but overnight and weekend street parking are free.  Just be careful to read the signs for street cleaning times.
access: The whole apartment will be yours.  I can meet you for check in if you want and then ask you to leave the keys in my lock box outside when your trip is over.  Just make sure you don't leave anything behind and/or find yourself locked out! I find that most guests are happy to use the lock box and enter on their own when they arrive.  This works well for me too as arrival times are so varied.  No rooftop access.
interaction: I will be available via phone to offer help throughout your stay.  If you have any questions about the apartment or the city, please feel free to text or call me.
house_rules: - Please be respectful of our neighbors above and below by keeping noise and hours in a normal range.  Please remove your shoes just inside the front door.  Make sure all lights and the ceiling fan are off when you go out.  Conserve energy by turning air conditioning off and heat down.  when your not going to be home for hours. Please leave the apartment respectfully clean. thank you.
host_about:
I am a 50 something woman, married for 30 years with one grown child and a wheaten terrier named Tucker.  I have lived in the Boston area my whole life and would love to share my city with you!  
I love to travel but never seem to travel enough!  When I do, I love to walk and feel walking a city is the best way to get to know it.  Boston is very walkable; you can literally walk anywhere from this apartment.  
I also love to try new food!  You will find more restaurants within walking distance that you can imagine.  Many are tucked into the quaint neighborhood of the South End.  This is one of the many reasons I love this area of Boston.
I know you will love Boston too!

name: Nice 1BD, Quick to Downtown, Free Parking
summary: This sunny second floor apartment is located in Dorchester/Roxbury on a dead end street. Easy access to public transportation (bus stop around the corner) that will take you most anywhere in Boston after one bus change within 30 - 60 minutes. You can also Uber pool most places depending on the time from between $4 - $9. Closest neighborhoods/landmarks (> 2 miles away) include Dudley Square, Franklin Park Zoo, Northeastern University, UMass Boston, the South End, and Jamaica Plain.

We are generally available during guests stay. Karolina and I both work full time and are not at home during the day. However we're free to answer questions when we are at home at nights and on the weekend. We'll let you know if we're planning on not being around when you are here, but you can always reach us through AirBnB. We live in a multi-ethnic and vibrant residential neighborhood, one block away from Boston Latin Academy, the first female college preparatory school in the United States. You won't find
neighborhood_overview: We live in a multi-ethnic and vibrant residential neighborhood, one block away from Boston Latin Academy, the first female college preparatory school in the United States. You won't find many bars or restaurants within walking distance, but you're a short Uber ride to more happening areas. On nice days you'll find many of our neighbors outside playing music, chatting, and BBQing while kids run around at the playground at the end of our street.
notes: We have two cats, so guests must be cat friendly. We always double check with guests, so to save some time upon booking, mention that you are okay with cats in your initial message.
transit: Our personal recommendation is to use UberPool or Lyft Line to get downtown from our house. If you avoid morning and after work commutes, the rates are usually between $4 - $9, but can be more during surge periods. Taking public transportation from here will cost at least $1.70 per person in bus fare (if you have a Charlie Card, explained below) and usually involves a transfer (free), so it can be a little complicated for visitors and doesn't save you that much compared to UberPool or Lyft Line.   If you are planning on using public transportation while here, which can be a good idea when you are travelling between areas accessible by the T (our subway), we suggest that you get a Charlie Card. They are hard plastic cards that you can store value on and use to pay for T and bus fares. Additionally, the fares are discounted compared to paying cash or getting one time passes ($2.25 vs $2.75 for the T, $1.70 vs. $2.00 for bus). You can pick up a Charlie Card at any major T stop. name: Regal and spacious South End apartment
summary: Beautiful, high ceiling, regal apartment. There are a total of two floors, three bedrooms, a newly renovated kitchen, and 1.5 bathrooms. The room available is extremely spacious, with a queen bed and chandelier. You will have your own private entrance. We are conveniently located in the South End, a few blocks from Boston Medical Center. Anywhere in Boston is easily accessible from our location. We would love to host you!
space: The bedroom is extremely large. The comfy queen bed is in the middle of the room, with a chandelier hanging over it. There is a desk, full-length mirror, drawers, (non-working) fireplace, and reading chair.  The kitchen is absolutely gorgeous, and comes with new appliances. It and the living room are open for you to use at your pleasure.  The bathroom on the first floor will basically be yours for your time here. The bathroom is the basement has the shower and will be shared with the 1-2 other permanent female occupants. You will have drawers to put your belongings in, towels, and clean sheets. Not all of the pillows pictured will be in the bedroom.

neighborhood_overview: The South End is our favorite part of the city, filled with cafes, parks, and some of the city's best restaurants. Check out Flour and Render for great coffee and breakfast, and Toro for tapas.
notes: NA
transit: A 15 minute walk will take you through beautiful South End into the Back Bay area, and 20 minutes in the other direction will bring you to Chinatown, the Theatre District, and Financial District.  The Silver Line, which takes you to South Station and the airport, is at our corner. We are also along the 1 bus route, which takes you into Cambridge. We are a 10 minute walk from the Massachusetts orange line stop.
access: You have full access to all kitchen and living room amenities.  The bedroom has its own door to exit into the building vestibule. You will have your own set of keys and are free to come and go as you please.
interaction: We are an apartment of three women. One of us will greet you to hand over the keys and answer any questions you may have. We will also be available (in person and via phone if we are not in the apartment) if you need anything during your stay.
house_rules: - We insist you use a coaster on our living room table. Otherwise, feel free to make yourself at home!
host_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
host_about:
Happy young female loving life in DC! I work in global health and am heading to medical school in the fall. I love street art, good books, chocolate and peanut butter (separately and together), and concerts.

I live with two really wonderful roommates. Before I head off to my next chapter, I'm traveling a lot for my job - meaning my place is open! I would love to host you.

My friends would describe me as loyal and generous, two characteristics that I think make me a very good host. I want to make sure your stay is as comfortable, convenient, and fun as possible.

Looking forward to meeting you!

Truly never a dull moment around here. There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on each floor, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the basement. Shampo
neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom,  and smoking only outside. Maintain Realistic Expectations: -We may talk late in the kitchen. -Your roommate is a stranger, and some people suck. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some heavily discolored spots, so no amount of cleaning will make it look sparkling clean. If you need to leave luggage before check-in or after checkout, grab a padlock with your room number (the combination is the same as your lockbox) and use the cabinets by the front door. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on FRIDAY MORNINGS, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on each floor, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the basement. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. You are welcome to hang out and talk in the kitchen or on the balcony, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 12am. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes or weed on the balcony in the back, but NOT indoors or on the front porch!  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation without a re
interaction: MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. /// BARGAINING POLICY: Please don't do it. I consider it disrespectful. I'm familiar with Boston's market prices and my own costs of operation, and I assure you my prices are rationally selected to provide a good value for your money. /// REFUND POLICY: -Want to shorten your stay?   * Send me an alteration request. I accept them all. Then all future days will be refunded in full. -Need to cancel before check-in?  * Full refund! I should still have time for another guest to book. -Choose to cancel after check-in?  * All future dates will be refunded in full.  * But the arrival date is NON-refundable (Website hidden by Airbnb) apologize in advance, but this is an economy listing and it is crucial that each space stably generates revenue every single night. -Your bed/space never cleaned? $
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 30+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Save or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -People are coming here to SLEEP, so be QUIET!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Just go to the front porch!) {$150 fine} -Don't take anyone's food for stuff. (That's stealing!) {$150 fine + 3x compensation} -Check out on time. (12pm!) {$15-$30 for the first hour; $50 for >1hr} -Keep the kitchen and bathroom CLEAN! -Don't take an eternity in the shower. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -Your roommate is a stranger. (And some people suck!)  ^ i.e.
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D

neighborhood_overview: Fort Hill a quiet urban neighborhood located between Boston's fashionable South End and Jamaica Plain neighborhoods. Our condominium is located on the south east side of the hill on the top floor of one of Boston's classic "triple deckers" or "three decker" and was built in 1910. It overlooks the neighborhood and it's gardens. We love the spaciousness and the light that the unit offers, the free parking as well as the access the location offers to the rest of the city. The "MBTA" Orange line station "Jackson Square" is a short 8 min walk, from there guests can be in the city center in just mins, Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Fenway, The North End, Harvard Square - Cambridge are all easily accessed via the MBTA
notes: NA
transit: The property is close to Boston's public transit system, the "MBTA"' in particular the "Orange Line" We are located at approx equal distance to the Jacson Square and Roxbury Community College stops, each on the Orange Line. The walk is approx 8 mins. From either stop it is approximately 10 mins to Boston's Back Bay, The Public Garden, The Boston Public Library and more. The Silver Line's  #4 and #5 bus rapid transit lines originate just mins away in the Dudley Square MBTA Station and serve downtown as well as Logan Airport.  The Pierre Lallement Bicycle Path runs along the Southwest Corridor Park from Forrest Hills to Back Bay. There are various car services including Uber, Lift and taxis available. There is also free "on-street" parking in front of our building.
access: Guests are invited to enjoy this Spacious Master Bedroom Suite with Private Bath, Private Balcony and Air Conditioning, Wifi
interaction: We are happily available in person or by cell phone at anytime to answers questions, to make suggestions and to answer any concerns.
house_rules: Both front door locks must be locked at all times, after entering or leaving the property. No smoking of any kind on the property. No alcohol on the property. No candles. No amplified sound/music We observe a peaceful, quiet atmosphere keeping in mind that there are others in the building and offer them our consideration. This includes upon entering and leaving the property, the common stairwell can amplify sound which could disturb our neighbors.  Thank you for your consideration.  Enjoy your stay.  William

name: Nice 2 BD, Quick to Downtown, Free Parking
summary: This sunny second floor apartment is located in Dorchester/Roxbury on a dead end street. Easy access to public transportation (bus stop around the corner) that will take you most anywhere in Boston after one bus change within 30 - 60 minutes. You can also Uber pool most places depending on the time from between $4 - $9. Closest neighborhoods/landmarks (> 2 miles away) include Dudley Square, Franklin Park Zoo, Northeastern University, UMass Boston, the South End, and Jamaica Plain.

You won't find many bars or restaurants within walking distance, but you're a short Ub
neighborhood_overview: We live in a multi-ethnic and vibrant residential neighborhood, one block away from Boston Latin Academy, the first female college preparatory school in the United States. You won't find many bars or restaurants within walking distance, but you're a short Uber ride to more happening areas. On nice days you'll find many of our neighbors outside playing music, chatting, and BBQing while kids run around at the playground at the end of our street.
notes: NA
transit: Our personal recommendation is to use UberPool or Lyft Line to get downtown from our house. If you avoid morning and after work commutes, the rates are usually between $4 - $9, but can be more during surge periods. Taking public transportation from here will cost at least $1.70 per person in bus fare (if you have a Charlie Card, explained below) and usually involves a transfer (free), so it can be a little complicated for visitors and doesn't save you that much compared to UberPool or Lyft Line.   If you are planning on using public transportation while here, which can be a good idea when you are travelling between areas accessible by the T (our subway), we suggest that you get a Charlie Card. They are hard plastic cards that you can store value on and use to pay for T and bus fares. Additionally, the fares are discounted compared to paying cash or getting one time passes ($2.25 vs $2.75 for the T, $1.70 vs. $2.00 for bus). You can pick up a Charlie Card at any major T stop. summary: This beautiful building is on the list of nationally historic buildings and dates to the late 19th Century.  Come get a taste of the past while living in the luxuries of the present. This 4th floor one bedroom suite features a full sized, open kitchen and living room that looks out onto a great view of the city and neighborhood. This brand new unit has polished hardwood floors throughout the unit, central air, marble countertops and new stainless steel appliances.
space: This 3rd floor one bedroom suite features a full sized, open kitchen and living room that looks out onto a great view of the city and neighborhood. This brand new unit has polished hardwood floors throughout the unit, central air, marble countertops and new stainless steel appliances. The bedroom features a queen mattress set, nightstand, reading lamp and alarm clock. The bathroom has a beautiful tile surround tub and shower combo. The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pans and cooking utensils, along with oven, range and refrigerator and there is a dining table that seats four. The living room has a flat screen TV and the sofa pulls out to a queen bed which makes this the perfect unit for two to four people.

neighborhood_overview: The South End is one of Boston’s trendiest neighborhoods boasting some of Boston’s best restaurants and night life, great access to public transit. A very urban, walk-able neighborhood in Boston. Known for its many parks, restaurants and artistic culture, this neighborhood has been the "hottest" in Boston's real estate market. Young families, professionals, doctors/nurses and empty nesters will enjoy this location.
notes: All of our rental units are equipped with wireless internet, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, tea kettle, toaster, microwave, linens and towels, as well as a guest book with instructions and recommendations. All building and unit doors are on secure, code-activated locks so coordinating key pick-up and drop-off is not necessary. This unit is accessed using stairs (there is no elevator) and is on the third level.
transit: Built in 1874 and beautifully restored to its former glory in collaboration with the National Parks Service and the South End Landmarks Association, this classic Boston property marries original 20th century charm and detail with modern luxuries in the South End neighborhood, one of Boston’s trendiest because of its vibrant restaurants and night life. The unit has great access to public transit, and is conveniently located within a 20 minute walk to most of Boston’s best tourist locations including Fenway Park, the Charles River, the Freedom Trail and the Boston Common.
access: Access is via code activated doors. Once you have a confirmed reservation you will receive an email from our management company confirming the details of your stay and the exact process to access the building and the unit. There is a washer and dryer in the basement of the building.
interaction: We have prepared for your stay so that you don't need to interact with us at all during your stay. You have complete privacy.

house_rules: Please do not make a request right away. But send me an email first. Unlike most other Airbnb listings, what we do here is long-term rentals by the year, or by the semester.  We try to keep the atmosphere conducive to studying and resting and a couple of house-rules are in place to this end.  1. Towels and linens (sheets, blankets, and pillows) are NOT provided. The bed is full size. 2. No smoking on the premises.  3. No loud music or TV etc.  4. Only for one person (no couples, no visitors). We seldom have visitors, let alone overnight guests. We know this will be a major turn-off to many people, but we believe we can find a like-minded roommate who can have fun outside the house.  5. If you are not sure about your check-out date, you can reserve the minimum days and extend your stay at a discounted rate.  6. Check-in time has to be coordinated at least 48 hours ahead.
