name: Beautiful Bedroom Next to Roxbury Crossing T Stop
summary: This bedroom is perfect for anyone visiting Boston looking for a quiet, luxurious, and comfortable stay. When you are here, this apartment is your home. -Comfortable bed, powerful WiFi, desk space, and plenty of closet space.  -The apartment this bedroom is in is brand new and decked out to the max - granite counters, brand new appliances, and a roofdeck.  -The location is even better - a 5-10 minute walk from an Orange Line T stop so the whole city is at your finger tips.
space: After you walk in the door, you will walk into a massive open concept living room-kitchen area.  -The kitchen is decked out to the max - massive granite counters, brand new appliances, beautiful cabinets. -The living room has a huge green sectional - be careful not to fall asleep on it after you sit down.   The bedroom is comfortable and spacious: -Turn on the fan if you need a little airflow in the room. -If you want to stow away your belongings and clothes, feel free to use the huge wardrobe in the room and dresser.  -If you have work to do, feel free to set up shop at the desk and connect to our wifi.  -If you are traveling with a second person, grab the air mattress in the wardrobe.  Freshen up in the bathroom right next to the bedroom. -Extra body wash, shampoo, tooth paste, and tooth brush will be in the wardrobe if you need it.
description: This bedroom is perfect for anyone visiting Boston looking for a quiet, luxurious, and comfortable stay. When you are here, this apartment is your home. -Comfortable bed, powerful WiFi, desk space, and plenty of closet space.  -The apartment this bedroom is in is brand new and decked out to the max - granite counters, brand new appliances, and a roofdeck.  -The location is even better - a 5-10 minute walk from an Orange Line T stop so the whole city is at your finger tips. After you walk in the door, you will walk into a massive open concept living room-kitchen area.  -The kitchen is decked out to the max - massive granite counters, brand new appliances, beautiful cabinets. -The living room has a huge green sectional - be careful not to fall asleep on it after you sit down.   The bedroom is comfortable and spacious: -Turn on the fan if you need a little airflow in the room. -If you want to stow away your belongings and clothes, feel free to use the huge wardrobe in the room and dresser
neighborhood_overview: -Historic Fort Hill neighborhood in Boston, adjacent to Mission Hill, Dudley Square, and Northeastern University.  -The neighborhood is quiet and residential. -It is a mix of college students, young professionals, long-term residents, and families. -Very close to downtown, Longwood, Back Bay, Northeastern, MCPHS, Wentworth, Mission Hill, and Jamaica Plain
notes: The apartment has three other bedrooms occupied by three working professional males - they have to be up early in the morning for work.  You will be sharing the bathroom with one other roommate so please keep it very clean and treat it as your own and be mindful of his use. Some of the roommates are 420 friendly so if you are very sensitive to the odor it is something to consider. The room itself will be completely free of the smell.
transit: -The Roxbury Crossing Orange line T stop is about 0.4 miles from the apartment (5-10 min walk).  -The Orange line inbound gives you access to downtown Boston (Financial District, Boylston St, Newbury St, Chinatown, North End, and Fanneuil Hall, Haymarket, TD Garden).  -The Orange line outbound will take you toward Jamaica Plain, where you can find a lot of trendy restaurants & coffee shops and parks & green space (Jamaica Pond, Arnold Arboretum, and Franklin Park).
access: -Go hang out in the living room, lounge on the sectional, and check out what is on TV (HBO is included). -If you like to cook, use the kitchen which has tons of counter space and top of the line appliances.  -Dirty clothes? Feel free to use the in-unit washer / dryer for free (detergent provided) -Want to hang out, tan, or read a book and enjoy some great views of the city? Check out the roof deck.
interaction: I work full-time for a healthy foods startup  and do part-time work in real estate so I am very busy.  That being said, I will be in the neighborhood and around the apartment from time to time. I am happy to give any tips on  things to do, places to see, or restaurants to eat at.  But in the spirit of being an Airbnb host and not a hotel-owner - if you want to grab a drink / coffee and hear about my experience living in the city, we can definitely make it happen.  But like I said, if you prefer to do your own thing, that is also completely fine!
house_rules: - Quiet hours from 1030pm-8am - Leave room in same condition you found it
host_about:
I am originally from Washington, DC. I moved to Boston to attend school at Northeastern University, where I studied business with concentrations in finance and entrepreneurship. During my time in school, I fell in love with Boston. Its combination of strong local economy, lush green spaces, intelligent urban planning, historical character, and compact size makes it a great place to live and visit. 

In my spare time, I enjoy the following:
-Following NBA basketball
-Listening to podcasts
-Writing / blogging
-Running and keeping fit

I come from an Italian family where hosting guests is taken very seriously. I bring that same passion to hosting guests on Airbnb. When you stay with me, I want you to have a great time.

Truly never a dull moment around here. There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on each floor, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the wa
neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom,  and smoking only outside. Maintain Realistic Expectations: -We may talk late in the kitchen. -Loud people won't quiet down unless you ask first. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some heavily discolored spots, so no amount of cleaning will make it look sparkling clean. If you need to leave luggage before check-in or after checkout, grab a padlock with your room number (the combination is the same as your lockbox) and use the cabinets by the front door. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on FRIDAY MORNINGS, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on each floor, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the basement. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. You are welcome to hang out and talk in the kitchen or on the balcony, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 12am. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes or weed on the balcony in the back, but NOT indoors or on the front porch!  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation without a re
interaction: 9am-11am: Breakfast on the 1st floor! ^_^ MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. /// BARGAINING POLICY: Please don't do it. I consider it disrespectful. I'm familiar with Boston's market prices and my own costs of operation, and I assure you my prices are rationally selected to provide a good value for your money. /// REFUND POLICY: -Want to shorten your stay?   * Send me an alteration request. I accept them all. Then all future days will be refunded in full. -Need to cancel before check-in?  * Full refund! I should still have time for another guest to book. -Choose to cancel after check-in?  * All future dates will be refunded in full.  * But the arrival date is NON-refundable (Website hidden by Airbnb) apologize in advance, but this is an economy listing and it is crucial that each space stably generates revenue every sing
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 30+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Save or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -People are coming here to SLEEP, so be QUIET!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Just go to the front porch!) {$150 fine} -Don't take anyone's food for stuff. (That's stealing!) {$150 fine + 3x compensation} -Check out on time. (12pm!) {$15-$30 for the first hour; $50 for >1hr} -Keep the kitchen and bathroom CLEAN! -Don't take an eternity in the shower. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some hea
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D

name: Two Bedroom Apartment, Parking Included.
summary: With access to the orange and red lines, this lower apartment has plenty to offer! 5 bus lines bring you to the main T-stations, just 15 min away from Logan airport. This property features private parking and two bedrooms w/ a king bed and single bed. Living room has a couch with queen size bed underneath. Close to Stop&Shop, CVS, and takeout, you can either order or cook your favorite meal in the fully equipped kitchen. We want you to experience Boston to the fullest without breaking your bank.
space: Newly renovated and freshly painted, this apartment is about 750 sf. There's a king size bed a twin bed also on living room is a pull out couch with queen size bed,extra bed sheets are on bedroom closet. No charge for extra people. Security deposit $100. Cleaning fee $30

transit: Five bus lines, (19, 22, 23, 29 and 44), can take you to major T-Stations in no more than 5-7 minutes. You can check the bus schedules and plan your trip on (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Franklin Zoo is only a 10 min walk away. Fenway Park is only a 15-20 min drive depending on the traffic. Downtown Boston is 4.5 miles away.
access: As a courtesy to other occupants, we would appreciate no smoking inside, no loud noises no parties or people's gathering on the property. We are very strict about these rules and If the they  violated the host reserves the right to take immediate action to end the event. We are committed to provide a quiet and peaceful environment for all the people who live in the property. As such we have zero tolerance policy on loud music, parties and gatherings or guests that host has not approved to be in the property
interaction: The host is available to answer questions anytime,call or text Eric (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ,thanks..
house_rules: No parties and no loud noises in the property. This is kid friendly property and we would like to offer a pleasurable experience for everyone. In case of snow, host is not responsible to clean the driveway.
host_about: Married with kids,family oriented,favorite travel places latin America,Europe,,like reading,music and Mediterranean food,fun guy to be around...

name: 2/1 Newly Furnished Condo By Public Transit (21D1)
summary: My condo is located just 8 minutes (walking) from the commuter rail (2 stops, 11 minute ride to South Station) and offers an open airy space that sleeps 4 adults comfortably. Free easy on street parking is available just outside the condo. I am an experienced host and have been hosting on Airbnb and other channels for almost 5 years. I would love the opportunity to host you and your group during your time in our beautiful City of Boston.
space: My 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom condo is located on the first floor of a three unit condo building. I also have the other two condos upstairs available. The upstairs condos are 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom and perfect for larger groups. The condo offers one bedroom with a queen size bed and another with a full size bed. I provide all linens, towels, hand towels, sheets etc for you during your stay. There is place settings for four people and enough dishes, silverware, glasses etc for four. The appliances are new and provide guests the ability to prepare freshly home cooked meals, instead of being cramped in a small hotel room.
description: My condo is located just 8 minutes (walking) from the commuter rail (2 stops, 11 minute ride to South Station) and offers an open airy space that sleeps 4 adults comfortably. Free easy on street parking is available just outside the condo. I am an experienced host and have been hosting on Airbnb and other channels for almost 5 years. I would love the opportunity to host you and your group during your time in our beautiful City of Boston. My 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom condo is located on the first floor of a three unit condo building. I also have the other two condos upstairs available. The upstairs condos are 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom and perfect for larger groups. The condo offers one bedroom with a queen size bed and another with a full size bed. I provide all linens, towels, hand towels, sheets etc for you during your stay. There is place settings for four people and enough dishes, silverware, glasses etc for four. The appliances are new and provide guests the ability to prepare freshly home
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is located just South of the city and just a short walk to the commuter rail stop, which provides easy access to the city centre. I live just 5 minutes away, so if guests need anything, in most cases I can just swing by and assist. The condo is located about 3 blocks off the main road and surrounded by public neighborhood vegetable gardens. The larger area around the neighborhood is undergoing gentrification. The famous Strand Theatre is walking distance from the condo and just underwent a $6 million renovation. There are also several dining options within walking distance, especially those with a culturally diverse appetite.
notes: I work very hard to make sure my guests are happy and am dedicated to insuring you have a pleasant stay. I ask that all guests reach out to me prior to placing a reservation with specific questions or concerns. Also, upon arrival if you need anything, please let me know and I will do everything I can to make sure your stay is comfortable and pleasant. I am available to answer any questions you have regarding the city, public transportation, dining options etc. I
transit: The condo is located 8 minutes from the local commuter rail stop. The ride is only 11 minutes and a one way ticket is $2.25. You can also purchase passes. The commuter rail will take you directly to South Station, which is in the heart of the city and just a short walk from the Boston Common, Newbury Street, and Downtown Crossing. The Boston Convention Center is less than 3 miles away as well.
access: Guests have full access to the entire condo. The condo has 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom. The condo also offers a rear balcony, from which you can see a glimpse of the John Hancock tower and overlooks a small community garden.
interaction: I am available 24/7/365 for guests through the Airbnb dashboard, telephone, text and email.
house_rules: House Rules Parties are NOT permitted at this property. Guests caught having parties will be removed from the premises immediately and may be subject to an extra cleaning fee, and will not be refunded. Locals MUST communicate with us prior to booking. Having some family in town and need extra space? That’s perfectly fine, we just need to know the situation prior to booking. It helps us cut down on unauthorized activities in our properties. All of our properties have strict occupancy limits, imposed by city codes. That means that no more than the specified number of guests in your reservation are allowed in the property at any given time. The number of guests indicated in your reservation should be accurate. Children and infants do count towards this total. Please notify us of any changes to the guest count prior to your stay. Should we find that you have violated this rule, you will be removed from the property and will not receive a refund. This is a SELF CHECK IN property. By reservi
host_about:
My name is Shawn and I've enjoyed hosting guests from all over the world since 2012. I'm a news junkie, foodie and love reading. I was born and raised in Orlando, but moved to Boston 6 years ago. I absolutely love Boston and all it has to offer. From the culture, great culinary treats, to the many open spaces and historic sites. My second home is Fort Lauderdale and Vieques, PR. Can you say warm weather! 

I spend most of my day responding and answering guest inquiries and insuring guests have a pleasant stay. Does your Airbnb take up too much of your time? Want to put it on autopilot? Shoot me a message, I would love to help :)

Feel free to reach out with any questions. I try to respond as quickly as time allows and am always available for my guests! 

Happy Booking!

He doesn't have a job :-) We are on the edge of the South End, near everything. The food in the area is great. If you need any suggesti

notes: There are only stairs to the third floor. No elevators, escalators or magic carpets.

name: Great Boston Bedroom w/ the Best Amenities!
summary: This bedroom is ideal for anyone wanting to experience Boston at an affordable rate.  Guest (2 Max) will have a queen size bed, flat screen tv w/ cable, private bathroom w/ single jacuzzi tub, wifi access and easy access to public transportation (5 minute walk).  Also, our unit includes a great view of the city from our back porch balcony and it goes well with coffee! Absolutely no pets and no guests!  Quiet hours are after 9pm.

house_rules: Check in is at 4pm. There is no early check in. THIS BUILDING IS A NON SMOKING PROPERTY. If you or your accompanying guest smoke do not book this property. Absolutely no drugs and no guests!  Must be respectful at all times.  Also you must remember to lock the door when entering and exiting.  This is non negotiable.  And again, absolutely no guests.!  AND please NO EATING IN THE BEDROOM.  Please eat in the kitchen area.
host_about:
My name is Jane and my husband's and I live in a cozy condo in Roxbury, MA.

I am a very cheerful and positive person!  I love to write songs, read plays and travel.  My favorite place to travel was Ghana because the food was delicious, the people were warm and the history was captivating!  In the future I would love to travel to Kenya or Thailand!  

I also love to watch romantic comedies and The Office (lol). 

My husband and I are very quiet and laid back.  We are always working on a new project or ambition and we are always inspired by the experiences of others who live their best life and who are impacting the world in a positive way!

name: Loft Style 1 Mile from Downtown Boston Brownstone.
summary: A Large, Loft Style, open space unit. With tall ceilings, exposed brick wall, with private entrance, to quiet peaceful Unit, with big kitchen, stocked with food, newly re-done private bathroom. Across from beautiful Highland Park. Within 1 mile (as the crow flies) from downtown Boston. Attached Brick Brownstone. Free on street Parking. Ten minute walk to the Train. Ten minutes to most of the major Hospitals in the Longwood Medical area. Ten Minutes to the Museum of Fine Art.
space: In addition to your separate, quiet and private, living-sleeping quarters, and bathroom, I offer wi-fi access, fridge, gas stove for cooking, kettle for coffee and tea as well as a variety of yogurts, juices and snacks.   There is plentiful parking on the street. A street bike is available upon request.  I love to welcome our guests and offer insights to the area. This place is great for a Single traveler, or a couple, for sight seeing, vacation. or Business.

This place is great for a Single traveler, or a couple, for sight seeing, vacation. or Business. You have access to, free on street parking, your own pri
neighborhood_overview: Its a pretty mixed neighborhood of mostly owner occupied Brownstones, and owner occupied Codo's. It used to be pretty much a blue collar neighborhood, but now I am seeing more Doctor and Lawyer types moving into the neighborhood. It is still a racially diverse area, and inclusive. What is most special about this neighborhood is its proximity to Downtown Boston and yet it does not have anywhere near the density of Downtown. So It has a laid back small town feel, yet one look from the top of the park reveals the Boston sky line and you know your in a Big International City.
notes: There's no shortage of things to do in Boston, history is everywhere, art museums. , galleries, music, movies, science, technologies, sports, on and on.
transit: Parking here is free 24 hours a day. But the key is to get here before like 4pm to 430pm. Because after that the street fills up and it can get very difficult to find a spot. My neighbors would prefer if you park at the end of my street and not directly in front of my building. But its still a free country on our street, and do as you feel, but parking up here is special, so try to think of my neighbors. I truly would like to keep parking up here free and without parking permits and meter maids. :)  Uber is probably the best way to get around.
access: You have access to, free on street parking, your own private entrance, the kitchen for cooking, newly re-done private bathroom, Washer and Drier, wifi, large flat screen TV, the Baby Grand Piano (at least to look at). Enjoy.
interaction: Only interaction with me would be, when you first arrive, so that I may give you the keys to the place, and a phone call away. I will be available at your Leisure.
house_rules: - Quiet Hours 10pm-7am
host_about: I'm From Boston, I love this city, and all it  has to offer. The arts, music, medical, and tech advantages, this city offers. Its amazing History, its charm, and on, and on.

name: Cozy & Convenient 2.33
summary: [Economy Listing] This is a PRIVATE ROOM with a SHARED BATHROOM. -Friendly (Hidden by Airbnb) with a cozy balcony and dining space. -Free, on-street parking. Convenient Transportation: 13-minute bus ride to the Ruggles Station [on the orange line]. Harvard, the airport, and downtown all less than 20min by car/Uber. Location: Search "Washington Park Mall" across the street: grocery store, convenience store, dollar store, bank, McDonald's, Walgreens, YMCA, etc.
space: I am doing my best to provide a great value for my guests, offering not only an affordable place to crash for the evening, but also to furnish most every little thing travelers may find useful (e.g. painkillers, sleep aids, sunscreen, healthy snacks, etc.). I humbly ask that you please be quick in the restroom (as there is only one), use the ash trays and trash cans when you smoke on the balcony, do your dishes, and remain reasonably quiet whenever anyone is trying to sleep.

I humbly ask that you please be quick in the restroom (as there is only one), use the ash trays and trash cans when you smoke on the balcony, do your dishes, and remain reasonably quiet whenever anyone is trying to sleep. There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on t
neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom,  and smoking only outside. Maintain Realistic Expectations: -We may talk late in the kitchen. -Loud people won't quiet down unless you ask first. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some heavily discolored spots, so no amount of cleaning will make it look sparkling clean. If you need to leave luggage before check-in or after checkout, grab a padlock with your room number (the combination is the same as your lockbox) and use the cabinets by the front door. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on FRIDAY MORNINGS, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs $4-$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs $8-$16--i.e. often significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself,
access: There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on the first floor as well, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the basement. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. You are welcome to hang out and talk in the kitchen or on the balcony, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 12am. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes or weed on the balcony in the back, but NOT indoors or on the front porch!  ^ Penalty: $150 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $150 fine + forced cancellation
interaction: MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. /// BARGAINING POLICY: Please don't do it. I consider it disrespectful. I'm familiar with Boston's market prices and my own costs of operation, and I assure you my prices are rationally selected to provide a good value for your money. /// REFUND POLICY: -Want to shorten your stay?   * Send me an alteration request. I accept them all. Then all future days will be refunded in full. -Need to cancel before check-in?  * Full refund! I should still have time for another guest to book. -Choose to cancel after check-in?  * All future dates will be refunded in full.  * But the arrival date is NON-refundable (Website hidden by Airbnb) apologize in advance, but this is an economy listing and it is crucial that each space stably generates revenue every single night. -Your bed/space never cleaned? $
house_rules: - Quiet Hours: 10pm-9am     => Low voices and headphones. - Any/all smoking on the balcony. - Be respectful: please do your dishes and don't hog the bathroom for >20 minutes.
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D

house_rules: Please do not make a request right away. But send me an email first. Unlike most other Airbnb listings, what we do here is long-term rentals by the year, or by the semester.  We try to keep the atmosphere conducive to studying and resting and a couple of house-rules are in place to this end.  1. Towels and linens (sheets, blankets, and pillows) are NOT provided. The bed is full size. 2. No smoking on the premises.  3. No loud music or TV etc.  4. Only for one person (no couples, no visitors). We know this will be a major turn-off to many people, but we believe we can find a like-minded roommate who can have fun outside the house.  5. Check-in time has to be coordinated at least 48 hours ahead. 6. Inside the apartment, we take off our outside shoes. So if you bring your own flip-flops, slippers or some kind of indoor shoes, that will be useful. 7. We use nearby laundromats (no washer and drier in the house).

neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom,  and smoking only outside. Maintain Realistic Expectations: -We may talk late in the kitchen. -Loud people won't quiet down unless you ask first. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some heavily discolored spots, so no amount of cleaning will make it look sparkling clean. If you need to leave luggage before check-in or after checkout, grab a padlock with your room number (the combination is the same as your lockbox) and use the cabinets by the front door. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on FRIDAY MORNINGS, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on the first floor as well, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the basement. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. You are welcome to hang out and talk in the kitchen or on the balcony, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 12am. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes or weed on the balcony in the back, but NOT indoors or on the front porch!  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation
interaction: This particular listing is for a PRIVATE room on my own floor, so you’ll almost inevitably find yourself dialoguing with me or my housemates at some point.  ^ Potential downside is that we may be hanging out in the kitchen at the end of the hallway past 10pm. If you enjoy meeting new people during your stays and are not a light sleeper, this place is for you! (If you wake up easily and just want some privacy, I suggest you opt for one of my many other private listings.) You need to use "The Self-Checkin Guide" to get inside. I will, of course, be available for questions via texting through the AirBNB app, but I am not always here to let you in, so I have tried to make the process of getting settled in easy and intuitive.  As for my housemates, they are all well aware which rooms are being AirBNBed but are rarely aware of specifically who is coming and going, so just start with hi, and enjoy your stay in Boston. :) ///\\\ \\\/// MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while provi
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 30+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Save or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -People are coming here to SLEEP, so be QUIET!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Just go to the front porch!) {$150 fine} -Don't take anyone's food for stuff. (That's stealing!) {$150 fine + 3x compensation} -Check out on time. (12pm!) {$15-$30 for the first hour; $50 for >1hr} -Keep the kitchen and bathroom CLEAN! -Don't take an eternity in the shower. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -Your roommate is a stranger. (And some people suck!)  ^ i.e.

summary: Stayloom is dedicated to giving you a luxurious and authentic travel experience. From the refurbished table to the local artwork, our homes are furnished so every detail has a genuine connection to the surrounding community. Spacious and suitable for groups of all sizes, each Stayloom home is crafted with the intention of bringing family and friends together. Stay in style. Stay for the stories. Stayloom.
space: Inspired by the crisp mid century style, this Stayloom condo is loaded with modern amenities. Every detail from renovation to decoration was hand selected to create a unique space where playful decor meets serious comfort. Stocked with all the comforts of a home and located just steps from the train, this space is an ideal home base for groups looking for a first-class Boston experience. -Can comfortably accommodate up to 9 guests - Open-concept living space includes a 55" SmartTV, a fully equipped kitchen (all essential cook/dishware and brand new appliances), and a breakfast bar. - Central air/heat, high-speed internet, and brand new high-capacity washer/dryer - All beds feature Tempurpedic-quality mattresses and silky, high thread count linens. - All bathrooms are immaculate and include essential toiletries and stacks of plush cotton towels.

neighborhood_overview: While charmingly historic, the Fort Hill neighborhood is pulsing with modern energy. With the South End, Fenway, and Downtown all nearby, Boston’s culinary and cultural scenes are at your fingertips. A dynamic mix of local families, young professionals, and students, Fort Hill has a unique flavor all its own while remaining deeply connected to Boston’s rich history. All guests after booking will receive a personalized list of recommendations including locals favorite spots, restaurants, and activities. We will provide detailed information and guides on the surrounding area to enhance your overall experience.
notes: If you have questions you need answered before securing your booking, or you simply want to talk with us first, reach out to our Stayloom team with an inquiry before a reservation request. Please also note that one-night stays on the weekend or reservations that start or end on a Saturday may be subject to an additional fee. Want more options? Check out Stayloom’s other homes located in popular destinations across the nation such as Boston, Savannah, New Orleans, and more! At Stayloom, we make sure you find the perfect fit. Damage deposit: $500 (non-Airbnb reservations only)
transit: The closest subway stop is less than a ten minute walk away, making the whole city readily accessible within minutes. For those who feel adventurous, the nearest Hubway bicycle rental location is a five minute walk away. For $6/day, you can enjoy access to a bike that can be dropped off at one of the 160+ locations across the city.
access: The entire apartment and back yard is exclusively for your group's enjoyment. Please note that there are two other apartments in this building, so the foyer space is shared.
interaction: You will have complete privacy here, however every question or concern you may have before or during your stay will be promptly addressed via messenger or phone. In the case of a maintenance emergency, our ground team is available to assist you. Entry is simple, there’s no need to coordinate key pick up.
house_rules: - Please respect Boston's noise ordinance. Quiet hours begin at 11:00pm, weekdays & weekends. - Any visit from the local police department will result in immediate eviction without refund.
host_about:
I am a proud member of the Stayloom network! My personal loves include cooking, travel, and books. Part of the joy for me is in providing a platform to let you discover what I love about this city. I hope I have the chance to show you Boston’s amazing energy and vibrant culture.

Cheers,
Demetrios

name: DEL'S PLACE
summary: Enjoy my cozy comfortable home with beautiful new kitchen, with all the amenities.  New living room sofa, chase let down to beds  if needed. Queen sleigh bed with mirror closet doors.  2 double beds . Two levels, 2 bathrooms, hardwood floors throughout the first level. Xfinity cable service and Wi-Fi in all 3 rooms with access to Netflix.  My condo is located in very nice, upcoming area of Roxbury. Safe & well lighted, five minute walk to the MBTA Dudley station.  1/2 hour from Downtown Boston.
space: The condo has 3 bedrooms, 2 full size beds and 1 queen size bed. the 3rd bedroom belongs to Delphine.  The living room space has a sofa and chase that will let down for extra beds if needed.  Wi-Fi and Xfinity Cable service in every bedroom and living room.    No smoking allowed in the unit.  There is a table on the front deck for those who smoke.

The kitchen is fully equipped with dishwasher, microwave, Keurig coffee maker, huge refrigerator with water and ice dispenser.   Guest have full use o
neighborhood_overview: My unit is located in Roxbury, one of the oldest communities of Boston.  Roxbury is rich with history and diversity. Roxbury was one of the first towns founded in the Massachusetts Bay Colony. As you walk around the area,   its amazing to see the gentrification all over the neighborhood. Roxbury is safe and well lighted. You will have easy access to Downtown Boston Theatre District, Boston Medical facilities, and several Universities in the area. I have been a proud resident of Roxbury for over 50 years and it is a pleasure to own property in Roxbury area. It's nice to share my home with people who visit and love Boston.
notes: I do have a cat name Egypt, who is not in the unit at this time,  currently living with my mother Sarah. I do not allow smoking in the unit.  No large parties in the unit.
transit: We are centrally located  in Roxbury 2 blocks from Dudley Bus Terminal the hub of (MBTA) Massachusetts Bay Transportation Association with connections to all bus and train lines.  Five minute walk to Dudley Station.  Ten minute walk to Northeastern University  & Wentworth University. Twenty minute ride to MIT Cambridge, fifteen minutes to Downtown Boston or the Boston Harbor.  There is FREE parking on my street and in the area around Dudley station  a 2 hour parking limit.
access: The kitchen is fully equipped with dishwasher, microwave, Keurig coffee maker, huge refrigerator with water and ice dispenser.   Guest have full use of all aplpliances, dishes  silverware and pots.  Extra linens sheets, towels and blankets are available during your stay. Cleaning  and bathing products are left in bathroom and kitchen. For you listening pleasure HK Onyx Studio 2 is available to use through your smart phone.  Netflix and   Wi-Fi are available.  Free parking on the street.
interaction: Delphine or Sarah will greet the guest upon arrival if you are able to arrive by 3:30pm. I have password entry lock . The code will be given to you on your day of arrival and can be shared with your guests. For safety reason the code is changed once the guests has checked out. Although Delphine lives in the unit , all guests will have the entire unit to themselves during your stay at Del’s Place Delphine or Sarah will be available through text or cell phone and can come to the unit within minutes if you have any problems.
house_rules: small pets are welcome as long as they are not left in the house alone without being in a kennel
host_about: Hello my name Delphine I love to entertain and spend time with family.  Most of the time I will be available to meet you and answer any questions you might have about the area, the Transit System (MBTA) , local grocery store and the local hot spots. If you have a late check in  I will not be available until the following day. I have a combination lock set up for easy check in on your own.  I love hosting through airbnb it has given me the oppourtunity to meet great people and share my home with travelars as they experience their stay in Boston. I look forward to your stay @ Del's Place

host_about: My name is Sarah, I'm a single mother and originally from Africa. I have lived in the US for 19+ years. I am an exceptionally kind, caring and considerate person with a big heart. I love meeting people and relating very well with them even at first sight. I am a professional in the Health care delivery, and work flexible hours. I love to watch TV and multicultural films with my family at my leisure time. Travelling to see the world is something I desire to do when the time comes, right now I enjoy the pleasure of the world coming to me via Airbnb. It is a great honor to be your host!

name: Massive 3 BR South End Apt by Domio
summary: Located on the first floor of a trendy South End building, this duplex is the perfect place for large families, groups of friends, and business professionals to enjoy Boston.  In a city where space is hard to come by, this apartment is a rare find with massive bedrooms and abundance of bathrooms. Featuring three bedrooms and three full bathrooms, this apartment ensures ultimate comfort and privacy.
space: Each bedroom has a queen size bed and its own bathroom. The dining table and kitchen are perfect for groups looking to avoid dining out for every meal. A Keurig coffee machine is also provided along side a number of different coffee pods for all your caffeine needs. The living room is spacious with ample seating and natural light.  Take advantage of the smart TV by tuning into your favorite prime time.  Cable and wifi are complimentary and we encourage our guests to take advantage. This unit has a washer and dryer to make laundry on extended trips a breeze.  Linens, towels, and bathroom amenities will be provided.  Domio properties provide all the comforts of home with the confidence of a hotel.

neighborhood_overview: Boarding Back Bay and South Boston, the South End is becoming a more modern area of Boston with tons of new high rises, trendy restaurants, and bustling nightlife.  Beyond the architecture, you will find streets resembling Back Bay with old gas lamp lighting and brick red sidewalks.  With it's unique diversity and high end youthful vibes, the South End is quickly becoming one of the most sought after places to live in Boston.
notes: Like what you see but it's not quite right? Please note that we have multiple listings available ranging from studios to four bedroom apartments! Feel free to check out our other listings on our Airbnb profile.
transit: Did you know you can walk the entire city of Boston in just five hours? Want to give your feet a rest? Take the "T" or download the Lyft app. Ask us for a discount code if you are a first time Lyft user!
access: In addition to full access to the apartment, our guests will receive exclusive discounts to some of the best attractions in Boston. Ride and float through the city on a Boston Duck Tour; save money on the absolute best way to see Boston. Finding Nemo at the world famous New England Aquarium comes at a discounted rate for our guests. Need restaurant recommendations? We're foodies at heart, and happy to recommend some of the top spots in the city.
interaction: We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available and at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

name: Entire 1-bedroom Apartment Near Downtown/Longwood
summary: Thank you for visiting our listing!   This lovely, private 1-bedroom apartment in the lower level of our townhouse has a dining room, living room, kitchenette, bathroom, and bedroom. All yours!!!  That’s not all...Walk just 5-10 min. to the train (called the “T”) or drive 5-10 min. to the highway. Easy in/out/around. We also know the hidden ethnic food gems of the city for all you foodies out there. :-)
space: The space looks exactly like the pictures.  It is spacious, comfortable, and modern.  You will have your own private dining room, living room with full-size sofa bed, kitchenette (including a full size refrigerator, but sadly no stove), bathroom with stand-up shower, and bedroom with a study desk.  All furnishing are new, handpicked to ensure that you feel welcomed and relaxed during your stay.   Additionally, there are several closets to hang your clothes.  You do not have to bring a lot of extra items too.  We provide most necessities, including free WiFi, real Colombian coffee, shampoo/conditioner, soap, towels, and some quick breakfast items. Iron & hair dryer available upon request.
description: Thank you for visiting our listing!   This lovely, private 1-bedroom apartment in the lower level of our townhouse has a dining room, living room, kitchenette, bathroom, and bedroom. All yours!!!  That’s not all...Walk just 5-10 min. to the train (called the “T”) or drive 5-10 min. to the highway. Easy in/out/around. neighborhood_overview: Our house is just outside of the historical Fort Hill neighborhood and a short walk away from the Latino district of the Jamaica Plain neighborhood.  A new bar and grill restaurant just opened up down the street and there are plenty of Latino spots to make your mouth water.  A major supermarket is within walking distance as well.     Public transportation in Boston is great, so the nearby train is your ticket to all the sites and sounds the city has to offer--from Harvard to MIT to the downtown financial district to the Boston Harbor to Paul Revere's home, and beyond.  Boston is known for being a walkable city too, so be sure to bring good walking shoes.
notes: *You will enter the house using the backdoor entrance, next to the garage. *You can park your car in front of or beside the house on the street. The parking is always free but make sure you move your car to the correct side of the street on Fridays for street cleaning. * We prefer check-ins before 12pm or after 4pm, but can be flexible. Just let us know & we can probably work something out. * We live on a lively city street that cuts through the neighborhood. If you prefer the quiet of the suburbs, our space is not for you.
transit: Jackson Square train “T” station is a mere 8-10 minute walk away. You can also walk to Longwood Medical Area & Jamaica Pond.  Several bus lines are nearby as well (e.g. routes 42 & 66). If you are driving, route 93 is about 10 minutes away.  Lastly, you can rent a car or bike for a few hours or for the day using Zipcar or Hubway, respectfully. Both Hubway & Zipcar locations are about 1-2 blocks away.
access: Even though we have a shared entrance, your space is very private and independent.  The shared back entrance has a keypad lock system.  We will give you the code when you arrive. The private lower level basement entrance has an ‘old-fashion’ key. You are welcomed to lock the lower level basement entrance. Parking is free 24/7 street parking in front of and beside the house. Just make sure you don't park your car on the wrong side of the street when there is street cleaning going on (welcome to Boston!).
interaction: We are a busy family, but enjoy orienting our guests to the area.  We have had countless friends and family visit us over the years and consider ourselves unofficial tour guides.  If you ever have any questions along the way, do not hesitate to call, email, or text us.
house_rules: - Quiet hours btw 10pm-8am - Must upload profile picture within TWO weeks of arrival/check-in for security reasons.  If reservation is made with less than two weeks notice, profile pictures must be uploaded at the time of reservation.  Thanks!
host_about: We are a busy family but love using our 20+ years of experience to orient visitors to the Boston area.  We are located super near everything so our place is the perfect ‘home base’ for your Boston adventures. Look forward to meeting you soon!

house_rules: Please do not make a request right away. But send me an email first. Unlike most other Airbnb listings, what we do here is long-term rentals by the year, or by the semester. We try to keep the atmosphere conducive to studying and resting and a couple of house-rules are in place to this end. 1. Towels and linens (sheets, blankets, and pillows) are NOT provided. The bed is full size. 2. No smoking on the premises. 3. No loud music or TV etc. 4. Only for one person (no couples, no visitors). We know this will be a major turn-off to many people, but we believe we can find a like-minded roommate who can have fun outside the house. 5. Check-in time has to be coordinated at least 48 hours ahead. 6. Inside the apartment, we take off our outside shoes. So if you bring your own flip-flops, slippers or some kind of indoor shoes, that will be useful. 7. We use nearby laundromats (no washer and drier in the house).

name: Back Bay/Fenway Place
summary: This one bedroom unit is located in the heart of Boston´s art and cultural district right at the border of Back Bay/South End/Fenway neighbohoods. You will be at walking distances from: Fenway Park, Symphony Hall, Northeast University, Whole Foods market, Museum of Fine Arts, Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, Kelleher Rose Garden, The Emerald Necklace Conservancy, Berklee College of Music, Theaters, New England Conservatory´s Jordan Hall, Boston Conservatory, and much more.
space: The apartment is located on a traditional brownstone building. The unit is located at the lower level at back of the building (not quite a basement yet). There are stairs leading up to the main entrance to the building and stairs going down to the unit. It also have a back entrance that access the buildings parking lot and the unit directly without the need to use the stairs, but you will be arriving thru the main entrance on Mass. Ave.
description: This one bedroom unit is located in the heart of Boston´s art and cultural district right at the border of Back Bay/South End/Fenway neighbohoods. You will be at walking distances from: Fenway Park, Symphony Hall, Northeast University, Whole Foods market, Museum of Fine Arts, Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, Kelleher Rose Garden, The Emerald Necklace Conservancy, Berklee College of Music, Theaters, New England Conservatory´s Jordan Hall, Boston Conservatory, and much more. The apartment is located on a traditional brownstone building. The unit is located at the lower level at back of the building (not quite a basement yet). There are stairs leading up to the main entrance to the building and stairs going down to the unit. It also have a back entrance that access the buildings parking lot and the unit directly without the need to use the stairs, but you will be arriving thru the main entrance on Mass. Ave. Guests can access all areas of the apartment: kitchen, bedroom, living room, bath
neighborhood_overview: The unit is located in the heart of Boston´s art and cultural district right at the border of Back Bay/South End/Fenway neighbohoods. You will be at walking distances from: Symphony Hall, Christian Science Plaza, Museum of Fine Arts, Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, Kelleher Rose Garden, The Emerald Necklace Conservancy, Berklee College of Music, Theaters, New England Conservatory´s Jordan Hall, Boston Conservatory, and, of course, the famous Fenway Park. The Cultural District taps in to the creativity and high energy of a neighborhood that is home to universities, colleges, and some of Boston’s most exciting performing and visual arts institutions.
notes: Please, keep in mind: there are stairs to access the lower level where the unit is located.  The washer and dryer machines are located outside the apartment and is shared with all the tenants in the building.
transit: Parking in Boston is a challenge. The unit itself does not have a dedicated parking space. Boston is a very walkable city and you will be staying close to many places of interest.  Boston is America´s walking city. However, you will be located right by the Massachusetts Avenue subway/Metro stop on the Orange Line and 5 minutes walking to the Symphony stop on the Green Line. The number 1 bus stops right across the street and takes you directly to Harvard University or MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology) and hundreds of other attractions and points of interest. You will not find an more convenient place to stay and get around Boston. However, if you need to have a car, we suggest you check the app SpotHero (there is a website with the same name. You can check availability by searching on the app or the website for the address of the unit. The search will let you know about affordable  parking spaces available in the neighborhood.
access: Guests can access all areas of the apartment: kitchen, bedroom, living room, bathroom.  The unit is tastefully and well decorated thinking on your comfort. The spacious bedroom has a queen size bed, a desk and a chair, it also has space for you to store your clothes.  The living room has a sofa bed where 2 can sleep comfortable and we also provide a air mattress for one more person. We provide all clean and fresh linens, sheets, pillow covers and blankets.  The kitchen is well equipped with everything you need for a basic cooking. We also provide coffee, sugar and cream, as well as tea.   There is washing and dryer machines outside the apartment that are used by all the tenants in the building and guests are welcome to use. The washer and dryer are coin operated.
interaction: We are a group of co-hosts and you are welcome to contact us anytime with your questions and/or needs while staying with us. Once you book the apartment, you will receive information on check in and our contact numbers. We ask you to always contact us thru the Airbnb app, this way, all of us can see your message and see how best we can answer you. The phone numbers are to be used only on a more urgent request.
house_rules: NA
host_about: I'm a married  engineer with my own business building factory automation and I have 11 rental apartments in Boston. Boston has been my home since starting school in 1975. I have not travelled much but my wife loves to and I'm eager to start.

name: Renovated unit in historical Harrison Hill
summary: Modern unit newly renovated with spacious rooms, high ceilings, new oak kitchen and bath.  Bedrooms are spacious with generous walk-in closets, large windows and natural lights.  Large private bath.
space: I live in a Colonial style home which was built in 1929.  It is located on Harrison Hill, a very quiet and historical part of the city. The house is surrounded by Victorians, Philadelphia style, and Queen Ann style homes.
description: Modern unit newly renovated with spacious rooms, high ceilings, new oak kitchen and bath.  Bedrooms are spacious with generous walk-in closets, large windows and natural lights.  Large private bath. I live in a Colonial style home which was built in 1929.  It is located on Harrison Hill, a very quiet and historical part of the city. The house is surrounded by Victorians, Philadelphia style, and Queen Ann style homes. Guest will have a private room with three large windows and large walk-in closet.  Large bathroom in unit for use by guest only.  Guest will have access to living room and kitchen which is fully equipped.  In room, guest is provided with a desk, chair, lamp, full length  mirror, hangers, and bath towels. In the summer months guest will have access to our beautiful zen back yard for instant relaxation near the waterfall and koi pond. I look forward to providing whatever help you may require in regards to directions, information on places of interest to visit and so forth. H
neighborhood_overview: Harrison Hill is a historic part of the city.  Records shows that back in the early 1900 this neighborhood was where the wealthy merchants, bankers,  politicians, doctors, lawyers, and businessmen had their summer homes.  If you have the opportunity to visit Harrison Hill you will witness the evidence of such era through the  architecture designed of such beautiful and intricate homes. Centrally located to the universities, hospitals, restaurants, shops, public transportation both train and bus, and the Kroc Center which feature the state of the art gym and in-door water park.
notes: A complete profile and verified ID is required. At time of booking please provide check-in and check-out time as well.
transit: It is literally 5 minutes walk to the commuter rail which takes you to downtown Boston in approximately 12 minutes.  Also, You can take a bus for the MBTA red line or orange line which is a 15 to  20 minute ride to either train station depending on traffic flow.  Uber is another popular method to get around which shows up to my door in less than 10 minutes when requested.
access: Guest will have a private room with three large windows and large walk-in closet.  Large bathroom in unit for use by guest only.  Guest will have access to living room and kitchen which is fully equipped.  In room, guest is provided with a desk, chair, lamp, full length  mirror, hangers, and bath towels. In the summer months guest will have access to our beautiful zen back yard for instant relaxation near the waterfall and koi pond.
interaction: I look forward to providing whatever help you may require in regards to directions, information on places of interest to visit and so forth.
house_rules: - Quiet hours from 11:00 pm to7:00 am - All shoes must be left at door in tray - Please be respectful and tidy.  Please do not leave dirty dishes in the sink or food on the counter including crumbs - Internet/Wifi use is a privilege, please do not use in any manner that is constituted a violation or infringement of any copyright law
host_about:
I am a world traveler by heart.  I have traveled to Asia, theMiddle East, Europe, the Caribbean, South America, and various states within the US.  I am passionate about new experiences especially learning about different cultures.  I am excited about being an Airbandb host because it will allow me the opportunity to interact with individuals from around the globe on a more intimate level such as sharing my home for what ever length of time.

I believe one can live a fulfilled life by experiences they have.  Live everyday to the fullest.

I want my guest to feel like they are home in my home but experiencing something wonderful and new.

name: Modern convenience close to Longwood Medical
summary: Cozy, modern bedroom in an elegant, spacious apartment close to Longwood Medical Area and easily accessible by public transportation.
space: The spacious apartment is filled with brick walls and elegantly decorated. There is a park across the street and a large community garden behind it, and most of the time it is so quiet you would think you're in the countryside! The apartment has every convenience -- washer and dryer, high-speed internet, dishwasher, and microwave. The room has its own heater and air conditioner for optimal comfort. I'm a potter, so you'll find pottery (mine and others') scattered liberally throughout the apartment.
description: Cozy, modern bedroom in an elegant, spacious apartment close to Longwood Medical Area and easily accessible by public transportation. The spacious apartment is filled with brick walls and elegantly decorated. There is a park across the street and a large community garden behind it, and most of the time it is so quiet you would think you're in the countryside! The apartment has every convenience -- washer and dryer, high-speed internet, dishwasher, and microwave. The room has its own heater and air conditioner for optimal comfort. I'm a potter, so you'll find pottery (mine and others') scattered liberally throughout the apartment. Guests are welcome to use the kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry room, and bathroom. I live in the apartment, so chances are you’ll see me regularly! I am friendly and have lived in the area for 6 years and am happy to answer any questions. Highland Park is a quiet, residential section of Roxbury. Historically the area where wealthy Bostonians had summ
neighborhood_overview: Highland Park is a quiet, residential section of Roxbury. Historically the area where wealthy Bostonians had summer homes, the architecture is beautiful. There is a Frederick Law Olmsted-designed park about a five minute walk away and you'll see many historic homes if you stroll around the area, including the Alvah Kittredge house and William Lloyd Garrison's house.
notes: NA
transit: Highland Park is conveniently located close to the South End, Jamaica Plain, Brookline, Longwood Medical, and route 93. There is plenty of on-street parking available and no permit required. It is a 7 minute walk to the Roxbury Crossing T-stop and a 15 minute walk to Dudley Square, where you can catch the Silver Line and many buses.
access: Guests are welcome to use the kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry room, and bathroom.
interaction: I live in the apartment, so chances are you’ll see me regularly! I am friendly and have lived in the area for 6 years and am happy to answer any questions.

space: Sunny, fully equipped 2 floor, 4 bedroom condo with large front porch! Large eat in kitchen with all amenities, including microwave, wine cooler, pantry. Great for families, business groups and friends. Close to downtown Boston, the Boston Waterfront, great restaurants, hospitals, Fenway Park, Colleges, shopping area. Very accessible to orange line, silver line trains and bus. Franklin Park Zoo and Golf course less than a mile away. Pool table, dart board and work space.  Fun place for a large family on vacation to enjoy after visiting Boston.   The space is NOT to be used for parties of any kind.  This is a smoke free condo.   Coffee and snacks available.  Some breakfast items. Pack & play and car seat are available for use.  Please request ahead of stay.  No charge for use but a charge will be assessed if damaged.

notes: The security deposit amount listed will only be collected if there are damages done to the apartment or its content.  This includes the extra cleaning fee for any excessive use of property.
transit: Bus transit at both ends of the street.  Short bus ride connects you to all train rails.
access: Use of everything in the unit.  There is ONE off street parking space available.  There is also non-permitted street parking is available. Street cleaning happens on Tuesday's during the months of May through November.  Please be mindful of signs.  Cars will be towed at owner's expense.
interaction: Available at any time if needed. Just a phone call away.
house_rules: Our goal is to create a very enjoyable stay for your trip. To do that we have a few requests so that you are as happy as our neighbors are. In respect to our home and our neighbors please review and accept our rental agreement:  Fines will be assessed, if you or your guest do not abide by the following rules: - Please be respectful of our neighbors by keeping noise to a normal level, reducing noise after 11:00 pm, and not lingering in front of the entrance.  -No additional guests without host approval.  -If you live in the area, please do not instant book, contact us first.  -No parties or events. Fines assessed for additional cleaning, trash removal and property damage. A party is grounds for termination of stay and immediate removal with no refund.  -Any furniture that is moved from its original location and requires a movers to return it to its original location will be  assessed a fee.  - Absolutely no under-age drinking.  This will result in immediate cancellation without a refund

name: Amazing & Luxurious Private Room in Boston, MA
summary: Awesome home in Boston! Great amenities, comfortable room and close to multiple forms of transit + street parking is available! The home is also close to Logan Airport !! ***Book now you will love it!!*** Excellent for short & long rentals 1-9 months** Rented to students often!!!*** Almost like a home away from home but, in Boston! Walking distance to all of the Colleges of the Fenway (Harvard, Northeastern, Wentworth & MCPHS etc...) Only a few minutes from Downtown Boston, MA!
space: This Boston Condo is decked out with modern amenities . The home is within one block of Roxbury Orange Line. T stop and nearby the silver bus lines. Additionally only 15 minutes away from Logan Airport!! As a bonus, the walk to the house takes you past -Ashur Restaurant- a nice morning stop for some chai, tea or biriyani. There are other restaurants nearby the T stop; please feel free to check them out! Your bedroom has a private entrance of the main entry hall. Though it is just one room, you should have enough space to make yourself comfortable and get a good night's sleep. The apartment is spacious enough, and all rooms are yours to use (with the exception of the master bedroom). In your room, there is an ac unit and a fast connection to the wireless internet.  You are welcome to use the kitchen for cooking and storing food. The only request is that if you are to use the stove/oven please open windows in kitchen and turn the fan on.  If you have any additional questions, please feel

interaction: We can talk as little or as much as you would like.
house_rules: To ensure we keep the floorboards squeaky clean for our guests’ enjoyment, we have a no shoes policy inside our home. If you use anything in the kitchen please rinse the dishes and load them into the dishwasher. To keep our costs down (and pass those savings on to our guests) we kindly ask that you switch off lights and the A/C or heating when its not in use or leaving the house. Mother nature thanks you too. Do not leave any food out that will attract uninvited pests. The home is pest-free =) We understand that accidents happen. But we do ask that you please let us know when they do. Chances are we can fix them as effortlessly as possible which also means better chances of having your full security deposit returned too. No pets – sorry, Fido has to stay home. Whilst we do a thorough professional clean between each guest stay, we kindly ask that prior to leaving, you clean and put away any dishes or kitchenware used and put any dirty towels in the hamper. As well as take out the trash
host_about:
I am a hard working professional who loves to travel! I am currently going back for my Doctorate Degree and busy with full-time work & full-time school as well as a few investment properties. 

I love pizza, cars & the show Brooklyn nine-nine (Hulu). My favorite genre of music is house, techno and trance. I know all of the best places to eat and see in Boston and would love to share some helpful tips! = ) The condo is very accommodating and relaxing + in a great location! Book with me today you will love it!!

name: Comfy, quite room with all you need.
summary: My place is near public transportation, very bikeable, very walkable and surrounded with green areas where you can enjoy a good time relaxing and exercising. You can get to any destination in just minutes: MGH and Longwood Medical Area (Beth Israel, Dana Farber, Children's Hospital) in about 15-20 minutes, Boston Medical Center in about 5 to 10 minutes, Tufts University and Downtown Boston in about 15 to 20 minutes.  There are two gyms near by, a Walgreen's Pharmacy and the South Bay Mall.

Hello,
I'm a happy, enthusiastic, hard working person who is always motivated to learn new things and new places. I am a man of faith and respect people's beliefs (actually, it's very interesting to share our beliefs and learning from each other!) 
Family and friends are very important to me so I always plan some type of activity to meet them on a regular basis (don't worry, we do outside activities). I also love sports and dancing! Basketball is my favorite so if you'd like to play or dance we can plan on it.

Perfect if you have a car and don't want to pay for parking; this listing is both Modern and private with free Wifi and cable included. name: Guest room on top of Fort Hill, Jamaica Plain/Roxb
summary: This is a beautiful 1875 Brick townhouse with bay window on the very top of historic Fort Hill, overlooking the Boston Skyline. It is very close the the Longwood Medical Area and Museums. We are a 7-10 minute walk to the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line on Boston's MBTA transit system. First floor, front. Boston Rental Reg#STR383293
space: YOUR ROOM: This listing is for our guest room on the 1st floor, street side. 15X12 RM (180 SQ. FT.) FURNISHED TOWNHOUSE BEDROOM. The staircase to the second and third floor has a slight curve but it is manageable for any able-bodied person. The common areas are on the top (third) floor. Bedsheets and towels are provided. THE HOUSE: BRICK 1875 TOWNHOUSE: 4-story, owner-occupied, 4 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms. The room available here is only used as a guest room/short term rental. You are welcome to use either bathroom and there is a laundry machine/dryer in the bathroom on the 1st floor that you are welcome to use. The common areas are on the third floor with a great view and a fully equipped kitchen (e.g. dishwasher, microwave, oven etc.) and you are welcome to use the equipment and to store food in the fridge. HUGE LIVING ROOM: features piano, loft-like open space, kitchen, spectacular panorama of Boston skyline.
description: This is a beautiful 1875 Brick townhouse with bay window on the very top of historic Fort Hill, overlooking the Boston Skyline. It is very close the the Longwood Medical Area and Museums. We are a 7-10 minute walk to the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line on Boston's MBTA transit system. First floor, front. You are welcome to use either bathroom and there is a laundry machine/dryer in the bathroom on the 1st floor that you are welcome to use. The common areas are on the third floor with a g
neighborhood_overview: WHERE: This is right at the juncture of Jamaica Plain, Mission Hill, and the South End - close to just about everything. At the very peak of elegant, chic FORT HILL on the juncture of Jamaica Plain/Mission Hill/Southwest Corridor, just South West of Boston's Back Bay. NEAR: MFA (museums), Hospitals in the Longwood Medical Area - Brigham& Women, Harvard Medical School, Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center, Harvard Children's Hospital, T.H. Chan School of Public Health, Dana Farber Cancer Center, B.U. Med, Mass Art, Mass Pharmacy, NEC, Northeastern, Brigham Circle, Cleary Square. GROCERIES: If you are looking for bigger supermarkets nearby, there are two Stop & Shops - one on Tremont Street (Closest T: Brigham Circle, Green line) and one on Center Street (Jackson Square, Orange line).
notes: ABOUT US: We (a heterosexual married couple, professional classical musician, bi-lingual English/Italian + German physician doing brain imaging research in Boston) are living on the second floor in 1 bedroom.  In total, we list three bedrooms in our house on AirBnB and frequently welcome researchers and physicians from all over the world who enjoy the coziness of our house and the convenient location not far from the Longwood Medical Area. Although we enjoy chatting with you in the kitchen when we meet, the house never seems to crowded - probably because we and our guests usually all have pretty busy schedules. We like our house as it is a peaceful, homey environment to help us relax after busy days at work our out in the city. The view from the bay window in the shared area/the roof top terrace is spectacular! We would be happy to welcome you as our guest! Please don't hesitate to email us in case you have some questions prior to your stay. We hope to provide you a cosy home-base to e
transit: GETTING THERE AND AROUND: 7-10 minutes walk down hill to Roxbury Crossing Orange Line Stop, and 66 Bus to Harvard Square. From Roxbury Crossing, it is a short ride to Boston Downtown and you can change easily change to the other major lines (e.g. Red Line at Downtown Crossing or Park Street to go to South Station or Harvard; Green Line at Park Street). Boston also has rental bikes (e.g. Hubway) and the Boston Bike corridor is located very close to our house. Our place is also an easy UBER ride from the airport (only 8 miles) - which might be a good idea especially when you are travelling with heavy luggage (We live on Fort HILL ;)). Alternatively, you could take the silver line(s) and then hop on the T to Roxbury Crossing.
access: Laundry, Bathroom, Kitchen - all common areas
interaction: The Boston/Cambridge area has a lot to offer and we are happy to give any advice you may need on where to go.
house_rules: 1. No outside guests beyond those on the reservation (neither during the day nor at night). 2. Quiet time after 10pm. 3. Please take off your shoes in the house. 4. Please don't leave dirty dishes in the sink - we have a great dishwasher. 5. When you are not home, please leave your door wide open so that everyone in the house knows who is home and who isn't.
host_about:
Hi, we are Kevin & Fran, a married multicultural couple (US/Italian + German).
Kevin is a professional classical musician (he doesn't practice at home) - you can learn more at Kevin's website - si parla Inglese e l'Italiano.
Kevin's wife Fran is a German physician.

As we are transferring to Munich by July 1, 2019, we have Nik and Alessia (two post-docs, they are a couple and will move into the 4th bedroom (which is currently ours) on Aug 23 and stay for at least a year) as our long-term renters and AirBnB "surrogate hosts". For the other available bedrooms, the renters have been international researchers/postdocs/physicians that are looking for a quiet place to wind down after busy days and we look forward to continuing this tradition as this was always a great fit. 
Our friend Kellie lives in Boston(West Roxbury) and will manage everything locally (e.g. if something is not working properly). Kevin is anticipating to come to Boston every couple of months. Kellie and Kevin will both monitor the AirBnB messages.
