name: La Casa Boheme
summary: La Casa Boheme, cozy, artsy, bohemian vibe, high ceilings (11'), 1890's Mansard style victorian, huge living room, eat in kitchen, record player, guitars, private backyard, driveway, lots of natural light, 12 minute walk to the subway (Orange line Jackson Square), quick Uber or bike ride to downtown Boston, I have a bike you can use.  Close to Jamaica Plain for some nice cafes,  SamAdams brewery, Merengue great Dominican food restaurant a walk away, Supermarket, YMCA, and Franklin Park nearby.
space: The space is a big single family house, on a quiet side street in Boston's Historic Roxbury neighborhood.  This neighborhood used to be where rich people in Boston would have their summer/vacation homes to get away from the city and get some fresh air (before cars came about!).  Nice quiet area, quick to be right in the mix.

This neighborhood used to be where rich people in Boston would have their summer/vacation homes to get away from the city and get some fresh air (before cars came about!).  Nice quiet area, quick to be right in the mix. The house has a huge living room, kitchen, 2.5 baths, backyard, and driveway if you need to park a car.  There is also plenty of street parking as well anyway.  Also, laundry
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is mostly residential, a lot of old historic homes, but for cafes and bars, expect to take an Uber, public transport, or bike.
notes: I do have a little cat, who is shy, but may be something to note for people who are allergic..
transit: 12 minute walk to Jackson Square Orange line subway station, which will take you anywhere you want to go.  Also busses at the end of the street, which you can get anywhere with as well.  Bike share nearby, as well as I have a bike you can use.  Plenty of parking, driveway or street.
access: The house has a huge living room, kitchen, 2.5 baths, backyard, and driveway if you need to park a car.  There is also plenty of street parking as well anyway.  Also, laundry in the basement that you are welcome to use.
interaction: I work from home, and work in the beer business as well, so I am always in and out, happy to give advice on where to go out, etc.  Also there are a couple roommates who are very friendly as well.
house_rules: - No shoes in house - No cigarette smoking in house - If having additional guests, need to let me know
host_about: I'm a chill guy, like my simple things, like my morning espresso, cooking some food, antique hunting, and refurbishing old things.  Often out at night hitting up the town for some nice food and a beer or three (as I work in the beer business), usually know of something interesting going on.

Famous restaurants, shops and venues at your doorstep. Only steps from the Franklin Park Zoo, Roxbury, South End, Boston Public Library branch, The Museum of NCAAA, Samuel Adams Brewery, Jamaica Pond, Boston Bowl, Whole Foods, Strand Theatre, Uphams Corner, Dorchester, Quincy, Ashmont. Stay here for the best experience Boston has to offer!

Only steps from the Franklin Park Zoo, Roxbury, South End, Boston Public Library branch, The Museum of NCAAA, Samuel Adams Brewery, Jamaica Pond, Boston Bowl, Whole Foods, Strand Theatre, Uphams Corner, Dorchester, Quincy, Ashmont. Stay here for the best experience Boston has to offer! PLEASE NOTE: while this listing is for 1 private room (Private Room# 3) there are 4 other private rooms in this space available on the first floor of the house. If you just want to book for yourself or 1 additional person, you can check for the dates you want in this listing or if your desired dates aren't available check the other rooms (#1, #2, #4 or #5) for availability. If you want to stay at this location with 3 or more people you can check the other rooms for availability from the links here:
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located in Grove Hall just south of Boston with quick and easy access to plenty of shops, restaurants, bars and tourists attractions just down the street.
notes: There is plenty of street parking. Sidestreet are resident parking after 6pm (except Sundays).
transit: Less than 5 minutes drive to MBTA Train stations (Stony Brook and Fields Corner stations) and nearby shopping areas along Dorchester Ave and South Bay Mall. Enjoy shopping, dining and nearby tourist attractions. - Uber and Lyft accessible - Quick 5 mile, less than 20 minute ride to reach Boston
access: The guest has access to the private room and common areas, (bathroom, kitchen and living room.) The room is locked and private to you and will only be accessed by you during your stay. No guests. Coin-operated laundry a few footsteps outside of building.
interaction: Happy to provide tips and suggestions as you plan your trip, and if you have any questions during your stay please send requests via Airbnb messaging.
house_rules: - No smoking - No parties, events, loud music or loud noise. - No pets - Self check-in with lockbox - Check in is anytime after 2PM - Check out by 10AM - No free parking available
host_about: I'm originally from Boston. I love movies, traveling, swimming, shooting pool, bowling, ping-pong, football, drinking responsibly, gambling in moderation, roller coasters/theme parks, skiing, and hiking! My favorite movie of all time is The Shawshank Redemption. I like to listen to classic rock mostly Guns N' Roses, Led Zeppelin, The Beatles, The Animals and Boston. I'm an American at heart but my taste buds favor food from Thailand and the Middle East. I love new life experiences, stepping out of my comfort zone, being a good friend, entertaining others and showing people a good time. My life motto is, "Everything in moderation". I'm 30 years old, ambitious and full of life! Here to make your stay in Boston, the best stay possible! Your satisfaction and positive experience is of the utmost importance. Always available to give great travel advice, restaurant and nightlife suggestions or help out with any other questions or concerns that may arise regarding maintenance and repairs. On the Airbnb Messenger you'll be speaking with myself. In the event of an emergency I can be reached by phone via text message or phone call. Come visit our Strong city of Boston! Home Sweet Home, professionally managed for an amazing experience and memorable visit, vacation or tour of Boston!

name: Modern convenience in central Boston location
summary: Elegant, spacious two-bedroom apartment close to Longwood Medical Area and easily accessible by public transportation.
space: The spacious apartment is filled with brick walls and elegantly decorated. There is a park across the street and a large community garden behind it, and most of the time it is so quiet you would think you're in the countryside! The apartment has every convenience -- washer and dryer, high-speed internet, dishwasher, and microwave. There's also a beautiful deck out back that is equipped with table and chairs and a cozy hammock. Both bedrooms have  air conditioners for optimal comfort. Common areas do not have AC but there is a fan. I'm a potter, so you'll find pottery (mine and others') scattered liberally throughout the apartment.
description: Elegant, spacious two-bedroom apartment close to Longwood Medical Area and easily accessible by public transportation. The spacious apartment is filled with brick walls and elegantly decorated. There is a park across the street and a large community garden behind it, and most of the time it is so quiet you would think you're in the countryside! The apartment has every convenience -- washer and dryer, high-speed internet, dishwasher, and microwave. There's also a beautiful deck out back that is equipped with table and chairs and a cozy hammock. Both bedrooms have  air conditioners for optimal comfort. Common areas do not have AC but there is a fan. I'm a potter, so you'll find pottery (mine and others') scattered liberally throughout the apartment. Guests are welcome to use the kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry room, and bathroom. I am friendly and have lived in the area for 6 years and am happy to answer any questions! Highland Park is a quiet, residential section of Roxbury.
neighborhood_overview: Highland Park is a quiet, residential section of Roxbury. Historically the area where wealthy Bostonians had summer homes, the architecture is beautiful. There is a Frederick Law Olmsted-designed park about a five minute walk away and you'll see many historic homes if you stroll around the area, including the Alvah Kittredge house and William Lloyd Garrison's house.
notes: NA
transit: Highland Park is conveniently located close to the South End, Jamaica Plain, Brookline, Longwood Medical, and route 93. There is plenty of on-street parking available and no permit required. It is a 7 minute walk to the Roxbury Crossing T-stop and a 15 minute walk to Dudley Square, where you can catch the Silver Line and many buses.
access: Guests are welcome to use the kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry room, and bathroom.
interaction: I am friendly and have lived in the area for 6 years and am happy to answer any questions!

space: I am doing my best to provide a great value for my guests, offering not only an affordable place to crash for the evening, but also to furnish most every little thing travelers may find useful (e.g. painkillers, sleep aids, sunscreen, healthy snacks, etc.). I humbly ask that you please be quick in the restroom (as there is only one), use the ash trays and trash cans when you smoke on the balcony, do your dishes, and remain reasonably quiet whenever anyone is trying to sleep.

There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on t
neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom,  and smoking only outside. Maintain Realistic Expectations: -We may talk late in the kitchen. -Loud people won't quiet down unless you ask first. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some heavily discolored spots, so no amount of cleaning will make it look sparkling clean. If you need to leave luggage before check-in or after checkout, grab a padlock with your room number (the combination is the same as your lockbox) and use the cabinets by the front door. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on FRIDAY MORNINGS, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on the third floor as well, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the basement. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. You are welcome to hang out and talk in the kitchen or on the balcony, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 12am. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes or weed on the balcony in the back, but NOT indoors or on the front porch!  ^ Penalty: $150 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $150 fine + 3x compensation + f
interaction: MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. /// BARGAINING POLICY: Please don't do it. I consider it disrespectful. I'm familiar with Boston's market prices and my own costs of operation, and I assure you my prices are rationally selected to provide a good value for your money. /// REFUND POLICY: -Want to shorten your stay?   * Send me an alteration request. I accept them all. Then all future days will be refunded in full. -Need to cancel before check-in?  * Full refund! I should still have time for another guest to book. -Choose to cancel after check-in?  * All future dates will be refunded in full.  * But the arrival date is NON-refundable (Website hidden by Airbnb) apologize in advance, but this is an economy listing and it is crucial that each space stably generates revenue every single night. -Your bed/space never cleaned? $
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 30+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Save or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Go to the balcony.) -Don't take an eternity in the shower. -Keep the noise level reasonably low whenever people are trying to sleep. -Keep the common areas clean, particularly in the kitchen and BATHROOM. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some heavily discolored spots, so no amount of cleaning will make it look sparkling clean. (Don't book if you're germaphobic.)
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D

Location: Search "Washington Park Mall" across the street: grocery store, convenience store, dollar store, bank, McDonald's, Walgreens, YMCA, etc.
space: I am doing my best to provide a great value for my guests, offering not only an affordable place to crash for the evening, but also to furnish most every little thing travelers may find useful (e.g. painkillers, sleep aids, sunscreen, healthy snacks, etc.). I humbly ask that you please be quick in the restroom (as there is only one), use the ash trays and trash cans when you smoke on the balcony, do your dishes, and remain reasonably quiet whenever anyone is trying to sleep.

neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom,  and smoking only outside. Maintain Realistic Expectations: -We may talk late in the kitchen. -Loud people won't quiet down unless you ask first. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some heavily discolored spots, so no amount of cleaning will make it look sparkling clean. If you need to leave luggage before check-in or after checkout, grab a padlock with your room number (the combination is the same as your lockbox) and use the cabinets by the front door. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on FRIDAY MORNINGS, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on the third floor as well, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the basement. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. You are welcome to hang out and talk in the kitchen or on the balcony, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 12am. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes or weed on the balcony in the back, but NOT indoors or on the front porch!  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation
interaction: MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. /// BARGAINING POLICY: Please don't do it. I consider it disrespectful. I'm familiar with Boston's market prices and my own costs of operation, and I assure you my prices are rationally selected to provide a good value for your money. /// REFUND POLICY: -Want to shorten your stay?   * Send me an alteration request. I accept them all. Then all future days will be refunded in full. -Need to cancel before check-in?  * Full refund! I should still have time for another guest to book. -Choose to cancel after check-in?  * All future dates will be refunded in full.  * But the arrival date is NON-refundable (Website hidden by Airbnb) apologize in advance, but this is an economy listing and it is crucial that each space stably generates revenue every single night. -Your bed/space never cleaned? $
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 30+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Save or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -People are coming here to SLEEP, so be QUIET!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Just go to the front porch!) {$150 fine} -Don't take anyone's food for stuff. (That's stealing!) {$150 fine + 3x compensation} -Check out on time. (12pm!) {$15-$30 for the first hour; $50 for >1hr} -Keep the kitchen and bathroom CLEAN! -Don't take an eternity in the shower. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some hea
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D

name: Huge, beautiful 4BR+ home, downtown location
summary: Huge (2500+ sq ft), newly renovated three-story house perfect for families or groups. New hardwood floors throughout, new appliances and modern, tasteful decorations. All linens and household items provided--truly your home away from home! Location is in a residential neighborhood across from a park with a public swimming pool and a playground. Minutes to subway, buses and one parking (off-street) available. Easy access (~20 mins walking) to hospitals, museums, Fenway and downtown Boston.
space: SPACE - this is a real house, with plenty of space for the whole family to relax, eat, cook, and decompress after a busy day sightseeing or in between doctors' appointments etc.  All the comforts of home (laundry, dishwasher, vacuum cleaners) are available. LOCATION - parking available for those who drive, but also easily accessible (~10 mins walk) to subway and buses that take you straight to downtown Boston  AMENITIES - I have tried to provide literally everything you might need during your stay; I am also local so if there is something you need, I will try to accommodate it!

neighborhood_overview: NA
notes: NA
transit: My place comes with an off-street spot (hard to find in the city!) and is about 10 minutes walk to the Orange Line subway (in Boston we call it the "T") station. There are also street parking options nearby. From there, you can get virtually everywhere in and around downtown Boston. There is a bus that stops literally across the street, that takes you to Dudley Square which is a major bus station. Fenway, Museum of Fine Arts, and the South End/Back Bay are walkable too--you can see the Boston skyline from the house.
access: I do not make the master suite available unless the number of guests require it. However, otherwise guests have access to the entire house and all amenities (food, cleaning products etc etc) that are provided.
interaction: I live ~30 minutes away and am always available for questions or if something is not working properly.
house_rules: Please remove your shoes when entering the house. Please be considerate of the neighbors, who are still getting used to airbnb guests. We share a small parking lot/yard as well as a front door. Please use the porch entrance (through the parking lot) that leads directly into the house. If using the front door, ensure that BOTH locks in the front remain locked, and avoid making noise and movement outdoors (slamming car doors etc), especially if arriving late at night.  We have one dedicated parking space "J" which is right next to the house. There is a white Hyundai Santa Fe SUV; you can park next to that car. Please do not park in another spot. There is plenty of free on-street parking.  Wifi network name and password are on the bottom of the router, in the bedroom on the left.
host_about: I'm a 30-something working in healthcare, and this is my first home. The co-host is my mom, a Chinese teacher, who has lived in the Boston area for 25+ years (we are originally from Beijing, China). She likes to read, travel and make new friends. We've always had visitors and boarders and are excited to welcome you to our home.

name: Brownstone Modern Bedroom tree top view by the T
summary: •  Well-designed bedroom, in a historical 19th century Boston Brownstone   •  Sunny north facing large windows looking over the treetops and partial city skyline  •  Modern shared bathroom next to bedroom in an international & professional household  •  Located in historic Fort Hill/Highland Park neighborhood  •  5 min walk to the T (Metro) Orange line, 3rd stop from Back Bay city center   •  Walk to Longwood Medical Area, MFA, Northeastern, Fenway & South End ‍♂
space: Welcome to my home at Alvah Kittredge Brownstone in the historic, friendly and diverse neighborhood of Fort Hill/Highland Park. The House:  My 142 year-old, newly restored classic Boston Brownstone home has four equally unique bedrooms available in this 3 level penthouse apartment (see also Custom Bedroom, Master Bedroom Suite, & Loft Bedroom). The Room: A well balanced blend of modern and historic. The bedroom is well designed for a guest and ideal for long term stays.  Plenty of storage to unload into the built-in closet, and drawers. 120sqft (11.2sqm).

neighborhood_overview: Located in historic Fort Hill (Highland Park), my home is in a wonderful & diverse urban residential/bedroom community. Steeped in history since the 1630, this hill has hosted figures such as several of the key founders of Harvard University, George Washington and Henry Knox during the Siege of Boston in the revolution, to the famous abolitionist William Llyod Garrison (whose home is close by and the water fountain in front of the house is designed in his image). After transforming into one of the nation's first streetcar suburbs, now Fort Hill is one of the most sought after and up and coming residential neighborhoods in the city with a diverse community of young professionals, working class and long time residents. The neighborhood is a history lover or architect's dream with every period represented. We have a progressive and engaged group of residents where one of the world's leading experts in urban farming resides, lots of public spaces, urban wilds (including our wild turkeys),
notes: The house is actually as it seems in the photos everyday; well maintained common spaces, so I simply ask guests to clean after themselves to leave the common space in order. The Modern Bedroom is part of my 4 bedroom apartment, and shares a common bathroom next to it with two other guest bedrooms. (3 flights of stairs total) 1 Guests total maximum Cleaning Fee: $30 Our area is considered safe and quiet for Boston, but this is the city, and anything can happen anywhere at any time so I always like to tell people to have common sense in travels in the whole city. We are walking distance to many good cafes, bars, restaurants down Tremont st past the T (metro station) and a ~$8 Uber ride to the nightlife of the Back Bay.
transit: Logan Airport ✈:  Take an airport shuttle bus from your terminal to the Airport T subway station (blue line). Travel in-bound to State T station where you will need to get off and switch to the orange line in-bound. Get off at Roxbury Crossing, and walk up the hill in 5 mins. T (subway/metro)  : The station is Roxbury Crossing and its the 3rd stop to Back Bay. Another 3 more stops from there takes you to Downtown Crossing. Blue Bikes sharing : $6 for a 24 hour pass or $12 for a 72 hour pass. I highly recommend this as a way to discover the city. Right at the T, subway station outside you'll see these bikes and the station is located on Boston's longest bike and walking path, the Southwest Corridor Park. 10 mins to Back Bay, 25 mins to Harvard Square.  Walk : 5-15 minutes walk to local restaurants, bars and grocery store. 15 minutes walking distance to Longwood Medical Area, Northeastern University, Museum of Fine Arts, etc and 25 minutes to Fenway Park, South End. Boston is a walking c
access: Dedicated kitchen pantry (with green personal cups, mugs, bowls, plates, pans and utensils), fridge, washer and dryer, kitchen, living room.
interaction: I'm a social and hospitable host who loves to share his home with others. I was born and raised in Boston, went to university literally down the road at Northeastern and so with plenty of knowledge I would be more than happy to help. I work from home and so usually around if you ever needed anything. My mother lives in a separate apartment (so please feel free to say hi if you cross paths with her outside) and I'm just next door. So I'm always close by and available, but you can have your space as well. Share your experience and take a bit of your stay with you by following us on social media:   Facebk: akbrowstone  Instagrm: @akbrowstone Hashtag: #akbrownstone
house_rules: -Shoes off apartment (slippers available to guests) -No smoking of any substance on the property -Respectful -Friendly -Quiet -Leave things as they were found, clean after yourself  -No dishes left in the sink  -Please use green cups, bowls, utensils and plates and  -Store dry foods in 2nd tall pantry cabinet for your personal food storage and store food in the fridge on the 2nd row -Modern Bedroom is for 1 guest only, sorry can't accommodate couples -Guests may not have additional visiting guests without clearing them with me first
host_about:
Born and raised in Boston, to parents from former Portuguese islands of Cape Verde in the Atlantic ocean. I'm an international, global citizen who loves travel, food, cultures, languages, history, current events and much more. I'm a former biomedical engineer (cardiovascular, sports medicine) now working in residential real estate (investments, design & development, management) & loving it! I also spend time on issues I'm passionate on, one of which is education where I sit on the board of a school.

I also love hosting guests and giving them the best experience in my home that I look for when I travel all over on Airbnb. 

Fun fact: I studied Mandarin for 6 years and sadly forgot most of it, so I'd love to practice it with you if you speak it :)

You can also stay connected with me and my home Alvah Kittredge Brownstone on Instagram and Face book @akBrownstone

Is this your first booking on Airbnb? Use this link to receive $40 off your stay: www.airbnb.com/c/jcorreia20

space: cozy unit with 4rooms, 2 bath, kitchen, living/dining room.
description: located in quiet one way street, cozy room in 4th floor 4room 2baths in brownstone building, one full bed, one closet, newly sanded floor, new paint. Walk to BU medical center, minutes to downtown Boston by bus and subway. cozy unit with 4rooms, 2 bath, kitchen, living/dining room. shared kitchen and baths, simple utensils, fridge, microwave oven, toaster oven. cups/forks/plates if not in the cabinets check the dish washer. Free wi-fi. Host doesn't live in the unit. But will take phone calls and messages to 10p. Located in Boston's south end, 5 minute walk to BU medical area. Easy access to orange line silver line T and buses on Mass Ave. Two blocks from BU Medical center, orange line Mass Ave station. Also within walking distance to NEU. transit: Two blocks from BU Medical center, orange line Mass Ave station. Also within walking distance to NEU. Easy to get to Hynes convention center by rt 1 bus on Mass Ave. Bus stop is 2 min from house.  Silver line 4, 5 on Washington st, rt 1 bus on Mass Ave to Cambridge. On street parking sections of Shawmut street, Camden street don't require resident sticker, you do need to read the signs for street cleaning every other week April - Nov. Within walking distance: 7-Eleven on Washington st @Mass Ave Closest CVS pharmacy on Harrison Ave @Northampton st. Walgreens pharmacy on Washington st @ West Concord st. Supermarket Tropical Foods on Melnea Cass Blvd @Shawmut st China Market and NewYork Market on Washington st @Harald and E. Berkeley st. via silver line 4 and 5.
access: shared kitchen and baths, simple utensils, fridge, microwave oven, toaster oven. cups/forks/plates if not in the cabinets check the dish washer. Free wi-fi.
interaction: Host doesn't live in the unit. But will take phone calls and messages to 10p.
house_rules: - quiet hours 10p-8a
host_about: NA

name: Private Room by a Shopping Center 1.1
summary: [Economy Listing] ONLY ONE BED in a PRIVATE ROOM with A SHARED BATHROOM. * Self-Checkin with a Keycode * Lockable luggage cabinets provided. Convenient Transportation: 13-minute bus ride to the Ruggles Station [on the orange line]. -Airport is a 14-22min drive away. -Boston Common [in downtown Boston] is a 23-minute bike ride or a 21-minute drive away. "Washington Park Mall" across the street: gym, grocery store, convenience store, liquor store, dollar store, pharmacy, bank, McDonald's, etc.
space: I am doing my best to provide a great value for my guests, offering not only an affordable place to crash for the evening, but also to furnish most every little thing travelers may find useful (e.g. painkillers, sleep aids, sunscreen, healthy snacks, etc.). I humbly ask that you please be quick in the restroom (as there is only one), use the ash trays and trash cans when you smoke on the balcony, and remain reasonable quiet whenever anyone is trying to sleep.

neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom, and smoking only outside on the balcony. Checkout by 12pm Check-in after 4pm Cleaning and room changes from 12pm-4pm If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on Friday mornings, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow the signs and you’ll be fine. :)  ^ Otherwise, the on-street parking is FREE. You CAN drop off your luggage before check-in! :D There are grey luggage cabinets in both your bedroom and the kitchen, so you can lock up your belongings while you are away and also leave your luggage before/after your stay.  ^ Locks are provided in your bedroom and in the kitche
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. There is a kitchen stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the basement. You are welcome to hang out and talk on the balcony or in the kitchen, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 11pm. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes on the balcony, but NOT indoors! And NO WEED in this listing either. This is NOT one of my 420-friendly listings!  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation without a refund The three bathrooms are shared, so please be cognizant of what other people find disgusting. Wipe the seat, wipe the floor, or don't use
interaction: MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. /// BARGAINING POLICY: Please don't do it. I consider it disrespectful. I'm familiar with Boston's market prices and my own costs of operation, and I assure you my prices are rationally selected to provide a good value for your money. /// REFUND POLICY: -Want to shorten your stay?   * Send me an alteration request. I accept them all. Then all future days will be refunded in full. -Need to cancel before check-in?  * Full refund! I should still have time for another guest to book. -Choose to cancel after check-in?  * All future dates will be refunded in full.  * But the arrival date is NON-refundable (Website hidden by Airbnb) apologize in advance, but this is an economy listing and it is crucial that each space stably generates revenue every single night. -Your bed/space never cleaned? $
house_rules: 1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. Since I am managing 30+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through Airbnb. This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or sleeping. 2) The Self-Checkin Guide is your friend. Please use it. -Save or print the information before coming if you won't have a stable Internet connection. 3) Only smoke on the balcony.   ^ This is NOT one of my 420-friendly listings, so no marijuana at this one please. 4) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -People are coming here to SLEEP, so be QUIET!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Just go to the front porch!) {$150 fine} -Don't take anyone's food for stuff. (That's stealing!) {$150 fine + 3x compensation} -Check out on time. (12pm!) {$15-$30 for the first hour; $50 for >1hr} -Keep the kitchen and bathroom CLEAN! -Don't take an eternity in the shower. 5) Maint
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D

summary: [Economy Listing] ONLY ONE of two beds in a MIXED-gender, SHARED room. * Self-Checkin with a Keycode * Lockable luggage cabinets provided. neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom, and smoking only outside on the balcony. Checkout by 12pm Check-in after 4pm Cleaning and room changes from 12pm-4pm If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on Friday mornings, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow the signs and you’ll be fine. :)  ^ Otherwise, the on-street parking is FREE. You CAN drop off your luggage before check-in! :D There are grey luggage cabinets in both your bedroom and the kitchen, so you can lock up your belongings while you are away and also leave your luggage before/after your stay.  ^ Locks are provided in your bedroom and in the kitche
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to

name: Spacious Two Bedroom Apartment. Free Parking &Wifi
summary: If you want to experience Boston without breaking your bank, this is the place for you! In a safe neighborhood, this apartment is conveniently located only 15-20 min away from popular destinations: Downtown Boston, Logan Airport, Boston Harbor, etc. This 3rd floor apartment gives you a nice view, and the privacy you need without experiencing the noise of anyone above you. So be ready to enjoy your trip and relax!
space: There are two bedrooms in this apartment, an eat-in kitchen and a living space with a couch for you to sit and watch TV. There is a porch where you can have a glass of wine or your morning coffee when the weather permits.

They take you to either Orange or Redline stations. From there, you can access other subway lines to go anywhere in the city.

Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. You are welcome to hang out and talk in the kitchen or on the balcony, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 12am. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes or weed on the balcony in the back, but NOT indoors or on the front porch!  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation without a re
interaction: MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. /// BARGAINING POLICY: Please don't do it. I consider it disrespectful. I'm familiar with Boston's market prices and my own costs of operation, and I assure you my prices are rationally selected to provide a good value for your money. /// REFUND POLICY: -Want to shorten your stay?   * Send me an alteration request. I accept them all. Then all future days will be refunded in full. -Need to cancel before check-in?  * Full refund! I should still have time for another guest to book. -Choose to cancel after check-in?  * All future dates will be refunded in full.  * But the arrival date is NON-refundable (Website hidden by Airbnb) apologize in advance, but this is an economy listing and it is crucial that each space stably generates revenue every single night. -Your bed/space never cleaned? $
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 30+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Save or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -People are coming here to SLEEP, so be QUIET!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Just go to the front porch!) {$150 fine} -Don't take anyone's food for stuff. (That's stealing!) {$150 fine + 3x compensation} -Check out on time. (12pm!) {$15-$30 for the first hour; $50 for >1hr} -Keep the kitchen and bathroom CLEAN! -Don't take an eternity in the shower. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -Your roommate is a stranger. (And some people suck!)  ^ i.e.
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D

name: Single Room Near Airport, I-93, Silver Line T
summary: Small bedroom with a twin bed, good for one person only, or one adult with a small child. Room is on the third floor of a brick rowhouse in Boston. Close to the T, I-93, airport, cafés, and a grocery store. On-street parking. This is a shared space and there is a cat in the home. Please expand & read the detailed description section and house rules below BEFORE booking to make sure my place is the right fit for you!
space: Great, open, spacious top floor apartment. Beautiful, refinished hardwood floors and new paint. Huge windows and full of sun. Tons of public transportation near by, as well as free on-street parking. The common areas in my building, (hall/stairs,) as well as my windows, are a bit run-down and could use updating, but my apartment is in excellent condition, and is well decorated. Please note that my apartment is on the third floor, so you will have to walk up two sets of narrow stairs with your luggage. This is a twin bed in a child's room that you will be renting while my child is not with me. There is no AC in the bedroom. There is a TV with Netflix and Amazon Prime in the room, but no cable. Super easy commute on public transportation to downtown and Cambridge. 10 minute drive from the airport with no traffic.

neighborhood_overview: If you are not familiar with Roxbury, or living in a city, please be aware that Roxbury is what some would call a "grittier" neighborhood. It is an inner-urban lower income area. I've lived here for three years, and have never felt unsafe in my area, even at night. My neighbors are all great. I grew up in Southern California, and I have lived in diverse, multi-cultural areas most of my life. However, you will see things such as: run down buildings, occasional graffiti, and homeless people panhandling down Melnea Cass Blvd in the warmer months, (mostly towards Massachusetts Ave.) The building was built in 1899, and the windows need updating, so you will hear noises such as: sirens, (the hospital and police station are both within close proximity,) and music and horns from the cars stopped at the traffic light out front. You may also hear: music from the unit below, people occasionally yelling outside, the doors closing in the building as the air pushes up the stairs, the clicking of the
notes: Please remember that this is home sharing! My house is clean - but lived in - it will not be like a hotel. There may be stacks of books, kids toys, and occasional other things you will see.  You are renting a child's room so there will be toys and kid items. Unfortunately there are no available drawers for your clothes in the room, and there is no closet to hang clothes! There is also no iron/ironing board or laundry. I have an indoor only cat in the house, so if you have allergies or dislike animals, this is probably not the place for you. There will be cat hair, and he will probably want to be in the room with you on the bed. (Feel free to shut him out, but please be careful not to lock him in.) The litter box is in a closet in the hall by the bathroom, please do not close that door.  If you are not a cat lover - or tolerant of animals - this is probably not the best place for you to stay. Occasionally he can get sick or have an accident. I sweep constantly, but the cat hair never fu
transit: Ideal commuter location! I-93 is right up the road. Silver Line T Stop Melnea Cass @ Washington is a block away, and goes into downtown in about 20-25 minutes, and to the airport in about 40 minutes. Orange line T Stop Ruggles is a 15 minute walk, and can connect you to all other subway lines. Multiple bus stops one block away, including the #1 bus which will take you into Cambridge. Free, on-street parking is usually available. Zipcar lot right next to Haley House Café. Easy Uber drive into downtown is usually $6-$8 when not surging.
access: Guests have full access to the shared bathroom and kitchen. Coffee and tea available for use. Please provide your own food - I will provide space in the fridge if you wish. There is no dishwasher, so please wash your own dishes. Also, please note that the living room, second bedroom and dining room are private.
interaction: I will leave the keys in a lockbox for you for check-in. Instructions can ne found in your itinerary. I will email you some additional information a day or two before you arrive. I am out a lot, so expect a quiet stay. However, I am always available via Airbnb messaging for help, questions about the apartment, questions about getting around, as well as for any suggestions in the area.
house_rules: BY MAKING THIS RESERVATION YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THE FOLLOWING: 1) You will contact me with a check-in time before your arrival. The room will most likely not be ready before this time. Don't just show up earlier without contacting me and expect the room to be ready. 2) There are NO luggage holds before or after your reservation.  3) You've read the entire listing and are aware that:   - There is a large cat in the home, which means there will be cat hair, a litter box, occasional cat smells, etc.  - There WILL be noise - I live in a low income neighborhood called Roxbury in Boston - There is no closet to hang up clothes, and no drawers to put them in - It is a child's room - I'm on the third floor and you must walk up stairs - This is no iron/ironing board/laundry - Check-in is 1pm or later, check-out is by 11am 4) You will respect my belongings and not play with them/go through drawers, or touch my knick knacks and art.  5) I am not home a lot, so you must be self-sufficient enough to foll
host_about: My name is Monica, and I absolutely love living in Boston! It is a great city with so much to do. I've lived on both coasts, growing up mostly in Southern California before settling in Boston again three years ago. I'm definitely a city girl at heart! I paint and draw and my walls are covered with art that I did myself, as well as an eclectic collection of other random things. I'm also an avid reader and have three giant bookshelves filled with books. I love museums, music, eating out, beer, and wine.

name: Light-Filled Gorgeous New Luxury Apartment
summary: Beautiful new top floor luxury apartment in stately Victorian home.  Extraordinary views of historic park as your front yard!  Your own entrance through a private garden.  Apartment is a light-filled open living space with full kitchen, living area, and bedroom bay with queen bed.  Also includes loft bedroom with 2 twin beds, or could be combined to a king.  Sliding glass kitchen doors open to a rooftop deck with outdoor seating, barbecue, and awning.  This apartment is a truly unique space!
space: This elegant apartment was just completely remodeled, with exquisite artistic touches throughout - from the hand-painted door to the original art tastefully placed throughout.   16-ft high wood-beamed ceiling, large bay windows overlooking the hilltop park with long views out over Boston, and amazing sunsets and sun rises!  Spacious and light-filled living area.  Kitchen includes silas stone quartz countertops, glass tile backsplash and stainless appliances - full-size refrigerator, gas range, dishwasher, and microwave.  Cookware and utensils, blender, dishes and glasses, silverware are all provided.  Cook a beautiful meal - and serve it outdoors on the deck or inside at the lovely dining table!     Living area includes large couch, plush chairs, and 40" TV.   Queen bed and dresser is set off in the bay window, with a gorgeous view of sky, treetops, park, and hills in the distance.     Magnificent full Bath includes glassed-walled shower, toilet & bidet,  and hand-painted vanity and do

Spacious and light-filled living area.  Kitchen includes silas stone quartz countertops, glass tile backsplash and stainless appliances - full-size refrigerator, gas range, dish
neighborhood_overview: Highland Park/Fort Hill is a quiet residential neighborhood with an historic, tree-filled park at its center.   We are a 10-minute drive from the Longwood Medical Area, Northeastern University, and the Museum of Fine Arts.
notes: Located 1 mile from Dana Farber Cancer Institute,  Children's Hospital, Brigham & Women's Hospital, Beth Israel Hospital, and Harvard Medical School.   Also 1 mile from the Museum of Fine Arts and Northeastern University.   1.5 miles to Fenway Park.
transit: We are located a 10-15 minute walk from two MBTA stops on the Orange Line:  Roxbury Crossing and Jackson Square.  But please note that we are on top of a hill, so if you have luggage we recommend taking an Uber or Lyft from the T station.
access: The apartment is located on the 2nd floor of a home, which sits on a private way adjacent to Highland Park - an historic hilltop park with an iconic tower commemorating a Revolutionary War fort.  Guests will enter the property thru a locked wood carved gate, walk across a small garden to your own door, and ascend 1 flight of stairs to your private apartment.  There is free parking on the private way in front.
interaction: We will meet you upon arrival to give you keys and show you the space.  Your entry and space are private, so you will not see us much unless you need us.  We will always be available for questions, guidance, whatever you might need.  We have a quiet household.  No pets in your apartment, please.
house_rules: For safety reasons, we do not recommend bringing children under 5 into the apartment.  The apartment has an open flight of stairs to the loft, and the outdoor deck is a roof deck.   Both have sturdy railings and pose no risk, except possibly to small children who might try to climb.

On street parking sections of Shawmut street, Camden street don't require resident sticker, you do need to read the signs for street cleaning every other week April - Nov. Within walking distance: 7-Eleven on Washington st @Mass Ave Closest CVS pharmacy on Harrison Ave @Northamp

Bedroom, Bathroom, Kitchen, Balcony (for smoking), Basement (for laundry) This particular listing is for a SHARED room on my own floor, so you’ll almost inevitably find yourself dialoguing with me or my housemates at some point.  ^ Potential downside is that we may be hanging out in the kitchen on the opposite
neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom,  and smoking only outside. Maintain Realistic Expectations: -We may talk late in the kitchen. -Your roommate is a stranger, and some people suck. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some heavily discolored spots, so no amount of cleaning will make it look sparkling clean. If you need to leave luggage before check-in or after checkout, grab a padlock with your room number (the combination is the same as your lockbox) and use the cabinets by the front door. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on FRIDAY MORNINGS, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: Bedroom, Bathroom, Kitchen, Balcony (for smoking), Basement (for laundry)
interaction: This particular listing is for a SHARED room on my own floor, so you’ll almost inevitably find yourself dialoguing with me or my housemates at some point.  ^ Potential downside is that we may be hanging out in the kitchen on the opposite end of the hallway past 10pm. If you enjoy meeting new people during your stays and are not a light sleeper, this place is for you! (If you wake up easily and just want some privacy, I suggest you opt for one of my private listings.) You need to use "The Self-Checkin Guide" to get inside. I will, of course, be available for questions via texting through the AirBNB app, but I am not always here to let you in, so I have tried to make the process of getting settled in easy and intuitive.  As for my housemates, they are all well aware which rooms are being AirBNBed but are rarely aware of specifically who is coming and going, so just start with hi, and enjoy your stay in Boston. :)
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 30+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Save or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Go to the balcony.) -Don't take an eternity in the shower. -Keep the noise level reasonably low whenever people are trying to sleep. -Keep the common areas clean, particularly in the kitchen and BATHROOM. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -We may talk late in the kitchen. (Don't book if you're a light sleeper.) (Tell us when you’re trying to sleep; otherwise, we don’t know to quiet down or move to the balcony.) -We
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D

name: Alaska Street R53
summary: Enjoy your experience in an original 1890 Victorian home in historic Boston, Roxbury. This is a four bedroom house in a quiet neighborhood. It has a shared kitchen and living space.  Public transportation (bus) is a three minute walk away. Most guests prefer to UBER to where they want to go. It costs under $10 to get to downtown. It is a +/-5 minute drive to the South End and Newbury Street which has a variety of restaurants and unique shopping venues.
space: This quiet and cozy room is in the back of the house. It has an exceptional stone accent wall inside the room. The room has a bar closet with a mini-fridge and small sink. There is also a large granite desk.  A private bathroom inside the room is floor-to-ceiling stone tiles. It has a super quiet exhaust fan. The shower includes body jets on the wall. Room is located on the third floor.

name: Instaworthy View★Spacious★Large Groups★Close to DT
summary: Welcome to Boston! Our stunning 5 Bedroom 3 Bathroom Apartment is the perfect fit for your visit. This space is ideal for any type of group, large or small. Minutes to local transportation, and tucked away in Boston’s hidden gem, Fort Hill. With scenic views of Boston’s historic Highland Park and Skyline, this newly renovated apartment is just for you! On-site parking included!	 Enjoy your stay! ♥Miya & Dan
space: We are so excited to host you and your group! Our apartment is perfect for large groups, families and gatherings! When you enter the main living floor you will be awe struck by the large open floor plan with exposed vintage fireplaces!!   The open floor plan comes complete with kitchen, dining, and a living room, creating the perfect gathering space for your family or large group. The kitchen is complete with all the necessities to create a gourmet meal or just a quick bite.  Too tired from exploring the city, there are plenty of local restaurants nearby for dining in or take out.   This two story apartment features all the necessities including Wifi, Netflix , central A/C & heating, fresh towels, in-unit washer and dryer, and a private deck furnished for outdoor enjoyment!

Boston is a small city, most places are walkable or just a short drive. Downtown is about 3 miles away and Fenway Park is a close 2 miles away.

Thank you!

name: La Casa Boheme 2
summary: La Casa Boheme bedroom 2. Great house with a relaxed vibe. Open, sunny living spaces in classic 19th century mansard Victorian.  Quiet street with parking and easy walk to public transport.  Quick ride to downtown Boston. (I do have a shy and very nice little cat, that you may not even see, but just in case you are allergic to cats, maybe a little allergy medication is good to bring)
space: 1 bedroom out of the 4 in the house, there are also 2.5 baths, kitchen, living room, also have laundry in the basement, front porch, backyard, we recycle, compost, and use green energy. (Also  friendly )
description: La Casa Boheme bedroom 2. Great house with a relaxed vibe. Open, sunny living spaces in classic 19th century mansard Victorian.  Quiet street with parking and easy walk to public transport.  Quick ride to downtown Boston. (I do have a shy and very nice little cat, that you may not even see, but just in case you are allergic to cats, maybe a little allergy medication is good to bring) 1 bedroom out of the 4 in the house, there are also 2.5 baths, kitchen, living room, also have laundry in the basement, front porch, backyard, we recycle, compost, and use green energy. (Also  friendly ) It's pretty open.. I am always in and out a bit, but happy to socialize whenever I’m around or can call/text if you need anything at all.  I also work in the beer business so can give good recommendations for bars and restaurants. The area is pretty residential, but short ride into the city center.  There is a great pizzeria nearby, Mario's.  Also close by, there is a great Dominican Restaurant, called Mer
neighborhood_overview: The area is pretty residential, but short ride into the city center.  There is a great pizzeria nearby, Mario's.  Also close by, there is a great Dominican Restaurant, called Merengue.  There is a Popeyes, McDonalds, and Walgreens down the street.  As well as some very nice parks, and lot of old houses with character, if you take a walk into the Fort Hill neighborhood.
notes: Other people live in the house, and are all friendly.  It’s a big 4 bedroom single family house.  I am in one bedroom, and rent out two others to young professionals in Boston.  This 4th bedroom is the one listed here.  So this is my home as well as for a couple others.
transit: The orange line, Jackson Square stop, is about a 12 minute walk away, which will bring you anywhere you want to go..!  There are also busses at the end of the street that will bring you into Dudley Square, and connects to all busses there as well.  There are bike rental stations down the street, if you want to bike around.  Then there is always Uber and not very expensive to bring you right into town.
access: It's pretty open..
interaction: I am always in and out a bit, but happy to socialize whenever I’m around or can call/text if you need anything at all.  I also work in the beer business so can give good recommendations for bars and restaurants.
house_rules: - I ask for people to take off their shoes - No Shoes, respectful house, noise to be kept down late at night
host_about: I'm a chill guy, like my simple things, like my morning espresso, cooking some food, antique hunting, and refurbishing old things.  Often out at night hitting up the town for some nice food and a beer or three (as I work in the beer business), usually know of something interesting going on.

Bah

name: Shared Space by the Franklin Park 1.1
summary: [Economy Listing] This is for 1 of 2 beds in a MIXED-GENDER, SHARED space.  ^ Read "Other things to note" before booking. Check-out before 12pm. Check-in after 4pm.  ^ Cleaning done from 12pm-4pm. 4min walk to two high-frequency buses: ^ 21min on buses 22 and 44 to RUGGLES on the orange line. ^ 14min on buses 22 and 44 to JACKSON SQUARE on the orange line. 5min walk to three convenience stores, but Stop & Shop is an inconvenient 13min walk away.
space: This is a 2-story, 6-room home that has been converted into an 6-bedroom accommodation with 2 bathrooms. With 11 guests (and 10 of those guests comfortable booking a shared room), there is a high likelihood of bumping into fellow travelers and having engaging exchanges in your downtime.

This is a 2-story, 6-room home that has been converted into an 6-bedroom accommodation with 2 bathrooms. With 11 guests (and 10 of those guests comfortable booking a shared room), there is a high likelihood of bumping into fellow travelers and having engaging exchanges in your downtime. The kitchen  is the primary common place for talking. Please only smoke on the balcony (not on the front porch). The two bathrooms are also shared, so please clean up your hair and be respectful with your shower time. I just got back in school for the fall and h
neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Check-out before 12pm. Check-in after 12pm.  ^ Cleaning done in the evenings after the hosts get off work.  ^ Clean towels and sheets accessible for those wanting to shower/nap beforehand. This room only uses tapestries draped over the doorways; this room does NOT have lockable doors. (Lockable cabinets, however, are provided for your belongings.) If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on Friday mornings, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street (or else you'll get towed). Follow the signs and you’ll be fine. :)  ^ Otherwise, the on-street parking is FREE. Please be cognizant of the fact that there will be about TEN GUESTS staying at any given time.  ^ Out of respect for the other 10 guests, you are expected to clean up after yourself in the kitchen and three bathrooms.  ^ Housecleaning will only be done ONCE A WEEK (rather than every day), so please be extra conscientious o
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: The kitchen  is the primary common place for talking. Please only smoke on the balcony (not on the front porch). The two bathrooms are also shared, so please clean up your hair and be respectful with your shower time.
interaction: I just got back in school for the fall and have not had time to properly develop this property. I intend to make steady improvements in the aesthetics and provisions until May, when I will resume short-term AirBNB stays for the summer.
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 40+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Screenshot or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -People are coming here to SLEEP, so be QUIET!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Just go to the front porch!) {$150 fine} -Don't take anyone's food for stuff. (That's stealing!) {$150 fine + 3x compensation} -Check out on time. (11am!) {$15-$30 for the first hour; $50 for >1hr} -Keep the kitchen and bathroom CLEAN! -Don't take an eternity in the shower. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -Your roommate is a stranger. (And some people suck!)
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D
