This is a 2-story, 6-room home that has been converted into an 6-bedroom accommodation with 2 bathrooms. With 11 guests (and 10 of those guests comfortable booking a shared room), there is a high likelihood of bumping into fellow travelers and having engaging exchanges in your downtime. There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on each floor, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee. There are some lockable luggage cabinets
neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Check-out before 12pm. Check-in after 12pm.  ^ Cleaning done in the evenings after the hosts get off work.  ^ Clean towels and sheets accessible for those wanting to shower/nap beforehand. This room only uses tapestries draped over the doorways; this room does NOT have lockable doors. (Lockable cabinets, however, are provided for your belongings.) There MAY be someone sleeping on the couch pictured beside your bed. (This thus far has only been happening about once a week, but may occur more often during the summer, when rates around events become extortionate.) If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on Friday mornings, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street (or else you'll get towed). Follow the signs and you’ll be fine. :)  ^ Otherwise, the on-street parking is FREE. Please be cognizant of the fact that there will be about TEN GUESTS/RESIDENTS staying at any given time.
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on each floor, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee. There are some lockable luggage cabinets in the main hallway and in your bedroom. Detergent is provided for doing laundry; the washer and dryer are in the basement. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. You are welcome to hang out and talk in the kitchen or on the balcony, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 12am. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes or weed on the balcony, but NOT indoors or on the front porch!  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation without a refu
interaction: MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. /// BARGAINING POLICY: Please don't do it. I consider it disrespectful. I'm familiar with Boston's market prices and my own costs of operation, and I assure you my prices are rationally selected to provide a good value for your money. /// REFUND POLICY: -Want to shorten your stay?   * Send me an alteration request. I accept them all. Then all future days will be refunded in full. -Need to cancel before check-in?  * Full refund! I should still have time for another guest to book. -Choose to cancel after check-in?  * All future dates will be refunded in full.  * But the arrival date is NON-refundable (Website hidden by Airbnb) apologize in advance, but this is an economy listing and it is crucial that each space stably generates revenue every single night. -Your bed/space never cleaned? $
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 40+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Screenshot or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -People are coming here to SLEEP, so be QUIET!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Just go to the front porch!) {$150 fine} -Don't take anyone's food for stuff. (That's stealing!) {$150 fine + 3x compensation} -Check out on time. (11am!) {$15-$30 for the first hour; $50 for >1hr} -Keep the kitchen and bathroom CLEAN! -Don't take an eternity in the shower. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -Your roommate is a stranger. (And some people suck!)
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D
amenities: {Wifi,Kitchen,"Free street parking",Heating,Washer,Dryer,"Smoke detector","Carbon monoxide detector","First aid kit",Essentials,Shampoo,Hangers,"Hair dryer",Iron,"Self check-in",Lockbox,"Hot water","Bed linens","Extra pillows and blankets",Microwave,"Coffee maker",Refrigerator,Dishwasher,"Dishes and silverware","Cooking basics",Oven,Stove,"Patio or balcony"}

space: This is a 2-story, 6-room home that has been converted into an 6-bedroom accommodation with 2 bathrooms. I am doing my best to provide a great value for my guests, offering not only an affordable place to crash for the evening, but also to furnish most every little thing travelers may find useful (e.g. painkillers, sleep aids, sunscreen, healthy snacks, etc.). I humbly ask that you please be quick in the restroom (as there are only two), use the ash trays and trash cans when you smoke on the balcony, do your dishes, and remain reasonably quiet whenever anyone is trying to sleep.

name: A historic home near Longwood & NEU
summary: Our 1860 single family home is located in a safe, historic Boston neighborhood only 3 stops to Back Bay station.  The house was renovated in 2011 with central air, modern kitchen, 5 bedrooms, & 4.5 baths. It is filled with artwork, books, and fine furniture. This room has a queen bed, HDTV, large closet, dresser, down comforter,  fresh sheets and towels. The room shares a bath with one other guest room.  Free onsite laundry, coffee and tea. No other bills.
space: The house has 3,500 square feet of space on 4 floors: *Floor 1: 1,000 square feet of common space (see “guest access“ description below), outdoor deck, backyard *Floor 2: Guest rooms, guest baths, free laundry, outdoor deck *Floor 3: owner’s private space *Basement: owner‘s private space

Coffee and tea are always ava
neighborhood_overview: The Fort Hill neighborhood is safe, beautiful, and well located in the geographic center of Boston. Subway,  bus stops, and Northeastern University are in walking distance. Harvard Medical School and Longwood Medical Area are 0.5 to 1 mile away. There are 4 grocery stores between 0.7 and 1.2 miles away.  The neighborhood is home to the oldest continuously operated wood structure church in Boston, a gorgeous Federal style white church in Elliott Square. It is also home to the Cochituate Standpipe, a water tower located on an American Revolution-era fort. The fort was used to defend Boston from invasion from western roads. The neighborhood is packed with historic homes.
notes: We expect guests to share our values of inclusion: all races, religions, loves, genders, birthplaces, and sizes are welcome in our home.  We have two gentle and friendly cats who warm up quickly to new people.  Due to new local laws, we only accept guest stays of 32 days or more. The nightly rate you see is priced for stays between 32 and 90 days. A small additional discount will be applied to stays longer than 90 days. Outside of this, we don’t negotiate the price.  In your booking request please respond briefly to these questions: 1. What experience, if any, do you have using Airbnb or similar short term stay services? 2. What experience, if any, do you have living in a shared space? 3. How would you describe your ideal living environment? Thanks for looking at our home!
transit: The Roxbury Crossing MBTA orange line  subway station is a 7-8 minute walk from the house. There are bus stops 1-3 blocks away in all directions. Lyft and Uber rides are always nearby. To plan a commute, nearby Alvah Kittredge Park is a good starting point.
access: Guests have full access to common spaces throughout the first floor: a huge living room with gas fireplace, a library, dining room, half bath, and a very well-equipped kitchen with your own mini fridge and food storage.  Coffee and tea are always available free of charge. There is a deck and small backyard just outside the kitchen door.
interaction: I live in the house and have one permanent housemate. One of us is always available in person or by phone (you will have our cell phones after booking).
house_rules: - Quiet hours 10 pm to 8am - We are a shoeless household - Please use the countertop appliances and dinnerware as you wish, but give us a day‘s notice if you want to cook a meal using the stove and oven.
host_about:
A little more about me: I was born near Boston to a family that arrived in the 1920s from Ireland. I live within one mile of my grandparents' first rented apartments.  I'm still close to a rather large extended family and network of friends throughout the Boston area.  We have loved being here, for 3 generations in a row. In my professional life I am a health policy researcher and professor of medicine in Boston. Outside of family and work, my interests include art, architecture, and music. 

Walking distance: 
Fort Hill and Highland Park are great for walking. In the mornings, head up to a revolutionary war fort (5 minutes) and an 1875 water standpipe that brought city plumbing to Roxbury. Eliot Square a few blocks away is home to an classic New England 1805 church, the oldest surviving wood structure church in the city. Walk 10 minutes to Dudley Square in one direction or Roxbury Crossing and the orange line MBTA subway Stationen the other. 

Short distance by subway or cab:
We are located within three subway stops of the Boston Symphony Orchestra (Andris Nelsons conducting is not to be missed), and 10 minutes by cab to the Museum of Fine Arts and the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum. We are within four subway stops of Copley Square, the Pru, South End Restaurants and cafes, shopping on Newbury and Charles Streets, Boston Public Gardens. You are staying in one of Boston's most exciting neighborhoods on one of its best streets.

If you want to explore Cambridge, Fenway Park, Harvard, MIT, the North End, the Boston Aquarium, Olmsted's Emerald Necklace, the Rose Kennedy Greenway, Boston Harbor (the "hahbah") or wherever your travel guide takes you, this home is located centrally. 

I hope you fall in love with my beautiful home and city during your visit.

name: Stayloom's Charming Upscale Duplex | near T
summary: Stayloom is dedicated to giving you a luxurious and authentic travel experience. From the refurbished table to the local artwork, our homes are furnished so every detail has a genuine connection to the surrounding community. Spacious and suitable for groups of all sizes, each Stayloom home is crafted with the intention of bringing family and friends together (Website hidden by Airbnb) Stay in style. Stay for the stories. Stayloom.
space: Our luxury duplex is the ultimate travel destination for large groups who want 2 unique spaces in which to relax and recharge. 2 unique apartments await you, located just steps from the subway and stocked with modern amenities. The perfect place to gather, whether you are family, friends, or colleagues.  - 2 unique apartments means you have access to 2 kitchens, 2 living areas, and more. - Professional interior design - Plant wall in 2nd bedroom is a touch we just adore - Free in-unit laundry available (in 1 apartment only) - Extra luxury rollaway beds comfortably accommodate large groups - Free on-street parking - All beds feature Tempurpedic-quality mattresses and silky, high thread count linens. - All bathrooms are immaculate and include essential toiletries and stacks of plush cotton towels.

neighborhood_overview: While charmingly historic, the Fort Hill neighborhood is pulsing with modern energy. With the South End, Fenway, and Downtown all nearby, Boston’s culinary and cultural scenes are at your fingertips. A dynamic mix of local families, young professionals, and students, Fort Hill has a unique flavor all its own while remaining deeply connected to Boston’s rich history. All guests after booking will receive a personalized list of recommendations including locals favorite spots, restaurants, and activities. We will provide detailed information and guides on the surrounding area to enhance your overall experience.
notes: If you have questions you need answered before securing your booking, or you simply want to talk with us first, reach out to our Stayloom team with an inquiry before a reservation request. Please also note that one-night stays on the weekend or reservations that start or end on a Saturday may be subject to an additional fee. Want more options? Check out Stayloom’s other homes located in popular destinations across the nation such as Boston, Savannah, New Orleans, and more! At Stayloom, we make sure you find the perfect fit. Damage deposit: $699 (non-Airbnb reservations only)
transit: The closest subway stop is less than a ten minute walk away, making the whole city readily accessible within minutes. The nearest Blue Bike bicycle share location is a five minute walk away. There are also several private transportation options at your disposal (Uber, Zipcar). If you do plan on driving, please note that while we do not have off-street parking at our home, there is no shortage of safe, free on-street parking available.
access: The entire home is for your exclusive use.
interaction: You will have complete privacy here, however every question or concern you may have before or during your stay will be promptly addressed via messenger or phone. In the case of a maintenance emergency, our ground team is available to assist you. Entry is simple, there’s no need to coordinate key pick up.
house_rules: - Please respect Boston's noise ordinance. Quiet hours begin at 11:00pm, weekdays & weekends. Thank you for helping to keep good relations with our neighbors! - Any visit from the Boston police department will result in immediate eviction without refund.
host_about:
I am a proud member of the Stayloom network! My personal loves include perfecting my Boston clam chowder recipe, traveling as much as I can, and keeping up to date on current events. Part of the joy for me is in providing a platform to let you discover what I love about my two favorite cities. I hope I have the chance to show you Boston and New York's amazing energies and vibrant cultures.

Cheers,

neighborhood_overview: While charmingly historic, the Fort Hill neighborhood is pulsing with modern energy. With the South End, Fenway, and Downtown all nearby, Boston’s culinary and cultural scenes are at your fingertips. A dynamic mix of local families, young professionals, and students, Fort Hill has a unique flavor all its own while remaining deeply connected to Boston’s rich history. All guests after booking will receive a personalized list of recommendations including locals favorite spots, restaurants, and activities. We will provide detailed information and guides on the surrounding area to enhance your overall experience.
notes: If you have questions you need answered before securing your booking, or you simply want to talk with us first, reach out to our Stayloom team with an inquiry before a reservation request. Please also note that one-night stays on the weekend or reservations that start or end on a Saturday may be subject to an additional fee. 1 apartment has free in-unit laundry; the other 2 do not have laundry facilities. Want more options? Check out Stayloom’s other homes located in popular destinations across the nation such as Boston, Savannah, New Orleans, and more! At Stayloom, we make sure you find the perfect fit. Damage deposit: $999 (non-Airbnb reservations only)
transit: The closest subway stop is less than a ten minute walk away, making the whole city readily accessible within minutes. The nearest Blue Bike bicycle share location is a five minute walk away. There are also several private transportation options at your disposal (Uber, Zipcar). If you do plan on driving, please note that while we do not have off-street parking at our home, there is no shortage of safe, free on-street parking available.
access: The entire home is for your exclusive use.
interaction: You will have complete privacy here, however every question or concern you may have before or during your stay will be promptly addressed via messenger or phone. In the case of a maintenance emergency, our ground team is available to assist you. Entry is simple, there’s no need to coordinate key pick up.
house_rules: - Please respect Boston's noise ordinance. Quiet hours begin at 11:00pm, weekdays & weekends. Thank you for helping to keep good relations with our neighbors! - Any visit from the Boston police department will result in immediate eviction without refund.
host_about:
I am a proud member of the Stayloom network! My personal loves include perfecting my Boston clam chowder recipe, traveling as much as I can, and keeping up to date on current events. Part of the joy for me is in providing a platform to let you discover what I love about my two favorite cities. I hope I have the chance to show you Boston and New York's amazing energies and vibrant cultures.

Cheers,
Frank

neighborhood_overview: Once a farming town on the outskirts of Boston, Roxbury began its transformation from agricultural, to industrial, to residential uses in the early nineteenth century. Today Roxbury is home to a diverse community and many young professionals. Few neighborhoods in Boston capture the city’s golden days the way the Roxbury does. The neighborhood is suburban, quiet, and relaxed.
notes: The apartment is located in a residential area so it is very quiet for those who are looking for a comfortable and quiet stay.
transit: Bus line 42 of the MBTA runs frequently and is less than 5 minutes away. Jackson Square (Orange Line) is less than 10 minutes away, additionally.

summary: Located in a historic Boston neighborhood, our 1860 colonial five bedroom home is updated, quiet, and cozy. The house is filled with light, artwork, books, and cozy spots everywhere. description: Located in a historic Boston neighborhood, our (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) colonial five bedroom home is updated, quiet, and cozy. The house is filled with light, artwork, books, and cozy spots everywhere. All three bedrooms in this listing are located together on the second floor. One has a private bath. The other two share a bath. Parking available off street for small extra charge. The home is located in Highland Park, a beautiful and historic hill top neighborhood on Fort Hill in Roxbury. The neighborhood is home to the oldest continuously operated wood structure church in Boston, a gorgeous Federal style white church in Elliott Square. It is also home to the Cochituate Standpipe, a water tower located on an American Revolution-era fort that was used to defend Boston from invasion from western roads. The neighborhood is packed with historic homes. You will be staying in one of them, a house built in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) that was gutted and fully updated with modern c
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in Highland Park, a beautiful and historic hill top neighborhood on Fort Hill in Roxbury. The neighborhood is home to the oldest continuously operated wood structure church in Boston, a gorgeous Federal style white church in Elliott Square. It is also home to the Cochituate Standpipe, a water tower located on an American Revolution-era fort that was used to defend Boston from invasion from western roads. The neighborhood is packed with historic homes. You will be staying in one of them, a house built in 1860 that was gutted and fully updated with modern comforts in 2011.
notes: NA
transit: (Hidden by Airbnb) maps has excellent, up-to date information on public transportation. As a starting point for your travels, use Alvah Kittredge Park, located 100 yards from our house. Our house is on a one-block quiet side street leading to the park. Please understand that we cannot give you our address or person contact information before you book. Airbnb does not allow us to share it.
access: NA
interaction: NA
house_rules: - Quiet hours 10 pm to 8am
host_about:
A little more about me: I was born near Boston to a family that arrived in the 1920s from Ireland. I live within one mile of my grandparents' first rented apartments.  I'm still close to a rather large extended family and network of friends throughout the Boston area.  We have loved being here, for 3 generations in a row. In my professional life I am a health policy researcher and professor of medicine in Boston. Outside of family and work, my interests include art, architecture, and music. 

Walking distance: 
Fort Hill and Highland Park are great for walking. In the mornings, head up to a revolutionary war fort (5 minutes) and an 1875 water standpipe that brought city plumbing to Roxbury. Eliot Square a few blocks away is home to an classic New England 1805 church, the oldest surviving wood structure church in the city. Walk 10 minutes to Dudley Square in one direction or Roxbury Crossing and the orange line MBTA subway Stationen the other. 

Short distance by subway or cab:
We are located within three subway stops of the Boston Symphony Orchestra (Andris Nelsons conducting is not to be missed), and 10 minutes by cab to the Museum of Fine Arts and the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum. We are within four subway stops of Copley Square, the Pru, South End Restaurants and cafes, shopping on Newbury and Charles Streets, Boston Public Gardens. You are staying in one of Boston's most exciting neighborhoods on one of its best streets.

If you want to explore Cambridge, Fenway Park, Harvard, MIT, the North End, the Boston Aquarium, Olmsted's Emerald Necklace, the Rose Kennedy Greenway, Boston Harbor (the "hahbah") or wherever your travel guide takes you, this home is located centrally. 

I hope you fall in love with my beautiful home and city during your visit.

Paramount in my life is being happy; absolutely everything else is secondary-- it is a very fulfilling experience.

Hosting and meeting people from all over the world is amazing- it makes me happy also; it is incredible what technology has allowed us to achieve in this way, here it is actually bringing people together. neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Check-out before 11am. Check-in after 4pm.  ^ Cleaning done between 11am-4pm.  ^ Clean towels and sheets accessible for those wanting to shower/nap beforehand. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on Friday mornings, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street (or else you'll get towed). Follow the signs and you’ll be fine. :)  ^ Otherwise, the on-street parking is FREE. Please be cognizant of the fact that there will be about TEN GUESTS staying at any given time.  ^ Out of respect for the other 10 guests, you are expected to clean up after yourself in the kitchen and two bathrooms. /// MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. REFUND POLICY: This is an ECONOMY LISTING, so I ONLY offer refunds that do NOT lose money!
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: The kitchen is the primary common place for talking. Please only smoke on the balcony (not on the front porch). The two bathrooms are also shared, so please clean up your hair and be respectful with your shower time.
interaction: I just got back in school for the fall and have not had time to properly develop this property. I intend to make steady improvements in the aesthetics and provisions until May, when I will resume short-term AirBNB stays for the summer.
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 40+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Screenshot or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -People are coming here to SLEEP, so be QUIET!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Just go to the front porch!) {$150 fine} -Don't take anyone's food for stuff. (That's stealing!) {$150 fine + 3x compensation} -Check out on time. (11am!) {$15-$30 for the first hour; $50 for >1hr} -Keep the kitchen and bathroom CLEAN! -Don't take an eternity in the shower. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -Your roommate is a stranger. (And some people suck!)
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D

Check-in after 4pm. 4min walk to the FRANKLIN PARK.  ^ Green space as vast as downtown Boston. 4min walk to two high-frequency buses: ^ 21min on buses 22 and 44 to RUGGLES on the orange line. ^ 14min on buses 22 and 44 to JACKSON SQUARE on the orange line. 5min walk to three convenience stores, but Stop & Shop is an inconvenient 13min walk away.
space: This is a 2-story, 6-room home that has been converted into an 6-bedroom accommodation with 2 bathrooms. With 10 guests (and 4-9 of those guests comfortable booking a shared room), there is a high likelihood of bumping into fellow travelers and having engaging exchanges in your downtime.
description: This is for a PRIVATE room with 1 bed in a house with 2 shared bathrooms.  ^ Read "Other things to note" before booking. Check-out before 12pm. This is a 2-story, 6-room home that has been converted into an 6-bedroom accommodation with 2 bathrooms. With 10 guests (and 4-9 of those guests comfortable booking a shared room), there is a high likelihood of bumping into fellow travelers and having engaging exchanges in your downtime. The kitchen is the primary common place for talking. Please only smoke on the balcony (not on the front porch). The two bathrooms are also shared, so please clean up your hair and be respectful with your shower time. I
neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Check-out before 12pm. Check-in after 12pm.  ^ Cleaning done in the evenings after the hosts get off work.  ^ Clean towels and sheets accessible for those wanting to shower/nap beforehand. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on Friday mornings, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street (or else you'll get towed). Follow the signs and you’ll be fine. :)  ^ Otherwise, the on-street parking is FREE. Please be cognizant of the fact that there will be about TEN GUESTS staying at any given time.  ^ Out of respect for the other 9 guests, you are expected to clean up after yourself in the kitchen and two bathrooms. MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. REFUND POLICY: This is an ECONOMY LISTING, so I ONLY offer refunds
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: The kitchen is the primary common place for talking. Please only smoke on the balcony (not on the front porch). The two bathrooms are also shared, so please clean up your hair and be respectful with your shower time.
interaction: I just got back in school for the fall and have not had time to properly develop this property. I intend to make steady improvements in the aesthetics and provisions until May, when I will resume short-term AirBNB stays for the summer.
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 40+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Screenshot or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -People are coming here to SLEEP, so be QUIET!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Just go to the front porch!) {$150 fine} -Don't take anyone's food for stuff. (That's stealing!) {$150 fine + 3x compensation} -Check out on time. (11am!) {$15-$30 for the first hour; $50 for >1hr} -Keep the kitchen and bathroom CLEAN! -Don't take an eternity in the shower. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -Your roommate is a stranger. (And some people suck!)
host_about: Nerdy and quirky and loving it. :D

name: Traveling Medical Professional Dedicated Home | 3R
summary: This is a shared traveling medical professionals, medical students, and post grad medical studies 4 bedroom home!  This apartment is in a newly restored Victorian house in the Fort Hill neighborhood of Boston. The house has a nice front terrace to sit out on to enjoy nice days and there are parking spaces available for rent (subj. to availability). There are four bedrooms organized in a co-living set-up, with a shared kitchen and living room. STRB provides bi-weekly common cleaning.
space: The kitchen is fully-equipped with appliances, including refrigerator, range with oven, microwave, pots/pans and cooking utensils. In the living room, there is a 40" flat screen Smart TV with cable and two comfortable sofas. The kitchen has a breakfast bar area that can seat six, as well as a large dining room table that can seat six. The available bedroom for rent is a private (locking) bedroom on the third floor. The bedroom features large closet space and several windows that provide fresh air and natural light. You will also have a desk and chair in your room for private work space. The bedroom is furnished with a queen size bed and dresser. You will share the kitchen, living room, and laundry room with 3 other roommates in the house.  This specific room - 3R - shares a bathroom with the other room on the third floor.  This rental unit is equipped with free wireless internet, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, tea kettle, toaster, microwave, linens and towels. Fully fur

This apartment is in a newly restored Victorian house in the Fort Hill neighborhood of Boston. The house has a nice front terrace to sit out on to enjoy nice days and there are parking spaces available for rent (subj. to availability). The bedroom features large closet space and several windows that provide fresh air and natura
neighborhood_overview: There is both on and off street resident parking at this location and the public T station is less than one block away (orange line). It is close to several Universities and the Longwood Medical Center. Resident parking requires a parking permit. There is limited parking in the driveway.  Must coordinate with other guests in the building.
notes: NA
transit: This home is located in the neighborhood of historic district in Boston. Fort Hill's name originates from the American Revolutionary War fortification built in the center of the district. It is a cozy corner of Boston and is filled with families and young professionals. The Fort Hill neighborhood is loaded with history, nearby public transit, and also is close to city bustle, but has a calm quiet charm to it.
access: We send out key codes 60 hours prior to your arrival and there will be a key in your bedroom unit door upon your arrival.
interaction: We require a 90 day minimum for traveling medical professionals, medical students, and post grad medical studies in this 4 bedroom home!. We would like to hear a little bit about your profession to make sure its a relevant fit! We grant you access to your unit by key codes and have hard locks for the doors. All building and unit doors are secure, the building is accessed using stairs (there is no elevator). IMPORTANT ITEM TO NOTE: Guest must return keys in unit door. If keys are not returned we will charge a $200 fee.
house_rules: - Being in the traveling medical professional field there is an etiquette involved with respecting others schedules!
host_about: Originally from Los Angeles, my wife and I have now been in Boston for 9 years.

name: Private room (rear, 1st floor) on top of Fort Hill
summary: This is a beautiful 1875 Brick townhouse with bay window on the very top of historic Fort Hill, overlooking the Boston Skyline. It is very close the the Longwood Medical Area and Museums. We are a 7-10 minute walk to the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line on Boston's MBTA transit system.
space: YOUR ROOM: This listing is for our guest room on the 1st floor, street side. 15X12 RM (180 SQ. FT.) FURNISHED TOWNHOUSE BEDROOM. The staircase to the second and third floor has a slight curve but it is manageable for any able-bodied person. The common areas are on the top (third) floor. Bedsheets and towels are provided. THE HOUSE: BRICK 1875 TOWNHOUSE: 4-story, owner-occupied, 4 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms. The room available here is only used as a guest room/short term rental. You are welcome to use either bathroom and there is a laundry machine/dryer in the bathroom on the 1st floor that you are welcome to use. The common areas are on the third floor with a great view and a fully equipped kitchen (e.g. dishwasher, microwave, oven etc.) and you are welcome to use the equipment and to store food in the fridge. HUGE LIVING ROOM: features piano, loft-like open space, kitchen, spectacular panorama of Boston skyline.

It is very close the the Longwood Medical Area and Museums. We are a 7-10 minute walk to the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line on Boston's MBTA transit system. The common areas are on the third floor with a great view and a fully equipped kitchen (e.g. dis
neighborhood_overview: WHERE: This is right at the juncture of Jamaica Plain, Mission Hill, and the South End - close to just about everything. At the very peak of elegant, chic FORT HILL on the juncture of Jamaica Plain/Mission Hill/Southwest Corridor, just South West of Boston's Back Bay. NEAR: MFA (museums), Hospitals in the Longwood Medical Area - Brigham& Women, Harvard Medical School, Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center, Harvard Children's Hospital, T.H. Chan School of Public Health, Dana Farber Cancer Center, B.U. Med, Mass Art, Mass Pharmacy, NEC, Northeastern, Brigham Circle, Cleary Square. GROCERIES: If you are looking for bigger supermarkets nearby, there are two Stop & Shops - one on Tremont Street (Closest T: Brigham Circle, Green line) and one on Center Street (Jackson Square, Orange line).
notes: ABOUT US: We (a heterosexual married couple, professional classical musician, bi-lingual English/Italian + German physician doing brain imaging research in Boston) are living on the second floor in 1 bedroom.  In total, we list three bedrooms in our house on AirBnB and frequently welcome researchers and physicians from all over the world who enjoy the coziness of our house and the convenient location not far from the Longwood Medical Area. Although we enjoy chatting with you in the kitchen when we meet, the house never seems to crowded - probably because we and our guests usually all have pretty busy schedules. We like our house as it is a peaceful, homey environment to help us relax after busy days at work our out in the city. The view from the bay window in the shared area/the roof top terrace is spectacular! We would be happy to welcome you as our guest! Please don't hesitate to email us in case you have some questions prior to your stay. We hope to provide you a cosy home-base to e
transit: GETTING THERE AND AROUND: 7-10 minutes walk down hill to Roxbury Crossing Orange Line Stop, and 66 Bus to Harvard Square. From Roxbury Crossing, it is a short ride to Boston Downtown and you can change easily change to the other major lines (e.g. Red Line at Downtown Crossing or Park Street to go to South Station or Harvard; Green Line at Park Street). Boston also has rental bikes (e.g. Hubway) and the Boston Bike corridor is located very close to our house. Our place is also an easy UBER ride from the airport (only 8 miles) - which might be a good idea especially when you are travelling with heavy luggage (We live on Fort HILL ;)). Alternatively, you could take the silver line(s) and then hop on the T to Roxbury Crossing.
access: Laundry, Bathroom, Kitchen - all common areas
interaction: The Boston/Cambridge area has a lot to offer and we are happy to give any advice you may need on where to go.
house_rules: 1. No outside guests beyond those on the reservation (neither during the day nor at night). 2. Quiet time after 10pm. 3. Please take off your shoes in the house. 4. Please don't leave dirty dishes in the sink - we have a great dishwasher. 5. When you are not home, please leave your door wide open so that everyone in the house knows who is home and who isn't.
host_about:
Hi, we are Kevin & Fran, a married multicultural couple (US/Italian + German).
Kevin is a professional classical musician (he doesn't practice at home) - you can learn more at Kevin's website - si parla Inglese e l'Italiano.
Kevin's wife Fran is a German physician.

As we are transferring to Munich by July 1, 2019, we have Nik and Alessia (two post-docs, they are a couple and will move into the 4th bedroom (which is currently ours) on Aug 23 and stay for at least a year) as our long-term renters and AirBnB "surrogate hosts". For the other available bedrooms, the renters have been international researchers/postdocs/physicians that are looking for a quiet place to wind down after busy days and we look forward to continuing this tradition as this was always a great fit. 
Our friend Kellie lives in Boston(West Roxbury) and will manage everything locally (e.g. if something is not working properly). Kevin is anticipating to come to Boston every couple of months. Kellie and Kevin will both monitor the AirBnB messages.

name: Spacious and Comfortable Urban Oasis
summary: Enjoy an affordable housing option in Boston! 4 comfortable bedrooms, 3 Queens, 1 twin 1 full bed!  This apartment can comfortably sleep 9 people in its 4 bedrooms, plus an air mattress and has a  fully equipped  kitchen, living and dining room for entertaining.  There is also an onsite (free) washer and dryer and internet access.
space: Conveniently located in the Historic Garrison trotter neighborhood of Boston,  with access to five bus lines into the city.  In the warmer months you can walk to Jackson Square and Stonybrook station in under 30 minutes.  Franklin Park is five minutes away, featuring walking trails, golfing and special events and concerts throughout the summer.  You are minutes from some of the best ethnic restaurants Boston has to offer, including the "best empanada," you'll ever eat!  We have a large backyard and porch for you to enjoy as well.

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very convenient to everything.   If you're driving, you are less that 10 minutes from I93 and I90.  We are within walking distance to five  bus lines, a major grocery store and a drugstore.  There are also several well-stocked convenience stores  i.e. "Bodegas" if you need something quick.   The neighborhood boasts some of Boston's largest and oldest homes.  The community is vibrant and very diverse.   Franklin Park is very close by and it heavily used by the surrounding neighborhoods..   There's  a very popular golf course, tennis and basketball courts available for public use. In the  summer months, there are concerts,  yoga and weekly line dancing classes!  The proximity to the park is one of my favorite aspects of this neighborhood.
notes: This is not a luxury property! It is an comfortable and affordable lodging option in the city of Boston.
transit: (Website hidden by Airbnb)  The apartment is within in a 5 minute walk to the following bus lines: # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) bus lines that will connect you to the Orange, Silver and Red Line trains.   The outbound #44 to Jackson Square is favored route to downtown.  In the warmer months Stonybrook, Jackson and Dudley Square are all within a 30 minute walk to the house.
access: Backyard and back porch
interaction: My sister, niece and I live upstairs.  We should be available during your stay to answer any questions you may have.   We can engage or not engage, we're completely flexible.
house_rules: NA
host_about: Hello, my name is Christie!  People describe me as; witty, smart and creative.  I have a big heart and laugh, which I'm told can be heard from a mile away.  I love to cook, travel and be social.  I am also very hard working.  Recently, I left my high pressure career at a prestigious University to become a Massage Therapist.   I practice Massage Therapy part time and also work for a local nonprofit, whose  mission is to help inner city businesses grow.  I am energized by people and I am looking forward to welcoming you to our home.

Forthill is a safe homebase for exploring Boston, attending a conference or previewing schools. Watch Hulu or Roku stream tv or just relax on the queen bed.  Place is 4 blocks to the Roxbury Crossing orange line metro.  Centrally located the apartment is a 10-15 min Uber ride to anywhere in Boston.

name: Cozy Penthouse 2 bedroom in the heart of the city
summary: Clean and Modern Two Bedroom Apartment on the top level of a beautiful Stone apartment building  with Free Wifi and close proximity to Downtown Boston. Public transportation right outside your front door step. Easy access to highway and Logan Airport.
space: My place is about a 7 minute uber or lyft ride to downtown boston. About a 20 minute ride from Boston Logan Airport. Central located near many of the colleges and universities. UMass Boston, Northeastern, Suffolk University , Boston Medical and more. There are three flights of stairs to climb please make sure you are walking up stairs before you book.
description: Clean and Modern Two Bedroom Apartment on the top level of a beautiful Stone apartment building  with Free Wifi and close proximity to Downtown Boston. Public transportation right outside your front door step. Easy access to highway and Logan Airport. My place is about a 7 minute uber or lyft ride to downtown boston. About a 20 minute ride from Boston Logan Airport. Central located near many of the colleges and universities. UMass Boston, Northeastern, Suffolk University , Boston Medical and more. There are three flights of stairs to climb please make sure you are walking up stairs before you book. Guess have accent to the third floor only and small balcony if they would like to smoke. If you are the lucky guest that is booked the weekend of July 15 you will be able to join and enjoy our community Cookout that we host ever year. Available for any questions by text (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) the 45 Bus runs right outside the front door steps , this will bring you to the nearby bus
neighborhood_overview: NA
notes: Parking On street parking on both sides of the street usually available . There is a free municipal parking lot next door to my place where you can park all day and overnight as well.
transit: the 45 Bus runs right outside the front door steps , this will bring you to the nearby bus station(Dudley Station) and the train station to Downtown Boston (Ruggles Station) for direct directions to anywhere go to (Website hidden by Airbnb) and you are able to get directions to your destination.

host_about:
Hello, 

My name is Robert Brown and I am the owner of BR Home Improvement Contractors. I have been a contractor for the last decade and I enjoy what I do. The KID IS GOOD LOL! Im usually working everyday, there always a project. I enjoy spending my free time partying and hanging out with Family. In the summer time you can catch me on the grill :)

house_rules: “Not too many rules, just the usual for your safety and well being.  You are however, expected to read the house rules for the listing, and abide by them, or you will render your booking under Airbnb terms, invalid.   Absolutely enjoy the space but please be respectful of the environment. NO EXTRA ADULT or children or visitors other than the ones mentioned in the booking. - Keep noise to a minimum after 10pm. - NO SMOKING  inside the home. Extra cleaning fees to remove odor and stains may be applied. - PLEASE WASH YOUR DISHES after use. I am a teacher, and a business man who loves to travel.  I travel a lot for pleasure and for work.  I love to learn about new cultures and meet new people.  I enjoy helping and being in service to others.  So please let me know how we can be of assistance and make your stay more enjoyable.
Many thanks

neighborhood_overview: Dudley Square in Roxbury is a historic and culturally vibrant neighborhood. A five-minute walk to Dudley Station, which is a major public transportation hub connecting you to the city. Steps from Hibernian Hall and local restaurants. One mile to the delicious restaurants of the South End, to the Museum of Fine Arts, to Wally's Jazz Cafe and Symphony Hall. One mile to Northeastern University, New England Conservatory, Hynes Convention Center, and the Seaport. Also close and accessible to Boston University, MIT, Harvard University, Wentworth, Simmons and to the major hospitals (Beth Israel Deaconness, Mass General, Brigham and Women's), Islamic Society of Boston.
notes: We look forward to welcoming you, but absolutely no parties, please.

Take the express Silver Line from the airport, or a short Uber/Lyft or drive and park in onsite garage.

host_about:
Paramount in my life is being happy; absolutely everything else is secondary-- it is a very fulfilling experience.

Hosting and meeting people from all over the world is amazing- it makes me happy also; it is incredible what technology has allowed us to achieve in this way, here it is actually bringing people together. Enjoy writing, photography, reading, research, traveling, sailing and diving and cycling.  Former restaurant owner.  Volunteer, supporting community efforts and local business. Environmentalist; currently working on a book(Peering into the Future).

summary: You will be sharing a 4 bd apt with 3 awesome young women, 2 friendly cats and a dog. The apartment is large it contains; a living room, bathroom, and a kitchen. There’s a gym, and a Marshalls for any extra needs.
space: You will have a comfy private bedroom with lots of beautiful windows to yourself. The bed is a queen sized memory foam mattress, and clean sheets will be provided.  We also have a sofa bed so the room can hold up to 4 guests comfortably, perfect for small travel groups! There is a TV with basic cable and we do have WiFi you can utilize.  You will also have access to the kitchen and appliances. Coffee, tea and snacks will be provided.  The bathroom is shared you will be able utilize the amenities provided for you. Please, if you feel the space is not clean enough for your standards definitely let us know. We take pride in providing a clean environment for our guests and would hate for our guests to feel uncomfortable. I also grow fresh herbs including; parsley, cilantro, basil and mint! If you’d like to make a mojito, spaghetti or tacos even please feel free to pick some fresh.

neighborhood_overview: My home is located in an urban neighborhood close enough to the city but far enough from any crazy city life. South Bay Mall is about a 10-15 min drive away if you’d like to shop a bit, or grab some food. Please note we are not IN the main city if you are looking to have a 5-10 minute walk to the main tourist attractions, our home is not for you. It will take you a good 15-60 min (depending on mode of transportation) to reach those attractions from our home.
notes: The three of us work full time, aside from the pets you will most likely have the space to yourself a majority of the time!
transit: I would recommend Uber/Lyft if you’re eager to see the city, but we have buses that can take you to Dudley station which will pretty much take you anywhere!
access: The house is pretty much open to your leisure, we have tons of open space if you’d like to do yoga or meditate in our spare open room you’re more than welcome! We have a full supplied kitchen, you are more than welcome to use our amenities to cook and store your food. All that we ask is that you treat our home like it was yours.
interaction: My roommates are fairly social if you have any questions ask them anything, however work schedules are pretty hectic so you might not see much of us in the first place. Any questions you have just shoot me a text/email!
house_rules: This home is very mi casa su casa style so if you happen to use the kitchen amenities please clean up after yourself. Other than that all I ask is to enjoy your stay and if you have any questions or concerns let me know!
host_about: Hi, I am a very outgoing person. I love to travel and see new things. Any suggestions and ideas you have please feel free to let me know, I appreciate your hospitality and kindness thank you!

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very convenient to everything.   If you're driving, you are less that 10 minutes from I93 and I90.  We are within walking distance to five  bus lines, a major grocery store and a drugstore.  There are also several well-stocked convenience stores  i.e. "Bodegas" if you need something quick.   The neighborhood boasts some of Boston's larges and oldest homes.  The community is vibrant and very diverse both socioeconomically and ethnically.   Franklin Park is very close by and it is heavily used by the surrounding neighborhoods..   There's  a very popular golf course, tennis and basketball courts available for public use. In the  summer months, there are concerts,  yoga and weekly line dancing classes!  The proximity to the park is one of my favorite aspects of this neighborhood.
notes: This is an older house with a kitschy feel. If you’re looking for luxury accommodation, don’t look here.  It’s spacious and comfortable with all of the basic needs covered. The neighborhood is in the inner city and residential. The nearest store or restaurant are a two blocks away.
transit: (Website hidden by Airbnb)  The apartment is within in a 5 minute walk to the following bus lines: # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) bus lines that will connect you to the Orange, Silver and Red Line trains.   The outbound #44 to Jackson Square is favored route to downtown.  In the warmer months Stonybrook, Jackson and Dudley Square are all within a 30 minute walk to the house.
access: Backyard and back porch.
interaction: My sister, niece and I live upstairs.  We should be available during your stay to answer any questions you may have.   We can engage or not engage, we're completely flexible.

host_about: Hello, my name is Christie!  People describe me as; witty, smart and creative.  I have a big heart and laugh, which I'm told can be heard from a mile away.  I love to cook, travel and be social.  I am also very hard working.  Recently, I left my high pressure career at a prestigious University to become a Massage Therapist.   I practice Massage Therapy part time and also work for a local nonprofit, whose  mission is to help inner city businesses grow.  I am energized by people and I am looking forward to welcoming you to our home.

summary: This is a shared traveling medical professionals, medical students, and post grad medical studies 4 bedroom home!  This apartment is in a newly restored Victorian house in the Fort Hill neighborhood of Boston. The house has a nice front terrace to sit out on to enjoy nice days and there are parking spaces available for rent (subj. to availability). There are four bedrooms organized in a co-living set-up, with a shared kitchen and living room. STRB provides bi-weekly common cleaning.
space: The kitchen is fully-equipped with appliances, including refrigerator, range with oven, microwave, pots/pans and cooking utensils. In the living room, there is a 40" flat screen Smart TV with cable and two comfortable sofas. The kitchen has a breakfast bar area that can seat six, as well as a large dining room table that can seat six. The available bedroom for rent is a private (locking) bedroom on the third floor. The bedroom features large closet space and several windows that provide fresh air and natural light. You will also have a desk and chair in your room for private work space. The bedroom is furnished with a queen size bed and dresser. You will share the kitchen, living room, and laundry room with 3 other roommates in the house.  This specific room - 3F - shares a bathroom with the other room on the third floor. The Fort Hill neighborhood is loaded with history, nearby public transit, and also is close to city bustle, but has a calm quiet charm to it.
access: We send out key codes 60 hours prior to your arrival and there will be a key in your bedroom unit door upon your arrival.
interaction: We require a 90 day minimum for traveling medical professionals, medical students, and post grad medical studies in this 4 bedroom home!. All building and unit doors are secure, the building is accessed using stairs (there is no elevator). IMPORTANT ITEM TO NOTE: Guest must return keys in unit door. If keys are not returned we will charge a $200 fee.

name: Fresh Studio Close to T - Superhost Manager!
summary: Freshly renovated first floor studio apartment with new floors, fresh surfaces everywhere, efficiency kitchen and bath.  Queen bed sleeps two, Ikea foldout couch has space for one more, or two snugglers.  7 min walk to T - just 3 stops from Back Bay, 6 to downtown!We live in the neighborhood and are usually available to answer any questions and dole out advice to the best of our knowledge. 20+ year residents now so we have a little bit of experience.
space: The kitchen has a two burner cooktop, microwave, toaster oven and coffee maker. The refrigerator is a below-the-counter variety. If you're looking to throw dinner parties or bake cakes, it's probably not what you're looking for. But if you need a basic, clean kitchen to prepare meals as an alternative to exploring the city's culinary scene, it's quite sufficient.

neighborhood_overview: It's pretty residential on the street, but places to eat and shop start showing up about 10 minutes away on foot.  You'll also be close to the T so you can get practically anywhere.  Jamaica Plain is right around the corner - a diverse assortment of restaurants can be found there, as well as a Whole Foods if you'd rather stay in and cook.  The renowned Sam Adams brewery is only 2 stops away by T.
notes: NA
transit: The T is a short walk away.  Street parking is available overnight and weekends right outside the house.  Parking during commuting hours is a 2-3 minute walk away.

name: Newly Renovated 1BR Close to T - Room for 4
summary: 1 BR apartment off of fresh renovation with room for 4.  Walk to T - 3 stops to Copley, 6 to downtown.
space: This is a second floor 1 BR apartment in a three-family brownstone.  Living room is the largest in the apartment with a long layout.  At one end is the "living area" with seating and at the other is a queen bed.  The bedroom is on the narrow side so we constructed custom loft bunks - perfect for the kids or friends looking for separate beds.  There is privacy between two sets of sleepers. Fresh surfaces throughout the entire apartment. Kitchen has electric range, MW, DW/disp, toaster and coffee maker. Cable TV and wireless internet are provided.

name: Traveling Medical Professional Dedicated Home | 2R
summary: This is a shared traveling medical professionals, medical students, and post grad medical studies home!  This apartment is in a newly restored Victorian house in the Fort Hill neighborhood of Boston. The house has a nice front terrace to sit out on to enjoy nice days and there are parking spaces available for rent. There are four bedrooms organized in a co-living set-up, with a shared kitchen and living room. This specific room has a private bathroom. STRB provides bi-weekly common cleaning.
space: The kitchen is fully-equipped with appliances, including refrigerator, range with oven, microwave, pots/pans and cooking utensils. In the living room, there is a 40" flat screen Smart TV with cable and two comfortable sofas. The kitchen has a breakfast bar area that can seat six, as well as a large dining room table that can seat six. The available bedroom for rent is a private (locking) bedroom on the third floor. The bedroom features large closet space and several windows that provide fresh air and natural light. You will also have a desk and chair in your room for private work space. The bedroom is furnished with a queen size bed and dresser. You will share the kitchen, living room, and laundry room with 3 other roommates in the house.  This specific room - 2R - has a private en-suite bathroom in the room.  This rental unit is equipped with free wireless internet, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, tea kettle, toaster, microwave, linens and towels. Fully furnished unit,

The bedroom features large closet space and several windows that provide fresh air a
neighborhood_overview: There is both on and off street resident parking at this location and the public T station is less than one block away (orange line). It is close to several Universities and the Longwood Medical Center. Resident parking requires a parking permit. There is limited parking in the driveway.  Must coordinate with other guests in the building.
notes: NA
transit: This home is located in the neighborhood of historic district in Boston. Fort Hill's name originates from the American Revolutionary War fortification built in the center of the district. It is a cozy corner of Boston and is filled with families and young professionals. The Fort Hill neighborhood is loaded with history, nearby public transit, and also is close to city bustle, but has a calm quiet charm to it.
access: We send out key codes 60 hours prior to your arrival and there will be a key in your bedroom unit door upon your arrival.
interaction: We require a 90 day minimum for traveling medical professionals, medical students, and post grad medical studies in this 4 bedroom home!. We would like to hear a little bit about your profession to make sure its a relevant fit! We grant you access to your unit by key codes and have hard locks for the doors. All building and unit doors are secure, the building is accessed using stairs (there is no elevator). IMPORTANT ITEM TO NOTE: Guest must return keys in unit door. If keys are not returned we will charge a $200 fee.
house_rules: - Being in the traveling medical professional field there is an etiquette involved with respecting others schedules!
host_about: Originally from Los Angeles, my wife and I have now been in Boston for 9 years.

space: We're an eclectic group of friends and fellow college/grad students mixed in with some AirBNB guests, all spread over five of the six floors in this building. Truly never a dull moment around here.
description: [Economy Listing] ONLY ONE of two beds in a FEMALE-ONLY, SHARED room.  -Friendly roommates with a cozy balcony and dining space. -Free, on-street parking. Convenient Transportation: 13-minute bus ride to the Ruggles Station [on the orange line]. Harvard, the airport, and downtown all less than 20min by car/Uber. Location: Search "Washington Park Mall" across the street: grocery store, convenience store, dollar store, bank, McDonald's, Walgreens, YMCA, etc. We're an eclectic group of friends and fellow college/grad students mixed in with some AirBNB guests, all spread over five of the six floors in this building. Truly never a dull moment around here. There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on the third floor as well, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the base
neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom,  and smoking only outside. Maintain Realistic Expectations: -We may talk late in the kitchen. -Your roommate is a stranger, and some people suck. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some heavily discolored spots, so no amount of cleaning will make it look sparkling clean. If you need to leave luggage before check-in or after checkout, grab a padlock with your room number (the combination is the same as your lockbox) and use the cabinets by the front door. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on FRIDAY MORNINGS, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on the third floor as well, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the basement. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. You are welcome to hang out and talk in the kitchen or on the balcony, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 12am. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes or weed on the balcony in the back, but NOT indoors or on the front porch!  ^ Penalty: $150 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $150 fine + 3x compensation + f
interaction: MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. /// BARGAINING POLICY: Please don't do it. I consider it disrespectful. I'm familiar with Boston's market prices and my own costs of operation, and I assure you my prices are rationally selected to provide a good value for your money. /// REFUND POLICY: -Want to shorten your stay?   * Send me an alteration request. I accept them all. Then all future days will be refunded in full. -Need to cancel before check-in?  * Full refund! I should still have time for another guest to book. -Choose to cancel after check-in?  * All future dates will be refunded in full.  * But the arrival date is NON-refundable (Website hidden by Airbnb) apologize in advance, but this is an economy listing and it is crucial that each space stably generates revenue every single night. -Your bed/space never cleaned? $
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 30+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Save or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Go to the balcony.) {$150 fine} -Don't take an eternity in the shower. -Keep the noise level reasonably low whenever people are trying to sleep. -Keep the common areas clean, particularly in the kitchen and BATHROOM. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -We may talk late in the kitchen. name: Egleston Square Studio (dog friendly)
summary: This 250 sqft studio with kitchenette is situated on the Jamaica Plain/Roxbury border. Close walk to the orange line, which will take you into the heart of Boston in 15 mins, as well as walking distance to all the restaurants and shops JP has to offer. There will be a designated parking spot and flexible check-in/check-out.  Note: you will be in a city, one that has diverse residents, people of color and people of various backgrounds, so please be mindful of this if you're not used to a city.
space: The space is a cozy 250 sqft suite complete with kitchenette and full bathroom. You’ll have a microwave, fridge, coffee machine, and kitchenware at your disposal. There is a desktop Mac through which you’ll be able to use my Hulu and Netflix accounts. You’ll have a full-size bed, wardrobe, armchairs and table.  Dogs are allowed as long as they won’t be left alone for longer than 4 hours. I can also supply a dog crate if your dog requires one. You will have access to the fenced in front yard as long as you clean up after your dog.  As this is a pet friendly listing, those who have severe dog allergies should not book. While my dog is hypo-allergenic, and the room will obviously be cleaned between each guest, I cannot promise a completely allergen-free room to those very sensitive to dogs. This is however a cat-free apt.   You will not have a private entrance so I ask that you are respectful to the other tenants when in the building’s common areas.
description: This 250 sqft studio with kitchenette is situated on the Jamaica Plain/Roxbury border. Close walk to the orange line, which will take you into the heart of Boston in 15 mins, as well as walking distance to all the restaurants and shops JP has to offer. Note: you will be in a city, one that has diverse residents, people of color and people of various backgrounds, so please be mindful of this if you're not used to a city. The space is a cozy 250 sqft suite complete with kitchenette and full bathroom. You’ll have a microwave, fridge, coffee machine, and kitchenware at your disposal. There is a desktop Mac through which you’ll be able to use my Hulu and Netflix accounts. You’ll have a full-size bed, wardrobe, armchairs and table.  Dogs are allowed as long as they won’t be left alone for longer than 4 hours. I can also supply a dog crate if your dog requires one. You will have access to the fenced in front yard as lon
neighborhood_overview: Egleston Square straddles Jamaica Plain and Roxbury, both vibrant, diverse, residential neighborhoods in the city of Boston. There are lots of great restaurants and shops within walking distance, as well as the Sam Adams brewery. Our quiet street is just off Washington,  which will take you directly into the city. We’re a 5 minute walk from Franklin Park, the largest park in Boston and great for runs or dog walks. We’re closest to the part where the old zoo used to be (the active zoo is a 10 minute walk further) and there’s abandoned bear enclosures from 1905 that are cool to explore.   I again want to remind all that you will be in a city that has diverse residents, people of color, and people of various backgrounds, so please be mindful of this and conduct yourself as such. If you equate a diverse neighborhood to an unsafe one, this is not the place for you, Boston may not be the city for you.
notes: NA
transit: The apartment is a 10 minute walk to the orange line, and one minute from various bus lines which will take to you the orange line station. Depending on traffic, it’s a 15-25 minute drive/uber into the center of Boston and 10-30 minutes to the airport. If you’re going into the city by public transport,  plan for 30 minutes total travel time (10 minutes walk to station, 5 minutes waiting for a train, 15 minutes on the train). Parking in the city will be difficult (especially the weekend of the marathon), so I would advise you either uber or take the T.
access: NA
interaction: I will not be in town and will have limited wifi access but will have a co-host on call to answer any questions that come up.
house_rules: - Cats are not allowed  - 420 friendly if you make sure to open the windows  - Dogs cannot be left alone for longer than 4 hours

name: 65 Beech Glen | Unit 1A | Private BR | Co-Living
summary: This is a completely re-built 4 bedroom home designed for Co-Living. All amenities, as well as utilities are included in rent. There are four bedrooms (each with a private lock), with a shared kitchen and living room. Short Term Rentals Boston provides bi-weekly common cleaning, and offers private room cleaning. Each unit is fully furnished with a Tuft & Needle Mattress, and a lock with a pin-pad.
space: The kitchen is fully-equipped with appliances, including refrigerator, range with oven, microwave, pots/pans and cooking utensils. In the living room, there is a 40" flat screen Smart TV with cable and two comfortable sofas. The kitchen has a breakfast bar area that can seat four, as well as a living room with a bistro table and seating for a group up to seven. The available bedroom for rent is a private (locking) bedroom. Each bedroom features closet space and several windows that provide fresh air and natural light. You will also have a desk and chair in your room for private work space. The bedroom is furnished with a queen size bed and dresser. You will share the kitchen, living room, and laundry room with 3 other roommates in the house.   This rental unit is equipped with free wireless internet, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, tea kettle, toaster, microwave, and a Tuft & Needle mattress. The unit is fully furnished and ready to move in.  STRB will provide bi-weekly

name: Relax in Roxbury! Out of the city but minutes away
summary: Hey there! Thanks for checking out my listing! My place is about 10 min from the city, easy Uber or train ride to Back Bay, Southie and more! It's listed low b/c you're sharing the space with me! Think of me as your own personal temp local!!! The place is stacked with huge TV, pool table, full kitchen and a FULL BAR!!! Easy street parking and plenty of room for people! Let me know what you have planned, I can be active or not in your Boston adventure!
space: Comfortable, smart home (Alexa, (Hidden by Airbnb) , firetv, ecobee themostat, live bar). It's right on the boarder of the city.
description: Hey there! Thanks for checking out my listing! My place is about 10 min from the city, easy Uber or train ride to Back Bay, Southie and more! It's listed low b/c you're sharing the space with me! Think of me as your own personal temp local!!! The place is stacked with huge TV, pool table, full kitchen and a FULL BAR!!! Easy street parking and plenty of room for people! Let me know what you have planned, I can be active or not in your Boston adventure! Comfortable, smart home (Alexa, (Hidden by Airbnb) , firetv, ecobee themostat, live bar). It's right on the boarder of the city. You get you're own room, plus the kitchen, bathroom, balcony and living room! Internet included, I've got cable, Netflix, Hulu and more! I'm pretty social, but I've got a lot going on! Let me know what your up to, I can show you around Boston or just let you be! Roxbury is a nice an upcoming part of Mass, it's literally right next to the city but it's not crazy busy or crowded! I've got a great view of the city
neighborhood_overview: Roxbury is a nice an upcoming part of Mass, it's literally right next to the city but it's not crazy busy or crowded! I've got a great view of the city from my balcony and roof!
notes: Bar Rules: I have a full bar in my place, I built it myself.... If you like to drink, u've come to the right listing. The bar is open, but if you drink from it, I expect you to replace it with the same or alternate beer/wine/liquor. It's the honor system, just replace what you consume.
transit: Uber or car is the best, but there's also a train station down the street. Scooters are all around in Brighton/Allston so you can download those apps to get around as well.
access: You get you're own room, plus the kitchen, bathroom, balcony and living room! Internet included, I've got cable, Netflix, Hulu and more!
