house_rules: Hey there, my place is your place while you're here! Treat it as if your staying at your friend's house for the weekend!
host_about: Hello, my name is Chris, graduated from Johnson & Wales University up in Providence, RI. Originally from NY but now I live in the middle of beautiful South Beach Miami!! Im 25 years old, and I work for Ritz-Carlton as a Food & Beverage Manager so I am well trained in hospitality at it's finest. I like to travel, fish, camp, cook & try everything new. I'm a very clean person, and I take great care of the places I live.

name: Clean, spacious and comfortable for 1 or 2 guests
summary: Minutes away from the city but surrounded by local businesses and restaurants, this is a beautiful traditional multi-family house that's been completely renovated- and well maintained since. Wood floors, marble countertops, simple design and decoration create a peaceful, accessible, and tidy place to relax, study, or use as a home base when touring Boston. With cable TV and WiFi, washer, dryer, and an equipped kitchen, you will feel right at home.
space: Thank you for considering a stay at 47 Julian! Located in the historic, friendly and diverse neighborhood of Dorchester, MA. The Room: The bedroom accommodates an individual or couple, and can be ideal for long term stays. Plenty of storage is available in the built-in closet plus a drawer. Outlets, a desk, chair, plenty of light, cable TV in the room, and WiFi throughout the condo, complete the space for any work or entertainment needs to be met. Early check in available if we have advance notice of the arrival time to schedule it.  The Common Areas: You're welcome to use the kitchen, living room, washer and dryer, and small back yard area shared by the house. Basic bathroom needs are provided as are linens and towels, there are also extra blankets and pillows. The kitchen has cups, mugs, bowls, plates, pans and utensils, a dish washer, fridge, microwave, blender and coffee machine. Cleaning is included in your stay but guests are asked to clean up after they use any common areas.  Th

neighborhood_overview: Located near Uphams Corner and Dudley Square, in Dorchester, the area is accessible through 4 different bus routes that can bring you to a T stop, like Ruggles or Roxbury Crossing (orange line). The stop for bus 45 is just at the end of Julian Street, a 3 minute walk. There is one parking spot available for guests on a first-come, first-served basis for one car only. Lyft and Uber service the area extremely well. Streets are well lit at night and safe to walk at any time of day. Dunkin' Donuts, Merengue Restaurante, Blue Hill House of Pizza, and three different supermarkets are in radius, Uber Eats delivers without problems.
notes: NA
transit: Guests can move around in public transportation. They can also drive and use the guest parking spot, use Lyft or Uber. For public transportation the best bus route to take is the #45. This bus route stops directly at the end of Julian Street, a 3 minute walk, and takes you to Ruggles Station, the orange line, which you can use to connect to any other “T” or subway/metro route. On the 45 bus route our stop is called “Blue Hill Ave @ Clifford Street.”
access: NA
interaction: Since this is a home we will interact from start to finish. We know the city like the back of our hand and can provide maps, suggestions, and knowledge to help you as you cruise around. Our work schedules may mean that we are not at home all the time (we're a doctor and a restauranteur in Boston) but we're still connected through text, call, or social media easily and reliably. Summer interns or students are highly welcome, as we'd like to get to know guests! The location is very accommodating for the specific budgets and time needs of summer programs (June, July, August).
house_rules: House Rules: *Check in is from 5pm to midnight  *Check out is by 11am  *Quiet hours for the entire building between 8pm to 5am *Shoes off apartment  *No smoking of any substance on the property *Cleaning included but guests are asked to pick up after themselves in common areas and kitchen *Friendly and respectful to all, and welcoming guests who are equally respectful of the home and neighbors who are of diverse backgrounds and ethnicities *No dishes left in the sink  *Guests may not have additional guests without confirmation  You must also acknowledge *The condo is on the second floor, with no elevator, and you must go up two flights of manageable stairs with a rest area in between *Security Deposit - if you damage the home, you may be charged up to $350 *Surveillance or recording devices on property - 24 hour video surveillance of the exterior of the building and common areas
host_about: Mexican American living in Boston and traveling all over.

name: Cozy & Convenient 1.52
summary: [Economy Listing] This is a PRIVATE ROOM with a SHARED BATHROOM. -Friendly roommates with a cozy balcony and dining space. -Free, on-street parking. Convenient Transportation: 13-minute bus ride to the Ruggles Station [on the orange line]. Harvard, the airport, and downtown all less than 20min by car/Uber. Location: Search "Washington Park Mall" across the street: grocery store, convenience store, dollar store, bank, McDonald's, Walgreens, YMCA, etc.
space: I am doing my best to provide a great value for my guests, offering not only an affordable place to crash for the evening, but also to furnish most every little thing travelers may find useful (e.g. painkillers, sleep aids, sunscreen, healthy snacks, etc.). I humbly ask that you please be quick in the restroom (as there is only one), use the ash trays and trash cans when you smoke on the balcony, do your dishes, and remain reasonably quiet whenever anyone is trying to sleep.

There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on each floor
neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom,  and smoking only outside. Maintain Realistic Expectations: -We may talk late in the kitchen. -Loud people won't quiet down unless you ask first. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some heavily discolored spots, so no amount of cleaning will make it look sparkling clean. If you need to leave luggage before check-in or after checkout, grab a padlock with your room number (the combination is the same as your lockbox) and use the cabinets by the front door. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on FRIDAY MORNINGS, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on each floor, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the basement. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. You are welcome to hang out and talk in the kitchen or on the balcony, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 12am. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes or weed on the balcony in the back, but NOT indoors or on the front porch!  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $100 fine + forced cancellation without a re
interaction: MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. /// BARGAINING POLICY: Please don't do it. I consider it disrespectful. I'm familiar with Boston's market prices and my own costs of operation, and I assure you my prices are rationally selected to provide a good value for your money. /// REFUND POLICY: -Want to shorten your stay?   * Send me an alteration request. I accept them all. Then all future days will be refunded in full. -Need to cancel before check-in?  * Full refund! I should still have time for another guest to book. -Choose to cancel after check-in?  * All future dates will be refunded in full.  * But the arrival date is NON-refundable (Website hidden by Airbnb) apologize in advance, but this is an economy listing and it is crucial that each space stably generates revenue every single night. -Your bed/space never cleaned? $
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 30+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Save or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -People are coming here to SLEEP, so be QUIET!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Just go to the front porch!) {$150 fine} -Don't take anyone's food for stuff. (That's stealing!) {$150 fine + 3x compensation} -Check out on time. (12pm!) {$15-$30 for the first hour; $50 for >1hr} -Keep the kitchen and bathroom CLEAN! -Don't take an eternity in the shower. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some hea

summary: Comfy room for rest.
space: Two single  beds. Desk and table lamp to do work. Spacious, clean and airy room. Closet for storage.
description: Comfy room for rest. Two single  beds. Desk and table lamp to do work. Spacious, clean and airy room. Closet for storage. Shared bathroom living room and kitchen. I am social, don’t be afraid to ask me anything if need be. For the most part I will give you your space and privacy. In the heart of Boston. Easy access to highways, downtown, new casino and malls. Great restaurants and nightlife if your into it. So much to offer just ask. South Bay mall, ymca, and grove hall close by. Car, bike, walk, taxi whatever is best for you 2 Corner stores walking distance. Public transportation accessible. YMCA up the st.

name: 139 Marcella | Unit 2B | Private BR | Co-Living
summary: This is a brand new apartment (Coming May 27th), designed for Co-Living. All amenities, as well as utilities are included in rent. There are four bedrooms (each with a private lock), with a shared kitchen and living room. Short Term Rentals Boston provides bi-weekly common cleaning, and offers private room cleaning. Each unit is fully furnished with a Tuft&Needle Mattress, and security is provided by Latch.
space: The kitchen is fully-equipped with appliances, including refrigerator, range with oven, microwave, pots/pans and cooking utensils. In the living room, there is a 40" flat screen Smart TV with cable and two comfortable sofas. The kitchen has a breakfast bar area that can seat four, as well as a living room with a bistro table and seating for a group up to seven. The available bedroom for rent is a private (locking) bedroom on either the first or second floor. Each bedroom features closet space and several windows that provide fresh air and natural light. You will also have a desk and chair in your room for private work space. The bedroom is furnished with a queen size bed and dresser. You will share the kitchen, living room, and laundry room with 3 other roommates in the house.   This rental unit is equipped with free wireless internet, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, tea kettle, toaster, microwave, and a Tuft & Needle mattress. If you would like further descriptions, please visit our website and view each listing. If you have additional questions, please contact Will (Email hidden by Airbnb)  What is included in your room rental? •	A fully furnished, lockable private bedroom. Not included - bed lines, towels and artwork/wall decorations (BYO!) •	Fully furnished common areas, including living rooms with smart TVs, shared bathrooms and fully-equipped kitchens. •	All utilities and internet. •	Bi-weekly cleanings (every other week) of common areas, and shared spaces. Bedroom cleanings are available upon request and for a fee. •	In-unit washer and dryer, free of charge. name: Perfect room for 1, short or long stay
summary: Minutes away from the city but surrounded by local businesses and restaurants, this is a beautiful traditional multi-family house that's been completely renovated- and well maintained since. Wood floors, marble countertops, simple design and decoration create a peaceful, accessible, and tidy place to relax, study, or use as a home base when touring Boston. With cable TV and WiFi, washer, dryer, and an equipped kitchen, you will feel right at home.
space: Thank you for considering a stay at 47 Julian! Located in the historic, friendly and diverse neighborhood of Dorchester, MA. The Room: The bedroom accommodates an individual only and can be ideal for long term stays.  Plenty of storage is available in the built-in closet. Outlets, a desk, chair, plenty of light, and WiFi throughout the condo, complete the space for any work or entertainment needs to be met. Cable TV is available in the living room. Early check in available if we have advance notice of the arrival time to schedule it.  The Common Areas: You're welcome to use the kitchen, living room, washer and dryer, and small back yard area shared by the house. Basic bathroom needs are provided as are linens and towels, there are also extra blankets and pillows. The kitchen has cups, mugs, bowls, plates, pans and utensils, a dish washer, fridge, microwave, blender and coffee machine. Cleaning is included in your stay but guests are asked to clean up after they use any common areas.  T
description: Minutes away from the city but surrounded by local businesses and restaurants, this is a beautiful traditional multi-family house that's been completely renovated- and well maintained since. Wood floors, marble countertops, simple design and decoration create a peaceful, accessible, and tidy place to relax, study, or use as a home base when touring Boston. With cable TV and WiFi, washer, dryer, and an equipped kitchen, you will feel right at home. Thank you for considering a stay at 47 Julian! Located in the historic, friendly and diverse neighborhood of Dorchester, MA. The Room: The bedroom accommodates an individual only and can be ideal for long term stays.  Plenty of storage is available in the built-in closet. Outlets, a desk, chair, plenty of light, and WiFi throughout the condo, complete the space for any work or entertainment needs to be met. Cable TV is available in the living room. Early check in available if we have advance notice of the arrival time to schedule it.  The Com
neighborhood_overview: Located near Uphams Corner and Dudley Square, in Dorchester, the area is accessible through 4 different bus routes that can bring you to a T stop, like Ruggles or Roxbury Crossing (orange line). The stop for bus 45 is just at the end of Julian Street, a 3 minute walk. There is one parking spot available for guests on a first-come, first-served basis for one car only. Lyft and Uber service the area extremely well. Streets are well lit at night and safe to walk at any time of day. Dunkin' Donuts, Merengue Restaurante, Blue Hill House of Pizza, and three different supermarkets are in radius, Uber Eats delivers without problems.
notes: NA
transit: Guests can move around in public transportation. They can also drive and use the guest parking spot, use Lyft or Uber. For public transportation the best bus route to take is the #45. This bus route stops directly at the end of Julian Street, a 3 minute walk, and takes you to Ruggles Station, the orange line, which you can use to connect to any other “T” or subway/metro route. On the 45 bus route our stop is called “Blue Hill Ave @ Clifford Street.”
access: NA
interaction: Since this is a home we will interact from start to finish. We know the city like the back of our hand and can provide maps, suggestions, and knowledge to help you as you cruise around. Our work schedules may mean that we are not at home all the time (we're a doctor and a restauranteur in Boston) but we're still connected through text, call, or social media easily and reliably. Summer interns or students are highly welcome, as we'd like to get to know guests! The location is very accommodating for the specific budgets and time needs of summer programs (June, July, August).
house_rules: House Rules: *Check in is from 5pm to midnight  *Check out is by 11am  *Quiet hours for the entire building between 8pm to 5am *Shoes off apartment  *No smoking of any substance on the property *Cleaning included but guests are asked to pick up after themselves in common areas and kitchen *Friendly and respectful to all, and welcoming guests who are equally respectful of the home and neighbors who are of diverse backgrounds and ethnicities *No dishes left in the sink  *Guests may not have additional guests without confirmation  You must also acknowledge *The condo is on the second floor, with no elevator, and you must go up two flights of manageable stairs with a rest area in between *Security Deposit - if you damage the home, you may be charged up to $350 *Surveillance or recording devices on property - 24 hour video surveillance of the exterior of the building and common areas
host_about: Mexican American living in Boston and traveling all over.

name: 139 Marcella | Unit 2C Private BR | Co-Living
summary: This is a brand new apartment (Coming May 27th), designed for Co-Living. All amenities, as well as utilities are included in rent. There are four bedrooms (each with a private lock), with a shared kitchen and living room. Short Term Rentals Boston provides bi-weekly common cleaning, and offers private room cleaning. Each unit is fully furnished with a Tuft&Needle Mattress, and security is provided by Latch.
space: The kitchen is fully-equipped with appliances, including refrigerator, range with oven, microwave, pots/pans and cooking utensils. In the living room, there is a 40" flat screen Smart TV with cable and two comfortable sofas. The kitchen has a breakfast bar area that can seat four, as well as a living room with a bistro table and seating for a group up to seven. The available bedroom for rent is a private (locking) bedroom on either the first or second floor. Each bedroom features closet space and several windows that provide fresh air and natural light. You will also have a desk and chair in your room for private work space. The bedroom is furnished with a queen size bed and dresser. You will share the kitchen, living room, and laundry room with 3 other roommates in the house.   This rental unit is equipped with free wireless internet, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, tea kettle, toaster, microwave, and a Tuft & Needle mattress. space: This spacious, light-filled, tastefully updated home on a cul-de-sac in Fort Hill is one of a kind. Private guest room with shared bath.  *Excellent Boston location, 5 minutes walk to train, 5 Minutes ride to Copley Plaza, the center of all Boston attractions.  *Room includes king size bed, coffee maker, Mini Fridge, Microwave and A/C.  *Wifi/Tv  *On street parking  *Perfect home away from home  *NO SMOKING  *Can accommodate up to 2 guests comfortably. *Initial housekeeping is including, Daily housekeeping upon request and is additional.

Uber/Lyft:  Uber and Lyft are dependable. Usually less than 4 or 5 minutes away. I don't recommend Taxi's Walk:  Boston is super walkable! 15 -20 minute walk to bars, restaurants, grocery stores, and colleges. 25-30 minute walk to Fenway, Longwood, Northeastern University, Museum of Fine Arts, South End, etc.

summary: Minutes away from the city but surrounded by local businesses and restaurants, this is a beautiful traditional multi-family house that's been completely renovated- and well maintained since. Wood floors, marble countertops, simple design and decoration create a peaceful, accessible, and tidy place to relax, study, or use as a home base when touring Boston. With cable TV and WiFi, washer, dryer, and an equipped kitchen, you will feel right at home.
space: Thank you for considering a stay at 47 Julian! Located in the historic, friendly and diverse neighborhood of Dorchester, MA. The Room: The bedroom accommodates a couple, and can be ideal for long term stays. Plenty of storage is available in the built-in closet plus drawers. Outlets, night stands, plenty of light, cable TV in the living room, and WiFi throughout the condo, complete the space for any work or entertainment needs to be met.  The Common Areas: You're welcome to use the kitchen, living room, washer and dryer, and small back yard area shared by the house. Basic bathroom needs are provided as are linens and towels, there are also extra blankets and pillows. The kitchen has cups, mugs, bowls, plates, pans and utensils, a dish washer, fridge, microwave, blender and coffee machine. neighborhood_overview: Located near Uphams Corner and Dudley Square, in Dorchester, the area is accessible through 4 different bus routes that can bring you to a T stop, like Ruggles or Roxbury Crossing (orange line). The stop for bus 45 is just at the end of Julian Street, a 3 minute walk. There is one parking spot available for guests on a first-come, first-served basis for one car only. Lyft and Uber service the area extremely well. Streets are well lit at night and safe to walk at any time of day. Dunkin' Donuts, Merengue Restaurante, Blue Hill House of Pizza, and three different supermarkets are in radius, Uber Eats delivers without problems.
notes: NA
transit: Guests can move around in public transportation. They can also drive and use the guest parking spot, use Lyft or Uber. For public transportation the best bus route to take is the #45. This bus route stops directly at the end of Julian Street, a 3 minute walk, and takes you to Ruggles Station, the orange line, which you can use to connect to any other “T” or subway/metro route. On the 45 bus route our stop is called “Blue Hill Ave @ Clifford Street.”
access: NA
interaction: Since this is a home we will interact from start to finish. We know the city like the back of our hand and can provide maps, suggestions, and knowledge to help you as you cruise around. Our work schedules may mean that we are not at home all the time (we're a doctor and a restauranteur in Boston) but we're still connected through text, call, or social media easily and reliably. Summer interns or students are highly welcome, as we'd like to get to know guests! The location is very accommodating for the specific budgets and time needs of summer programs (June, July, August).
house_rules: House Rules: *Check in is from 5pm to midnight  *Check out is by 11am  *Quiet hours for the entire building between 8pm to 5am *Shoes off apartment  *No smoking of any substance on the property *Cleaning included but guests are asked to pick up after themselves in common areas and kitchen *Friendly and respectful to all, and welcoming guests who are equally respectful of the home and neighbors who are of diverse backgrounds and ethnicities *No dishes left in the sink  *Guests may not have additional guests without confirmation  You must also acknowledge *The condo is on the second floor, with no elevator, and you must go up two flights of manageable stairs with a rest area in between *Security Deposit - if you damage the home, you may be charged up to $350 *Surveillance or recording devices on property - 24 hour video surveillance of the exterior of the building and common areas
host_about: Mexican American living in Boston and traveling all over.

name: *FEMALE ONLY* Shared Space 5.52L
summary: [Economy Listing] ONLY ONE of two beds in a FEMALE-ONLY, SHARED room.  -Friendly roommates with a cozy balcony and dining space. -Free, on-street parking. Convenient Transportation: 13-minute bus ride to the Ruggles Station [on the orange line]. Harvard, the airport, and downtown all less than 20min by car/Uber. Location: Search "Washington Park Mall" across the street: grocery store, convenience store, dollar store, bank, McDonald's, Walgreens, YMCA, etc.
space: We're an eclectic group of friends and fellow college/grad students mixed in with some AirBNB guests, all spread over five of the six floors in this building. Truly never a dull moment around here.
description: [Economy Listing] ONLY ONE of two beds in a FEMALE-ONLY, SHARED room.  -Friendly roommates with a cozy balcony and dining space. -Free, on-street parking. Convenient Transportation: 13-minute bus ride to the Ruggles Station [on the orange line]. Harvard, the airport, and downtown all less than 20min by car/Uber. Location: Search "Washington Park Mall" across the street: grocery store, convenience store, dollar store, bank, McDonald's, Walgreens, YMCA, etc. We're an eclectic group of friends and fellow college/grad students mixed in with some AirBNB guests, all spread over five of the six floors in this building. Truly never a dull moment around here. There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on the third floor as well, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the base
neighborhood_overview: The Roxbury-Dorchester area has historically been a high-crime area and, even though it has improved enough that I am willing to live and host here, I still want my guests to be aware that they should stay vigilant. If you're friendly and avoid being outside after nightfall (especially after most stores close at 8pm), things should be fine. If you suspect you'll feel uncomfortable, I would recommend that--for your peace of mind--you stay in some other part of town. I am leaving it up to my guests to decide for themselves if the risk is worth the thrifty price of the stay. With that said, the overwhelming majority of people are friendly, and I recommend relying on Uber/Lyft instead of public transit for reasons unrelated to safety. The peace of mind is a fringe benefit.
notes: Three Rules:  1) Please only contact me through AirBNB. (No emails or phone calls please.) 2) Use the Self-Checkin Instructions. (You shouldn't need help getting in.) -Save or print the information before coming. 3) Be considerate: quiet for sleep, quick in the bathroom, clean in the kitchen/bathroom,  and smoking only outside. Maintain Realistic Expectations: -We may talk late in the kitchen. -Your roommate is a stranger, and some people suck. -We clean every day, but our bath tub is old and has some heavily discolored spots, so no amount of cleaning will make it look sparkling clean. If you need to leave luggage before check-in or after checkout, grab a padlock with your room number (the combination is the same as your lockbox) and use the cabinets by the front door. If you will be coming in a car, please pay attention to where you park on THURSDAY NIGHT. The city cleans one side of the street on FRIDAY MORNINGS, so everyone has to be parked on the opposite side of the street. Follow
transit: If I don't cycle, I personally use UBER/LYFT to get everywhere. UBER/LYFT will save you time and stress, and sometimes even money. The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT. An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 2 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$8--i.e. the average shared Uber/Lyft ride. An Uber X or private Lyft to Downtown Crossing only costs $8-$15 at off-peak times.  ^ At $2/ride, getting 4 people anywhere on public transit usually costs ~$16--i.e. significantly more than the cost of a private Lyft or Uber X. Unfortunately, UBER/LYFT charge a premium from the airport, so that'll run you ~$20. Even as someone who's pretty ridiculously frugal himself, I have to
access: There is a shared bathroom with a toilet and shower on the third floor as well, so you can walk to another if it is taken. The kitchen is stocked for cooking and supplied with tea and coffee on each floor. There are some lockable luggage cabinets by the front door. Detergent is provided for doing laundry in the washer and dryer in the basement. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are supplied in the shower; each bed comes with sheets, a comforter, two pillows, and a bath towel. You are welcome to hang out and talk in the kitchen or on the balcony, but be QUIET after 10pm and SILENT after 12am. This place is first and foremost a place to SLEEP.  ^ Penalty: warning or forced cancellation You are welcome to smoke cigarettes or weed on the balcony in the back, but NOT indoors or on the front porch!  ^ Penalty: $150 fine + forced cancellation You are welcome to use the fridge, but NOT eat from the fridge. Do I really have to tell you not to steal?  ^ Penalty: $150 fine + 3x compensation + f
interaction: MISSION: To help decrease prejudice/xenophobia while providing some of Boston’s most affordable short-term accommodation during the summer and most affordable long-term housing during the academic year. /// BARGAINING POLICY: Please don't do it. I consider it disrespectful. I'm familiar with Boston's market prices and my own costs of operation, and I assure you my prices are rationally selected to provide a good value for your money. /// REFUND POLICY: -Want to shorten your stay?   * Send me an alteration request. I accept them all. Then all future days will be refunded in full. -Need to cancel before check-in?  * Full refund! I should still have time for another guest to book. -Choose to cancel after check-in?  * All future dates will be refunded in full.  * But the arrival date is NON-refundable (Website hidden by Airbnb) apologize in advance, but this is an economy listing and it is crucial that each space stably generates revenue every single night. -Your bed/space never cleaned? $
house_rules: 1) Please ONLY contact me through AirBNB! Since I am managing 30+ listings, the constant barrage of phone calls can be highly disruptive to my personal and professional life, so please only contact me through AirBNB. (Do not send emails, or call me, or text me through other apps.) This allows me to prioritize those messages which are most urgent and have my friends/cohosts cover me whenever I'm busy or need a break. 2) You NEED to use "The Self-Checkin Guide." -Save or print the information from your email before coming. 3) Come on! Be CONSIDERATE!!! -Don't smoke inside. (Go to the balcony.) {$150 fine} -Don't take an eternity in the shower. -Keep the noise level reasonably low whenever people are trying to sleep. -Keep the common areas clean, particularly in the kitchen and BATHROOM. 4) Maintain Realistic Expectations. -We may talk late in the kitchen.
